caption: Whenever we go out to dinner or especially when we go to see family, my father asks me, “Are you going to put some makeup on?”
quote: Whenever we go out to dinner or especially when we go to see family, my father asks me, “Are you going to put some makeup on?”

caption: In a class talking about men lifting large rocks, a girl says something about women being able to lift them, too. She looks around at all the men around her and quickly says, “Haha, I’m just kidding, I’m like as far from a feminist as you can be.”
quote: In a class talking about men lifting large rocks, a girl says something about women being able to lift them, too. She looks around at all the men around her and quickly says, “Haha, I’m just kidding, I’m like as far from a feminist as you can be.”

caption: I’m renewing my discount card at a video game store, and the clerk suggests I give the extra card to my husband to earn more points. I’m a 29 year-old black bi woman gamer, and so is my partner. Guess we don’t get points.
quote: I’m renewing my discount card at a video game store, and the clerk suggests I give the extra card to my husband to earn more points. I’m a 29 year-old black bi woman gamer, and so is my partner. Guess we don’t get points.

caption: Man outside of a club referring to the length of my skirt.
quote: “Oh, that chick is asking for it.”
actual_quote: Oh, that chick is asking for it.

caption: “The Bridge Poem” by Donna Kate Ruskin
quote: An allied poem we like!

caption: “When filling out a form at a dermatologist’s office, I am prompted to select which “high-risk group” I belong to. Possible options: gay, lesbian, bisexual.If they are really concerned about possible sexually transmitted diseases (STD), where are the questions about high-risk behaviors such as frequent unprotected sex with multiple partners? Aren’t straight people just as likely to be “at risk” for STDs?
quote:
“When filling out a form at a dermatologist’s office, I am prompted to select which “high-risk group” I belong to. Possible options: gay, lesbian, bisexual.If they are really concerned about possible sexually transmitted diseases (STD), where are the questions about high-risk behaviors such as frequent unprotected sex with multiple partners? Aren’t straight people just as likely to be “at risk” for STDs?
I am a 22 year old lesbian who is not out to her family. The only other people in the waiting room were senior citizens. Made me feel shocked, helpless, marginalized and invaded of my privacy. I also felt deeply ashamed, especially as I ended up checking off the box saying that I did not belong to any of those categories.

caption: An everyday question - it’s rare to hear someone asked “Why are you Christian?” or “Why are you Jewish?” but it’s common for atheists to be asked to explain or justify their beliefs.
quote: “WHY are you Atheist?”
actual_quote: WHY are you Atheist?

caption: When I was seven years old, I was at a sleepover and the only Indian girl there.  While I was changing in the closet (because I was too uncomfortable changing in front of all the other girls), I overheard the girl who invited us telling all the other girls not to take a bath with me, or else all of my darkness would come off of me and get onto them.  As if my skin color was some disease.  As if I was some disease.  It’s been 14 years since that incident, and my eyes still sting every time I think about it.
quote: When I was seven years old, I was at a sleepover and the only Indian girl there.  While I was changing in the closet (because I was too uncomfortable changing in front of all the other girls), I overheard the girl who invited us telling all the other girls not to take a bath with me, or else all of my darkness would come off of me and get onto them.  As if my skin color was some disease.  As if I was some disease.  It’s been 14 years since that incident, and my eyes still sting every time I think about it.

caption: Male classmate, at school, yesterday. Apparently it’s okay to feel sorry for women, as long as they don’t try to gain equal rights or anything. Made me feel angry and powerless.
quote: “I have lots of sympathy for women, but I have no sympathy for feminists.”
actual_quote: I have lots of sympathy for women, but I have no sympathy for feminists.

caption: Liberal straight white friend, speculating aloud to my queer partner and me whether having to stay closeted in the military really makes much different to a queer person. He also spent a good amount of time explaining to us that Don’t Ask Don’t Tell had been repealed, and that this is a good thing for “homosexuals.”
quote: “But is it really that big a deal?”
actual_quote: But is it really that big a deal?

caption: On one of the first days of sixth grade in my new school when two girls corner me and start asking me, “Are you a lesbian?” over and over again, pronouncing the word “lesbian” in the dirtiest way they could imagine and shaking their hips. I said “yes” just so that they would go away.
quote: On one of the first days of sixth grade in my new school when two girls corner me and start asking me, “Are you a lesbian?” over and over again, pronouncing the word “lesbian” in the dirtiest way they could imagine and shaking their hips. I said “yes” just so that they would go away.

caption: While hugging my friend and braiding her hair (also a girl) while waiting for our bus number to be called, a boy in our class looks at us and starts singing, “Why are you gay?” to the tune of “YMCA”.
quote: While hugging my friend and braiding her hair (also a girl) while waiting for our bus number to be called, a boy in our class looks at us and starts singing, “Why are you gay?” to the tune of “YMCA”.

caption: In bed with my partner, after I told her the details of why I wanted to run a marathon, as if I had to be defective in some way to date her.
quote: “Well, don’t lose too much weight, or else you’ll be way out of my league!”
actual_quote: Well, don’t lose too much weight, or else you’ll be way out of my league!

caption: I’m on the light-rail, it’s gotten incredibly crowded, standing room only. I look up from my book and realize that there is a single seat available -  between me, a cross-dressing male, and a middle-aged black man, who’s the only non-white person in the car. I wonder whether all the people standing, packed shoulder to shoulder, were more racist or more transphobic, and which of us needed to be replaced by a cis white person to get the seat filled.
quote: I’m on the light-rail, it’s gotten incredibly crowded, standing room only. I look up from my book and realize that there is a single seat available -  between me, a cross-dressing male, and a middle-aged black man, who’s the only non-white person in the car. I wonder whether all the people standing, packed shoulder to shoulder, were more racist or more transphobic, and which of us needed to be replaced by a cis white person to get the seat filled.

caption: White male lawyer, “responding” to my politely angry sister’s question about our condo association’s roofing contract. This lawyer had had no problem answering the question posed by an angry man minutes before, of course.
quote: “I don’t think I like your tone of voice.”
actual_quote: I don’t think I like your tone of voice.

caption: When I handed in my class work in a simple folder instead of a proper art portfolio, my art professor harped on it for a good 5-10 minutes instead of grading my work, praising other students’ professionally made portfolios. I couldn’t get a proper portfolio because I spent all my money on other materials for his class. "Even that cardboard box is better than this,“ he said, referring to the box from recycled materials that another low income student made to hand in her work. He then glossed over the drawings and moved on to the next student.
quote: When I handed in my class work in a simple folder instead of a proper art portfolio, my art professor harped on it for a good 5-10 minutes instead of grading my work, praising other students’ professionally made portfolios. I couldn’t get a proper portfolio because I spent all my money on other materials for his class. "Even that cardboard box is better than this,“ he said, referring to the box from recycled materials that another low income student made to hand in her work. He then glossed over the drawings and moved on to the next student.

caption: Friend, after I answered some classmates’ questions about my disability.
quote: “You’ve been kind of hogging the spotlight.”
actual_quote: You’ve been kind of hogging the spotlight.

caption: I was walking down the street hand-in-hand with my girlfriend. An unknown woman stopped in front of us and snapped, “You’re excused!”
quote: I was walking down the street hand-in-hand with my girlfriend. An unknown woman stopped in front of us and snapped, “You’re excused!”

caption: White female neighbour and family friend to my mom and dad. She had come over for a visit, and didn’t know that we had remodeled our home and gotten new stainless-steel appliances. We’re a black Canadian family and my parents have been working here for over 25 years.
quote: “Did you guys win the lottery or something? Living the high life!”
actual_quote: Did you guys win the lottery or something? Living the high life!

caption: When I was growing up, I was not allowed to take cooking classes. My sister, however, was in cooking classes for over eight years. My mom told me I would meet a nice woman when I grew up to cook and clean for me. Today, I am a 25 year-old gay man, currently teaching myself to cook. Makes me feel hungry.
quote: When I was growing up, I was not allowed to take cooking classes. My sister, however, was in cooking classes for over eight years. My mom told me I would meet a nice woman when I grew up to cook and clean for me. Today, I am a 25 year-old gay man, currently teaching myself to cook. Makes me feel hungry.

caption: At work today I saw Elton John and his parter on the cover of some magazine. I saw their new baby and said, “Aww what a cute baby!" My co-worker said, "Poor baby, I feel sorry for him.”
quote:
At work today I saw Elton John and his parter on the cover of some magazine. I saw their new baby and said, “Aww what a cute baby!" My co-worker said, "Poor baby, I feel sorry for him.”
I asked her why and she responded with how it’s just not right.  My response was that there is nothing wrong with it and I know some same sex couples who have raised wonderful children.
She ignored me.

caption: Boyfriend, 20, texting me after I explained my tendonitis.
quote: “Ya, but it’s not like a real disability.”
actual_quote: Ya, but it’s not like a real disability.

caption: An acquaintance after he said, “That’s so gay!” It’s not okay.
quote: “It’s okay, I have gay friends.”
actual_quote: It’s okay, I have gay friends.

caption: Questions to my tomboy-femme partner and I about our family. We are a lesbian couple in Buffalo, NY and this happens every time we go out.
quote:
Questions to my tomboy-femme partner and I about our family. We are a lesbian couple in Buffalo, NY and this happens every time we go out.
“So… which one had the baby?” “How did that happen?” “You look like teenagers yourselves, how could you afford to get a donor?” “Where is her dad now?” “Are both of you the mom or…?” “Don’t you think that’s unfair to the baby?” “Do you think she’ll grow up gay too?” “I just don’t get it… (to me) You’re the girly one!”
They would never ask how the baby was conceived if we were a straight couple.

caption: My academic adviser in college
quote: “You don’t want to be a professor; you want to have kids.”
actual_quote: You don’t want to be a professor; you want to have kids.

caption: My mother to me. She doesn’t know I’m bi and now I know for certain I can never come out. Made me sad and angry, like there is something wrong with me.
quote: “I don’t understand bisexuals. Why can’t they just pick a side?”
actual_quote: I don’t understand bisexuals. Why can’t they just pick a side?

caption: John McCain, in response to an audience question on whether Barack Obama was Arab.
quote: “No, ma'am. He’s a decent family man, citizen that I just happen to have disagreements with on fundamental issues and that’s what this campaign’s all about. He’s not [an Arab].”
actual_quote: No, ma'am. He’s a decent family man, citizen that I just happen to have disagreements with on fundamental issues and that’s what this campaign’s all about. He’s not [an Arab].

caption: A male classmate (15 years old) during class after a discussion of LGBT rights.
quote: “I don’t hate them, just keep them away from me.”
actual_quote: I don’t hate them, just keep them away from me.

caption: New York Times review of New York City Ballet’s Nutcracker production last winter.
quote: “Jennifer Ringer, as the Sugar Plum Fairy, looked as if she’d eaten one sugar plum too many.”
actual_quote: Jennifer Ringer, as the Sugar Plum Fairy, looked as if she’d eaten one sugar plum too many.

caption: College thesis discussion about Arizona’s immigration law and its ethical implications.
quote: “I don’t wear Colombian Pride bracelets or drape Colombian flags over myself. You know, I have mostly white friends, and it’s not like I’m gonna wear hoop earrings and show my ass off by wearing tight jeans. I’m not gonna ask for it [to be racially profiled.]”
actual_quote: I don’t wear Colombian Pride bracelets or drape Colombian flags over myself. You know, I have mostly white friends, and it’s not like I’m gonna wear hoop earrings and show my ass off by wearing tight jeans. I’m not gonna ask for it [to be racially profiled.]

caption: A boy I was talking to, who knew I was a questioning woman. Made me feel angry, bitter, defensive, objectified.
quote: “Lesbians and bi girls are different. Yeah, I guess it’s kind of because they’re hot.”
actual_quote: Lesbians and bi girls are different. Yeah, I guess it’s kind of because they’re hot.

caption: While telling a well-known writer my positive but conflicted feelings about his speech, he converses but is rather brusque and when someone he knows comes by he PATS ME ON THE HEAD and starts talking to her instead. I am a 5 foot tall woman and was humiliated.
quote: While telling a well-known writer my positive but conflicted feelings about his speech, he converses but is rather brusque and when someone he knows comes by he PATS ME ON THE HEAD and starts talking to her instead. I am a 5 foot tall woman and was humiliated.

caption: In written correspondence, my husband’s family likes to call me Mrs. HisLastName and refer to our fetus as Baby HisLastName.  They should know by now that I didn’t change my name, and will soon find out that our baby will have both our names.  I know that the patriarchal naming traditions here don’t make things easy, but they don’t have to shove it in my face by intentionally getting my name wrong repeatedly. I feel like they don’t respect me.
quote: In written correspondence, my husband’s family likes to call me Mrs. HisLastName and refer to our fetus as Baby HisLastName.  They should know by now that I didn’t change my name, and will soon find out that our baby will have both our names.  I know that the patriarchal naming traditions here don’t make things easy, but they don’t have to shove it in my face by intentionally getting my name wrong repeatedly. I feel like they don’t respect me.

caption: My family for the past 36 years.
quote: “Why can’t you act like a normal person? You don’t have Asperger’s. There’s nothing wrong with you. You’re just looking for attention/excuses.  If you’d just stop behaving so oddly, you wouldn’t need to blame it on a disease.”
actual_quote: Why can’t you act like a normal person? You don’t have Asperger’s. There’s nothing wrong with you. You’re just looking for attention/excuses.  If you’d just stop behaving so oddly, you wouldn’t need to blame it on a disease.

caption: On the train, two girls in the seats opposite ours whispering about my girlfriend and me: “Oh, look how cute, lesbians!”
quote:
On the train, two girls in the seats opposite ours whispering about my girlfriend and me: “Oh, look how cute, lesbians!”
Made me feel angry at being talked about like a cute little animal, angry at feeling that I should be “thankful” for the “positive” response to our sexuality.

caption: When I asked my partner’s sister to please stop using “gay” as a way to insult people or say that something is bad, she replied “Lighten up, I have gay friends too.”
quote: When I asked my partner’s sister to please stop using “gay” as a way to insult people or say that something is bad, she replied “Lighten up, I have gay friends too.”

caption: I travel frequently as part of my job coordinating a nationwide program. On a recent flight, the flight attendant offered beverages to every other person within my earshot by saying, “To drink, Ma'am?” or “to drink, sir?” When she got to me, she asked, “To drink, baby girl?”
quote:
I travel frequently as part of my job coordinating a nationwide program. On a recent flight, the flight attendant offered beverages to every other person within my earshot by saying, “To drink, Ma'am?” or “to drink, sir?” When she got to me, she asked, “To drink, baby girl?”
I am forty-ish and was dressed in business attire.  There is little doubt that my blindness was the reason. Made me feel condescended to, infantilized, not taken seriously, pitied, singled out.

caption: Having to constantly think of how my actions are perceived to others to make sure I seem as non-threatening as I possibly can be. No raising my voice, always pleasant, and acting as if I have to be the ambassador for people of color just because your perception of us is rife with horrible generalizations. All of this so I can actually get my foot in the door anywhere I go. Makes me feel TIRED.
quote: Having to constantly think of how my actions are perceived to others to make sure I seem as non-threatening as I possibly can be. No raising my voice, always pleasant, and acting as if I have to be the ambassador for people of color just because your perception of us is rife with horrible generalizations. All of this so I can actually get my foot in the door anywhere I go. Makes me feel TIRED.

caption: A friend, after I scoffed at a white man on the radio saying that people of colour just need to learn to relax.
quote: “The people I feel most sorry for in America are white men. They can’t do or say ANYTHING without someone getting upset.”
actual_quote: The people I feel most sorry for in America are white men. They can’t do or say ANYTHING without someone getting upset.

caption: A friend after I mentioned that I never got the hang of AP Calculus in high school and didn’t pass the exams.
quote: “What? But you’re Asian, you’re supposed to be smart!”
actual_quote: What? But you’re Asian, you’re supposed to be smart!

caption: My boyfriend’s best friend about his Christmas gift to me, a Bath & Body Works set of Japanese Cherry Blossom-fragranced items. I was defensive, shocked, confused, invisible as a person who has many interesting qualities besides my ethnicity.
quote: “If you don’t like it, you can return it. I just knew that they had a Japanese-type scent and thought of you.”
actual_quote: If you don’t like it, you can return it. I just knew that they had a Japanese-type scent and thought of you.

caption: I’m 20 and mostly interact with other university-age students, but I get this from employers and other people too. This is overwhelming and irritating. If I want to explain the cane, I will. It’s not any of their business.
quote: “Oh my god, you’re using a cane! What happened?!?”
actual_quote: Oh my god, you’re using a cane! What happened?!?

caption: My friends keep implying that I’m a moocher because I have to wait until payday to pay them back for food/booze/etc. Sorry I’m living paycheck to paycheck. I always pay them back. In college and makes me feel poor, misunderstood.
quote: My friends keep implying that I’m a moocher because I have to wait until payday to pay them back for food/booze/etc. Sorry I’m living paycheck to paycheck. I always pay them back. In college and makes me feel poor, misunderstood.

caption: My boss, in response to me saying that sometimes I don’t approach him directly when there’s a conflict at work because I feel like, as a woman, I’m not taken seriously.
quote: “Don’t be afraid to be direct with me. I have nothing against strong, independent women. On the contrary, I find them attractive.”
actual_quote: Don’t be afraid to be direct with me. I have nothing against strong, independent women. On the contrary, I find them attractive.

caption: Read in February 2011 Cosmopolitan magazine. Disgusted that American society claims to be “post-racist” and yet can’t even acknowledge that my hair is attractive.
quote: “Bounce, shine, and softness are the key to sexy hair.”
actual_quote: Bounce, shine, and softness are the key to sexy hair.

caption: My white aunt while touching my afro. I was 17 at home.
quote: “I feel so bad for you. Your hair will always look like a bad perm.”
actual_quote: I feel so bad for you. Your hair will always look like a bad perm.

caption: Police officer about a woman who lived with an abusive partner.
quote: “Well, her boyfriend’s all over our records. If she got involved with him in the first place, she got what was coming to her.”
actual_quote: Well, her boyfriend’s all over our records. If she got involved with him in the first place, she got what was coming to her.

caption: A white boy in history, after our teacher told us about Native American history and explained the racism of pioneers.
quote: “Eh, but that’s not even racist.”
actual_quote: Eh, but that’s not even racist.

caption: Social studies classmate discussing the plight of various Native/First Nations/Inuit reserves in Canada and how our government deals with it.
quote: “They (Native people) need to stop being so difficult and complaining! They already get so much from our tax money, what more do they want?”
actual_quote: They (Native people) need to stop being so difficult and complaining! They already get so much from our tax money, what more do they want?

caption: My lesbian coworker to me after piping up in a conversation about sexuality that I was bi.
quote: “Oh, I would never date a bisexual. I’d always worry they would cheat on me with a guy. Plus, they aren’t seriously gay, they are just pretending to be because it’s ‘hip.’”
actual_quote: Oh, I would never date a bisexual. I’d always worry they would cheat on me with a guy. Plus, they aren’t seriously gay, they are just pretending to be because it’s ‘hip.’

caption: This is a flat out aggression. Published by Psychology Today, written by a Japanese man.
quote: This is a flat out aggression. Published by Psychology Today, written by a Japanese man.

caption: Said by a 44 yr old white woman to my sister, who is Latina. She was seated with my white brother in law. My sister knew she couldn’t speak up because no one would believe her hurt or sadness.
quote: “I know my girls were raised sheltered and only around white people, and if I had to do it again, I would.”
actual_quote: I know my girls were raised sheltered and only around white people, and if I had to do it again, I would.

caption: Said by a 44 yr old white woman to my sister, who is Latina. She was seated with my white brother in law. My sister knew she couldn’t speak up because no one would believe her hurt or sadness.
quote: “I know my girls were raised sheltered and only around white people, and if I had to do it again, I would.”
actual_quote: I know my girls were raised sheltered and only around white people, and if I had to do it again, I would.

caption: My white mom, after asking me what my white boss’ black husband did for a living.
quote: “Well, at least he’s not a laborer.”
actual_quote: Well, at least he’s not a laborer.

caption: My now-ex, during the time when we were breaking up and I was considering getting a teaching degree. Made me feel belittled.
quote: “You can’t be a high school teacher. You’re too pretty, so the boys won’t respect you.”
actual_quote: You can’t be a high school teacher. You’re too pretty, so the boys won’t respect you.

caption: As justification for a lack of characters of color in a online discussion of American Girl. Apparently people of other races and ethnicities only show up when needed in American history. Made me feel irritated, ignored, marginalized.
quote: “America has a white majority, and a far larger one in most of the country’s past, so why wouldn’t the American Girls [dolls] have one as well?”
actual_quote: America has a white majority, and a far larger one in most of the country’s past, so why wouldn’t the American Girls [dolls] have one as well?

caption: My friend emails me excitedly; she’s met this girl she wants to hook me up with, we’re soulmates. A little prodding reveals that we have nothing in common - the only reason she thinks we’d be perfect for each other is because we’re the only two lesbians she knows.
quote: My friend emails me excitedly; she’s met this girl she wants to hook me up with, we’re soulmates. A little prodding reveals that we have nothing in common - the only reason she thinks we’d be perfect for each other is because we’re the only two lesbians she knows.

caption: When I am six, my aunt only allows my sisters to play with her dolls. When I am fourteen my mother sends me outside to work with my father, leaving my little sister to take care of the babies. Now people question whether my partner and I can raise children - and I am secretly afraid that I don’t know enough.
quote: When I am six, my aunt only allows my sisters to play with her dolls. When I am fourteen my mother sends me outside to work with my father, leaving my little sister to take care of the babies. Now people question whether my partner and I can raise children - and I am secretly afraid that I don’t know enough.

caption: Every day in class & I don’t have a car. Makes me feel annoyed, poor, angry.
quote: “Where are you parked?”
actual_quote: Where are you parked?

caption: A group of drunk white boys called out to me, my sister and friends. Apparently, black girls aren’t pretty. Outside a local restaurant in Savannah & it made me feel angry, offended, upset, annoyed.
quote: “Y'all are pretty for some black girls!”
actual_quote: Y'all are pretty for some black girls!

caption: Older relative speaking about a member of our family who is bi-racial: "She’s so pretty she could pass for white.“ and "Just so you know, she’s not illegitimate, she’s adopted.”
quote: Older relative speaking about a member of our family who is bi-racial: "She’s so pretty she could pass for white.“ and "Just so you know, she’s not illegitimate, she’s adopted.”

caption: I was born with only one hand… and I get stuff like this all the time!
quote: “How is your recovery going?”
actual_quote: How is your recovery going?

caption: Friend’s response to me experiencing something along the lines of this microaggression.
quote: “You realise she was complimenting you, right? You get offended too easily.”
actual_quote: You realise she was complimenting you, right? You get offended too easily.

caption: Many people when they find out my boyfriend is Chinese.
quote: “So, is it true what they say about Asians?”
actual_quote: So, is it true what they say about Asians?

caption: Always meant as a compliment, from adolescence through adulthood, whenever someone meets me in person having known my race, name, or background before.
quote: “You’re not what I expected.”
actual_quote: You’re not what I expected.

caption: My art school teacher requested we work on a canvas of 7ft x 6ft. I live over an hour away from campus, have to take public transportation, know no one with a car, and my home is not large enough for the canvas. Even though it isn’t feasible for me to do my homework, my teacher does not work with me to discuss possible alternatives for finishing the assignment.
quote: My art school teacher requested we work on a canvas of 7ft x 6ft. I live over an hour away from campus, have to take public transportation, know no one with a car, and my home is not large enough for the canvas. Even though it isn’t feasible for me to do my homework, my teacher does not work with me to discuss possible alternatives for finishing the assignment.

caption: My supervisor and I are eating lunch together and making small talk. We work outside of a small town and I live/study most of the year in a fairly large city. When talking about the city I live in, my supervisor (white Canadian) says that she doesn’t like going there “because there tends to be a lot of Natives there.”
quote: My supervisor and I are eating lunch together and making small talk. We work outside of a small town and I live/study most of the year in a fairly large city. When talking about the city I live in, my supervisor (white Canadian) says that she doesn’t like going there “because there tends to be a lot of Natives there.”

caption: Man who works in the same building as me. This made me feel fairly nauseous.
quote: “The only reason women make up more of the rape statistics than men is because men are less likely to make a big deal about it.”
actual_quote: The only reason women make up more of the rape statistics than men is because men are less likely to make a big deal about it.

caption: Woman working in a yarn store where I was shopping. She was making kits for little kids to make toy monsters. I was the only person of color there, and everyone else giggled awkwardly.
quote: “When have you ever seen a monster with blue eyes?”
actual_quote: When have you ever seen a monster with blue eyes?

caption: A regular customer at my coffee shop, reacting to a sign with the American flag and the word “Justicia.”
quote: “Is that about supporting illegals? Who here is an illegal?”
actual_quote: Is that about supporting illegals? Who here is an illegal?

caption: My college roommate.
quote: “One of my good friends from high school is black, but I don’t really think of her as black because she told me she’s white on the inside.”
actual_quote: One of my good friends from high school is black, but I don’t really think of her as black because she told me she’s white on the inside.

caption: White woman, with a smile as I took a water break from riding my bike in a nice neighborhood park. It became clear through her body language and tone that to her, it was funny and out of the ordinary that a 16 year-old black female would want to ride her bike in a park.
quote: “What are you doing here?”
actual_quote: What are you doing here?

caption: Some guy I had sex with on why I was modest about my appearance.
quote: “Well, it’s probably the Asian part of you. Asian people are always so modest.”
actual_quote: Well, it’s probably the Asian part of you. Asian people are always so modest.

caption: My friend, less than ten minutes after we BOTH complained about people using “gay” as a derogatory adjective.
quote: “This IS GAY. Everyone in the class is doing as badly as me!”
actual_quote: This IS GAY. Everyone in the class is doing as badly as me!

caption: More than half the times I tell a stranger I’m Native.
quote: “So how much Indian ARE you? I mean, you don’t look it.”
actual_quote: So how much Indian ARE you? I mean, you don’t look it.

caption: An older customer, trying to make small talk with me as I ring up his order.
quote: “A college student, huh?  So, nursing or teaching?”
actual_quote: A college student, huh?  So, nursing or teaching?

caption: My boss, 3 days ago, walking her daughter home from a $25,000/year Manhattan preschool. Astounded that someone who purports to be liberal doesn’t see the problems with a statement like this.
quote: “We’re paying full fees for our daughter to go to school, and they still ask us to donate our time! And I just think, why not ask these families on financial aid who are only paying a couple thousand bucks!? If you can’t give your money, you should give your time, you know?”
actual_quote: We’re paying full fees for our daughter to go to school, and they still ask us to donate our time! And I just think, why not ask these families on financial aid who are only paying a couple thousand bucks!? If you can’t give your money, you should give your time, you know?

caption: Subscribe | If you’d like to read these microanecdotes in your inbox, sign up for our newsletter here! You will get all the latest posts, as well as news about our blog, community events and more.
quote: Subscribe | If you’d like to read these microanecdotes in your inbox, sign up for our newsletter here! You will get all the latest posts, as well as news about our blog, community events and more.

caption: My advisor to me, a Mexican American, and I don’t consider my house decorations “Mexican” per se!
quote: “One day I will invite you to my place you’ll like it, it’s decorated Mexican.”
actual_quote: One day I will invite you to my place you’ll like it, it’s decorated Mexican.

caption: A woman at the DMV counter throws a form at my son, barks some instructions and calls ‘next.'  He is nervous for his first road test and doesn’t catch the instructions. When he politely asks her to repeat them, she turns back to him and loudly, clearly and slowly (so everyone can hear) says, “I speak English; what language do you speak?” We are South Asian American.
quote: A woman at the DMV counter throws a form at my son, barks some instructions and calls ‘next.'  He is nervous for his first road test and doesn’t catch the instructions. When he politely asks her to repeat them, she turns back to him and loudly, clearly and slowly (so everyone can hear) says, “I speak English; what language do you speak?” We are South Asian American.

caption: My roommate reasoning why her friends will be good house guests while staying at our apartment. She’s a graduate student in the School of International and Political Affairs.
quote: “I mean, they’re Asian. They’ll leave little notes and chocolates.”
actual_quote: I mean, they’re Asian. They’ll leave little notes and chocolates.

caption: Said by a friend of a friend (we’re all white) over dinner. Made me feel embarrassed to be with her.
quote: “She’s Indian or Muslim or something. They just wait for their husbands to tell them it’s time to have a baby and then they get pregnant. It’s sad.”
actual_quote: She’s Indian or Muslim or something. They just wait for their husbands to tell them it’s time to have a baby and then they get pregnant. It’s sad.

caption: My mother-in-law, after eyeing a car containing two African-American men going down my street.
quote: “You need to move to a safer a neighborhood.”
actual_quote: You need to move to a safer a neighborhood.

caption: My boss.
quote: “Before you meet your new coworker, I should warn you: she’s lesbian. That’s why she dresses like a man.”
actual_quote: Before you meet your new coworker, I should warn you: she’s lesbian. That’s why she dresses like a man.

caption: Random older white female passerby.
quote: “You have such nice hair, not like most Blacks! Are you half white?”
actual_quote: You have such nice hair, not like most Blacks! Are you half white?

quote: “I’m not prejudiced, but when I hear about some crimes on the news, I just know it’s going to be a Mexican.”
actual_quote: I’m not prejudiced, but when I hear about some crimes on the news, I just know it’s going to be a Mexican.

caption: Classmate to professor, during a discussion of some fairly recent feminist essays.
quote: “Everything we read in this class is so outdated, all this stuff about men dominating women.  Why don’t we talk about current issues?”
actual_quote: Everything we read in this class is so outdated, all this stuff about men dominating women.  Why don’t we talk about current issues?

quote: As someone who is trying to become a teacher, and dreams of being a teacher, it really kills me when I see the submissions that are said by people's teachers. It's so disturbing.

caption: White psychologist speculating about an female Asian client with a white husband. Australia, September 2010.
quote: “Maybe she was a mail order bride.”
actual_quote: Maybe she was a mail order bride.

caption: From someone who was looking at my autistic son playing and who obviously thought that autistic was a “bad” or “deficient” way to be. Made me feel like my son’s way of being was being invalidated.
quote: “I wish I could fix your son for you.”
actual_quote: I wish I could fix your son for you.

caption: Male orchestra conductor, mentioned twice during two different rehearsals & the performance.
quote: “This new piece is a little different. It’s by a female composer so we’ll see what happens. It’s dedicated to all of the females in the orchestra.”
actual_quote: This new piece is a little different. It’s by a female composer so we’ll see what happens. It’s dedicated to all of the females in the orchestra.

caption: Classmate in my 4th year of college.
quote: “Oh, you are Native American? You don’t look native, are you sure?”
actual_quote: Oh, you are Native American? You don’t look native, are you sure?

caption: Teacher about my proposed research subject about the experiences of gender non-conforming folks with medical and mental health services. Made me feel invisible & isolated.
quote: “You might have trouble finding participants for that study.”
actual_quote: You might have trouble finding participants for that study.

caption: Said with relief by the enrollment counselor at my new high school after looking at my transcript.
quote: “You’re actually smart. You hardly have an accent. Good for you.”
actual_quote: You’re actually smart. You hardly have an accent. Good for you.

caption: My so-called liberal arts college didn’t accept my transfer credit for a pre-1750 history class that was more Afrocentric & focused on Asia instead of Europe. Why teach equality if we don’t really believe in it? Ugh, it makes me want to quit somedays.
quote: My so-called liberal arts college didn’t accept my transfer credit for a pre-1750 history class that was more Afrocentric & focused on Asia instead of Europe. Why teach equality if we don’t really believe in it? Ugh, it makes me want to quit somedays.

caption: Looking at an assortment of teas in a box: “Plantation Mint” and “Oriental Green Tea” are among the offerings. Today, made me feel like I was living in a colonized world - which I am.
quote: Looking at an assortment of teas in a box: “Plantation Mint” and “Oriental Green Tea” are among the offerings. Today, made me feel like I was living in a colonized world - which I am.

caption: My white, 20 year old female friend to me in our school’s cafe where I, as a multiracial individual, am the “blackest” person in the room. Made me feel sad. Invisible. Discounted. Discredited.
quote: “This is why we get along! You totally get my f’d-up sense of humor. Like, I always think about this list of objects that would be perfect"–looks around and lowers her voice– “BLACK-GIRL NAMES. Like ‘Dijonnaise’ or 'Medulla Oblongata’!””
actual_quote: This is why we get along! You totally get my f’d-up sense of humor. Like, I always think about this list of objects that would be perfect"–looks around and lowers her voice– “BLACK-GIRL NAMES. Like ‘Dijonnaise’ or 'Medulla Oblongata’!”

caption: The doctor who delivered me to my white mother. When he saw my Asian father he was all “OH, nevermind.”
quote: “I don’t want to worry you, but something is wrong with her eyes.”
actual_quote: I don’t want to worry you, but something is wrong with her eyes.

caption: Reporters from my school newspaper call me every time a story comes up involving queer issues. As if I’m the only queer person on campus.
quote: Reporters from my school newspaper call me every time a story comes up involving queer issues. As if I’m the only queer person on campus.

caption: A stranger on the bus.
quote: “Go back to China.”
actual_quote: Go back to China.

caption: My class (13 girls of color) and I (white woman) walk to visit a school up the street in an affluent neighborhood, and the students are nearly all white. Two parents inside the building start singing, “One of these things is not like the others,” and laughing as my girls pass by. My girls ask me what the parents mean by that.  I don’t know what to tell them. I’m 22 and my students are 11 and 12 in “liberal” New England.
quote: My class (13 girls of color) and I (white woman) walk to visit a school up the street in an affluent neighborhood, and the students are nearly all white. Two parents inside the building start singing, “One of these things is not like the others,” and laughing as my girls pass by. My girls ask me what the parents mean by that.  I don’t know what to tell them. I’m 22 and my students are 11 and 12 in “liberal” New England.

caption: An old friend IMs me asking me to fill out a survey for his statistics class. It’s about “who should pay on a first date,” and the options are “Male, Female, Split, Whoever asked.”
quote:
An old friend IMs me asking me to fill out a survey for his statistics class. It’s about “who should pay on a first date,” and the options are “Male, Female, Split, Whoever asked.”
I ask him what to do if I identify as female and the person I’m on a date with also identifies female. He doesn’t get the question at first, then, after explaining again, he says “Oh, I guess my survey isn’t really set up for that. :(” All I get is a sad-face emoticon? I guess this is what coming out to a middle school buddy feels like.

caption: In Global Studies class on the issue of feminism, where most the class agreed.
quote: “I mean it’s true, girls just find something wrong in everything and make it all about them when it’s not. How are we supposed to prove that we aren’t the bad guys when they can never be satisfied? Feminism is stupid, they should stop complaining.”
actual_quote: I mean it’s true, girls just find something wrong in everything and make it all about them when it’s not. How are we supposed to prove that we aren’t the bad guys when they can never be satisfied? Feminism is stupid, they should stop complaining.

caption: My coworker, putting his hand on my arm after he suggested that only black people would vote for Obama because he’s black, the way Hispanic people would vote for Allison Iraheta for American Idol.
quote: “I know what I just said sounds prejudiced, but I’m really not.”
actual_quote: I know what I just said sounds prejudiced, but I’m really not.

caption: My mother
quote: “Boys don’t wear necklaces like that.”
actual_quote: Boys don’t wear necklaces like that.

caption: Interview with Ms. Magazine | It’s up! Check it out. Shoutout to the Ms. Blog and the wonderful blogging they do!
quote: Interview with Ms. Magazine | It’s up! Check it out. Shoutout to the Ms. Blog and the wonderful blogging they do!

caption: m4m craigslist personals (everywhere)
quote: “no fats no fems”
actual_quote: no fats no fems

caption: Question we received in response to this post:
quote:
Question we received in response to this post:
What suggestions do you guys have for dealing with this ‘ignorance’? It upsets me, bothers me, yet people continually respond with “It’s okay, my best friend is gay.” “It’s okay, my niece is retarded.” “It’s okay, my brother-in-law is black.” “It’s okay, I’ve been to a dim sum restaurant before.”More so, what’s the best way to deal with the frustration that these people cause? I sometimes lose focus on where the patience comes from and want to lash out. Only stopping to remind myself that’ll often make it worse.
Please feel free to discuss in the comments section of the post!

caption: My science teacher, while digressing from a lecture about explosive elements.
quote: “Everyone in Afghanistan and Iraq knows how to make road side bombs. They learn from their fathers and uncles. Monkey see, monkey do!”
actual_quote: Everyone in Afghanistan and Iraq knows how to make road side bombs. They learn from their fathers and uncles. Monkey see, monkey do!

caption: My 10th grade History teacher
quote: “Native Americans have to stop being so whiney. Geronimo wasn’t describing Bin Laden, it’s just a word. People have to stop being so sensitive and just get over it.”
actual_quote: Native Americans have to stop being so whiney. Geronimo wasn’t describing Bin Laden, it’s just a word. People have to stop being so sensitive and just get over it.

caption: My mother (a white woman), having just dressed after a shower, with her wet hair wrapped in a bath towel, speaking to my sister and her friend on the porch.
quote: “I shouldn’t step outside in my turban; people might think I’m a terrorist.”
actual_quote: I shouldn’t step outside in my turban; people might think I’m a terrorist.

caption: (via colorlines)
A white, middle class childhood friend during a conversation about cultural appropriation and her racism. I am a mixed-race queer woman of color. Made me feel angry, invisible, inauthentic.
quote: “You may be a person of color, but you’re not black. What right do you have to tell me about racism? I mean, you’re mixed, so you’re half white!”
actual_quote: You may be a person of color, but you’re not black. What right do you have to tell me about racism? I mean, you’re mixed, so you’re half white!

caption: Twenty-something white man on his cell phone.
quote: “Well, she’s Puerto Rican, but she doesn’t come off as Latina. She comes off more, like, business, you know?”
actual_quote: Well, she’s Puerto Rican, but she doesn’t come off as Latina. She comes off more, like, business, you know?

quote: “You’re so much less man-hating than I expected a [women’s college] lesbian to be!”
actual_quote: You’re so much less man-hating than I expected a [women’s college] lesbian to be!

caption: The project is looking for some savvy coders for a site redesign to make it more accessible!If you (or someone you know) know anything about html/css/tumblr layouts/etc, shoot email us at editors@microaggressions.com
quote: The project is looking for some savvy coders for a site redesign to make it more accessible!If you (or someone you know) know anything about html/css/tumblr layouts/etc, shoot email us at editors@microaggressions.com

caption: A TA in my college class, about my physical disability (which I have accommodations for).
quote: “I don’t think it would be fair to my other students if I let you have special treatment.”
actual_quote: I don’t think it would be fair to my other students if I let you have special treatment.

caption: Said by a white, straight, man to a queer, light-skinned, mixed-race persyn who was talking about problems faced by queer people.
quote: “I mean you’re white, you really have nothing to complain about.”
actual_quote: I mean you’re white, you really have nothing to complain about.

caption: A piece of advice in a LGBTQ magazine for a bi woman afraid she won’t get a girlfriend because of looking “too straight,” although she’s “pretty gay.” Made me feel awful, invisible, outcast, wrong.
quote: “So are you gay or not? You can’t be “pretty gay”. At the end of the day, bisexuals are usually actually homosexuals.”
actual_quote: So are you gay or not? You can’t be “pretty gay”. At the end of the day, bisexuals are usually actually homosexuals.

caption: A guy at a bar, upon learning I was asexual.
quote: “Come on, you just need to meet the right guy to get you loosened up.”
actual_quote: Come on, you just need to meet the right guy to get you loosened up.

caption: A competitor in a speech tournament, yesterday. Made me feel patronized, irritated that she was implying “weird” equals “un-American."  She assumed that I am embarrassed of having a hard to pronounce last name, that I’m going to get married, have kids etc.,  that if I were to get married I’d change my last name.
quote: “Marry someone with a name like Smith, so you can still have a weird first name but with a last name people can actually pronounce. It’s better for your kids that way, too.”
actual_quote: Marry someone with a name like Smith, so you can still have a weird first name but with a last name people can actually pronounce. It’s better for your kids that way, too.

caption: While staying with a friend in London, his cousin drops by for dinner. We turn on a show that’s sort of a line-up of stand-up comedians. (So far, all white men.) A black woman walks on stage. Friend’s cousin immediately whines to us, “Oh no, this is going to suck, all she’s going to talk about is being black and being a woman.”
quote: While staying with a friend in London, his cousin drops by for dinner. We turn on a show that’s sort of a line-up of stand-up comedians. (So far, all white men.) A black woman walks on stage. Friend’s cousin immediately whines to us, “Oh no, this is going to suck, all she’s going to talk about is being black and being a woman.”

caption: Response given by White training director in health care setting when I (person of color) asked why the supervision group for students of color had been discontinued. This made me feel devalued, unimportant, that the needs of white people come first.
quote: “The White interns complained that they were feeling left out.”
actual_quote: The White interns complained that they were feeling left out.

caption: A friend is trying to describe to me as a dumb loudmouth says that I am a “mix between a southern hick and a New York Jew.”
quote: A friend is trying to describe to me as a dumb loudmouth says that I am a “mix between a southern hick and a New York Jew.”

caption: A straight, agnostic classmate. I felt alienated and invalidated.
quote: “What do you mean, you’re a Christian?  You’re a lesbian!  That’s just masochistic!”
actual_quote: What do you mean, you’re a Christian?  You’re a lesbian!  That’s just masochistic!

caption: In reference to my race and heard from many people since I was in grammar school. I’ve often wondered about their motivations. Is it that if they don’t immediately recognize one’s race, they still have an overwhelming urge to classify them?
quote: “What are you?”
actual_quote: What are you?

caption: Everyone assuming the only other Asian student in my high school and I are cousins.
quote: Everyone assuming the only other Asian student in my high school and I are cousins.

caption: My fair-skinned mother on meeting my boyfriend’s family with a slight tan. I am 21 and was at home.
quote: “You’re dark, that’s the worst time to make a first impression.”
actual_quote: You’re dark, that’s the worst time to make a first impression.

caption: In fifth grade while studying WWII, the kid sitting next to me says, “I hate the Japanese."  Turning to me, he adds, "no offense!"  I am Filipina, and my great grandparents died in the Bataan Death March. I was speechless.
quote: In fifth grade while studying WWII, the kid sitting next to me says, “I hate the Japanese."  Turning to me, he adds, "no offense!"  I am Filipina, and my great grandparents died in the Bataan Death March. I was speechless.
“Anyway, [the teacher] says if you’re not black or Latin@, the standards are higher. I’m so jealous of [biracial girl]; she gets to put ‘black,’ but she still looks white.”
actual_quote: Anyway, [the teacher] says if you’re not black or Latin@, the standards are higher. I’m so jealous of [biracial girl]; she gets to put ‘black,’ but she still looks white.

caption: My boyfriend, today.
quote: “I’m just not attracted to black or Hispanic girls.”
actual_quote: I’m just not attracted to black or Hispanic girls.

caption: While at the Golden State Warrior’s game last week, I watched Jeremy Lin, the first Asian American, play at the end of the 2nd quarter. The white man sitting next to me proceeds to shout  "COME ON CHOW MEIN!“ after referring to his friend seated next to him as "nigga.”
quote: While at the Golden State Warrior’s game last week, I watched Jeremy Lin, the first Asian American, play at the end of the 2nd quarter. The white man sitting next to me proceeds to shout  "COME ON CHOW MEIN!“ after referring to his friend seated next to him as "nigga.”

caption: Old white woman in elevator turns to me and says, “It’s hot, isn’t it?” I reply, “Yes, it’s unbearable”. She than asks me, “Well, aren’t your people used to this type of weather?“
quote:
Old white woman in elevator turns to me and says, “It’s hot, isn’t it?” I reply, “Yes, it’s unbearable”. She than asks me, “Well, aren’t your people used to this type of weather?“
I am a 21 year old, South Asian American female. This was June 2010, in my hometown, New York City. I wanted to attack her with my words, but didn’t feel that it was worth it.  This woman knows that my family and I have been living in the apartment building for a long time. I was afraid that if I said anything, she would complain to our supervisor, who already has issues with the South Asian folks in the building, that it could possibly affect our rental status.

caption: My step-grandmother in North Carolina, looking at photos of me and my mostly-Asian American group of friends from University of Hawaii.
quote: “There don’t seem to be many American students there.”
actual_quote: There don’t seem to be many American students there.

caption: After reviewing a proposal from a caterer for a Chinese themed party. I tell my boss that some aspects of it seemed “hokey” and slightly offensive. My boss says “But, its for old white people. It will be fun because the servers will be wearing Chinese garb!”
quote: After reviewing a proposal from a caterer for a Chinese themed party. I tell my boss that some aspects of it seemed “hokey” and slightly offensive. My boss says “But, its for old white people. It will be fun because the servers will be wearing Chinese garb!”

caption: Note on submissions - THANK YOU for all of your contributions so far to The Microaggressions Project! We’ve gotten many questions about submissions not being posted yet!
quote:
Note on submissions - THANK YOU for all of your contributions so far to The Microaggressions Project! We’ve gotten many questions about submissions not being posted yet!
Just so you know, we’ve queued over 200 posts right now. We don’t want to bombard news feeds so we only post 4-6 a day, even though we have 1000s of submissions. Since we have no hierarchy of what gets posted first (rare exceptions for timely submissions about recent current events, etc.), any submissions over the last few weeks will probably take a few weeks/months to get published. We just wanted to let you know that we are still welcoming submissions, but they may take a while to appear on the site. Thanks! Please post any suggestions/input on the discussion thread…

caption: The ‘xs’ stands for 'extra small’ and is for formatting purposes only; it gives each post the size that we want.
quote: I feel like I should know this, but what does the 'xs' tag indicate? Intersectionality, or... ?

caption: (via colorlines)
Fellow college student in a very diverse university.
quote: “My friend Kelly; she’s black, but she’s really smart.”
actual_quote: My friend Kelly; she’s black, but she’s really smart.

caption: Often said to my same-sex partner and I who have two children together, (ages 7 and 10). I’m 45 and live in a “liberal” pocket of western Massachusetts. Makes me annoyed, angry, sad.
quote: “Now which one of you is the real mom?”
actual_quote: Now which one of you is the real mom?

caption: I am one of two women at my service-oriented job. Older clients often complain that my coworker’s style isn’t feminine enough and that she shouldn’t always wear her hair slicked back in a ponytail. It especially pains me that those making the sexist comments are fellow women. Makes me feel deeply disappointed.
quote: I am one of two women at my service-oriented job. Older clients often complain that my coworker’s style isn’t feminine enough and that she shouldn’t always wear her hair slicked back in a ponytail. It especially pains me that those making the sexist comments are fellow women. Makes me feel deeply disappointed.

caption: My step-mom was giving away kittens and had spoken to a woman earlier on the phone about adopting one.  She told me she knew the woman adopting was Black because of how she sounded on the phone.  Later that day when the family was out to lunch, my step-mom turned to the Black lady in the booth behind ours and asked if she had talked to her earlier about adopting the kitten because “she sounded JUST like the woman on the phone.”
quote: My step-mom was giving away kittens and had spoken to a woman earlier on the phone about adopting one.  She told me she knew the woman adopting was Black because of how she sounded on the phone.  Later that day when the family was out to lunch, my step-mom turned to the Black lady in the booth behind ours and asked if she had talked to her earlier about adopting the kitten because “she sounded JUST like the woman on the phone.”

caption: My father
quote: “Why do they keep talking about Katrina? It was five years ago!”
actual_quote: Why do they keep talking about Katrina? It was five years ago!

caption: My mother, after I asked her not to call high prices for clothes “retarded.”
quote: “I’m allowed to use that word any way I want to! I have a nephew like that and I grew up with cousins and classmates who were that way.”
actual_quote: I’m allowed to use that word any way I want to! I have a nephew like that and I grew up with cousins and classmates who were that way.

caption: A girl is leaving to visit a mosque as part of a seminar. Two guys start talking about it: “What kind of seminar is it? Religion…?” “Arabic religion, I think. She hates it.” “Do they make her wear those head things?” “Do they make her be stoned to death?" In a college dorm, today.
quote: A girl is leaving to visit a mosque as part of a seminar. Two guys start talking about it: “What kind of seminar is it? Religion…?” “Arabic religion, I think. She hates it.” “Do they make her wear those head things?” “Do they make her be stoned to death?" In a college dorm, today.

caption: From certain white friends. Makes me feel invisible.
quote: “You’re so white… you’re so not a black girl. I don’t understand why you get upset when I say this… You don’t “act black.””
actual_quote: You’re so white… you’re so not a black girl. I don’t understand why you get upset when I say this… You don’t “act black.”

caption: While I’m standing at the front of the room teaching the class, an older white male professor comes in with two male TA’s and starts moving around tables for the next class ten minutes before my class was to end. I say loudly, “We’re not done here yet,” and he looks past me as if I’m not there; the TA’s follow suit and ignore me, if uncomfortably. I angrily tell them that the class is not over yet, with no effect. As I continue giving my students the homework assignment, he and his TA’s take away the table right in front of me with my materials on it. Made me feel invisible, embarrassed, devalued as a female graduate student instructor.
quote: While I’m standing at the front of the room teaching the class, an older white male professor comes in with two male TA’s and starts moving around tables for the next class ten minutes before my class was to end. I say loudly, “We’re not done here yet,” and he looks past me as if I’m not there; the TA’s follow suit and ignore me, if uncomfortably. I angrily tell them that the class is not over yet, with no effect. As I continue giving my students the homework assignment, he and his TA’s take away the table right in front of me with my materials on it. Made me feel invisible, embarrassed, devalued as a female graduate student instructor.

caption: A female co-worker, in regards to a sexual assault case at my university. I was shocked & angry.
quote: “She’s just trying to have her Kobe Bryant moment.”
actual_quote: She’s just trying to have her Kobe Bryant moment.

caption: Maybe more macro than micro, but contains an underlying message - this article from Indian Country Today breaks it down.
quote: Bin Laden code name "Geronimo"

caption: My white colleague’s response to my concern of not being taken seriously by other, older, white, female colleagues. We are both in our 30s and we were having a drink post-work. Made me feel angry, dismayed, betrayed, and disappointed that I could not have further conversation.
quote: “Well you have to understand that those people are from a different generation so you can’t get upset.  If they tell you that your hair is festive it’s not meant to be a bad thing, you know?”
actual_quote: Well you have to understand that those people are from a different generation so you can’t get upset.  If they tell you that your hair is festive it’s not meant to be a bad thing, you know?

caption: At work, by a white administrator, after a mother came in for a conference & brought her little daughter. Made me feel alienated, disgusted, objectified, alone.
quote: “I want to steal a black baby.  Black babies are just so much cuter than white babies!”
actual_quote: I want to steal a black baby.  Black babies are just so much cuter than white babies!

caption: “Friend” (another woman of color) watching me get my hair cut, commenting on its color, coarseness, and curls as it hit the floor. Made me feel alone, like it hurts more when it comes from among us, like there’s so much work to be done.
quote: “Ew, your hair looks like pubes!”
actual_quote: Ew, your hair looks like pubes!

caption: My creative writing professor, in response to my piece about being mixed and on the margins, constantly in between and searching for community. Made me feel like my experience as a mixed person was being equated with the experiences of whiteness & white people not recognizing their privilege or experiences relating to power.
quote: “This is totally an experience a lot of white kids can relate to. I once had a friend who wished she was Indian - LOVED the food, dance, culture, everything! Then she went to China and wished she was Chinese!”
actual_quote: This is totally an experience a lot of white kids can relate to. I once had a friend who wished she was Indian - LOVED the food, dance, culture, everything! Then she went to China and wished she was Chinese!

caption: Microaggressions panel at Hunter College tomorrow!
quote:
Microaggressions panel at Hunter College tomorrow!
If you’re in New York City, come to a panel hosted by the Coalition for the Revitalization of Asian American Studies at Hunter (CRAASH):
“Microaggressions: Subconscious Biases in a ‘Postracial’ World”
Wednesday May 4th, 1:30pm at Hunter College HW 116 (695 Park Avenue)

caption: My friend after I told her that I’d like to play a lead role in the Broadway musical Chicago. Stuff like that makes me wonder if there’s any space for an actually talented African-American in the acting industry, even if it’s not me.
quote: “I don’t think Velma Kelly can be played by a black girl. It just wouldn’t seem right.”
actual_quote: I don’t think Velma Kelly can be played by a black girl. It just wouldn’t seem right.

caption: A friend in response to me explaining how I feel diminished and humiliated when men shout out sexual things to me when walking down the street. It is downright scary and not at all flattering.
quote: “You should be grateful. You may not get all that attention one day. Lots of girls would trade places with you.”
actual_quote: You should be grateful. You may not get all that attention one day. Lots of girls would trade places with you.

caption: 70ish year-old socialite at a charity dinner I was working. Made my jaw drop, and several people left at that point.
quote: “I have news… the terrorist Barack Hussein Obama has been hunted down and killed…” *girlish giggle* “Oops, I meant Osama Bin Laden.”
actual_quote: I have news… the terrorist Barack Hussein Obama has been hunted down and killed…” *girlish giggle* “Oops, I meant Osama Bin Laden.

caption: Teacher, jokingly. He wasn’t; I actually was. I even have the permanent balance disorder to show for it.
quote: “What, were you hit on the head too many times as a kid?”
actual_quote: What, were you hit on the head too many times as a kid?

caption: At a rally against the passing of Proposition 8 in San Diego, I was brought up to the front of the crowd to stand next to the speaker so that I could be their token Asian woman in case anyone wanted to  take pictures.
quote: At a rally against the passing of Proposition 8 in San Diego, I was brought up to the front of the crowd to stand next to the speaker so that I could be their token Asian woman in case anyone wanted to  take pictures.

caption: A girl who wanted to see what color my gums were. I was 14, in 9th grade religion class.
quote: “Smile.”
actual_quote: Smile.

quote: “I really don’t like [a graduate student speaker’s fellow classmate]; he’s so disgusting and fat. I hate fat people. They’re so lazy…. No one should be fat, not even poor people… poverty is no excuse. Even in the ghetto you can walk on the street and work out.”
actual_quote: I really don’t like [a graduate student speaker’s fellow classmate]; he’s so disgusting and fat. I hate fat people. They’re so lazy…. No one should be fat, not even poor people… poverty is no excuse. Even in the ghetto you can walk on the street and work out.

caption: I am told to apologize to my grandmother for crying and “making a scene” at Easter dinner after my cousin tells me he’s glad gay men can’t donate blood; that way he’ll never have “faggot blood” in his veins.
quote: I am told to apologize to my grandmother for crying and “making a scene” at Easter dinner after my cousin tells me he’s glad gay men can’t donate blood; that way he’ll never have “faggot blood” in his veins.

caption: If I should mention, for any reason, if it’s asked, if it just comes up in conversation, that I’ve taken multiple self defense classes, the response that I almost always get from men, from friends, family, from my boss, is some variation of “oh, well, I could still snap you like a twig, you silly, 120 pound, 5'5 girl.” It’s like they want to  make sure I know that no matter what I do, they can always overpower me, I will never be able to handle myself, I will never have any power, no matter how I try, over my own safety.
quote: If I should mention, for any reason, if it’s asked, if it just comes up in conversation, that I’ve taken multiple self defense classes, the response that I almost always get from men, from friends, family, from my boss, is some variation of “oh, well, I could still snap you like a twig, you silly, 120 pound, 5'5 girl.” It’s like they want to  make sure I know that no matter what I do, they can always overpower me, I will never be able to handle myself, I will never have any power, no matter how I try, over my own safety.

caption: An ex, to me. In the USA & made me feel angry & marginalized.
quote: “Can I say that I have yellow fever?”
actual_quote: Can I say that I have yellow fever?

caption: Though I intentionally wear skirts that fall below my knees and tops that come up to my neck, I am told that my dress is distracting or inappropriate. Because my non plus-sized co-workers wear mini-skirts and tops that reveal “tasteful” cleavage, I know the problem is not my clothing but my “full figure.” This has happened since I dared to enter puberty.
quote: Though I intentionally wear skirts that fall below my knees and tops that come up to my neck, I am told that my dress is distracting or inappropriate. Because my non plus-sized co-workers wear mini-skirts and tops that reveal “tasteful” cleavage, I know the problem is not my clothing but my “full figure.” This has happened since I dared to enter puberty.

caption: Black male coworker: Hey, are you familiar with the phrase (some old-timey phrase I don’t know)?Me: No.  I’ve never heard it. Maybe my dad has… What does it mean?Coworker:  Oh, I forgot, you’re not really black.
quote: Black male coworker: Hey, are you familiar with the phrase (some old-timey phrase I don’t know)?Me: No.  I’ve never heard it. Maybe my dad has… What does it mean?Coworker:  Oh, I forgot, you’re not really black.
“You don’t look Jewish.”
actual_quote: You don’t look Jewish.

caption: I walk into the ninth grade English classroom with a short haircut, the day before I had cut off my braids. The teacher looks me up and down and says, “Good morning, butch.”
quote:
I walk into the ninth grade English classroom with a short haircut, the day before I had cut off my braids. The teacher looks me up and down and says, “Good morning, butch.”
Freshman year of high school, 1997 & made me feel angry & ashamed.

caption: I meet the spouse of a friend, who launches into recycling the racist jokes he’s told at his workplace. He insists that his black and Puerto Rican coworkers think he’s a cutup, and can’t understand why I’m reacting coldly. Just because some people of color might laugh at your racist jokes, doesn’t mean we all will.
quote: I meet the spouse of a friend, who launches into recycling the racist jokes he’s told at his workplace. He insists that his black and Puerto Rican coworkers think he’s a cutup, and can’t understand why I’m reacting coldly. Just because some people of color might laugh at your racist jokes, doesn’t mean we all will.

caption: Being too afraid to say something when a man harasses me and other women at the bus stop. I get on the bus and leave them with him.
quote:
Being too afraid to say something when a man harasses me and other women at the bus stop. I get on the bus and leave them with him.
Made me feel ashamed, impotent, angry.

caption: Overheard during ceremony when student with Arabic name received an award.
quote: “Yeah, well, you can bet HE won’t have to pay to go to good college.”
actual_quote: Yeah, well, you can bet HE won’t have to pay to go to good college.

caption: My classmate makes a joke about Jews running the media. We all laugh, including me, because they think there are no Jews around to hear it. Made me feel humiliated.
quote: My classmate makes a joke about Jews running the media. We all laugh, including me, because they think there are no Jews around to hear it. Made me feel humiliated.

caption: Fellow men who paternalistically refer to women (who are around their age, or even older) as “girls.”
quote: Fellow men who paternalistically refer to women (who are around their age, or even older) as “girls.”

caption: Said to my father and me, age 8, while walking across Union Square, San Francisco. Made me feel confused, at first; we’re Pilipino, not Chinese. Made me angry when I realized it didn’t matter whether we are Chinese - we’re clearly “foreigners” and don’t have rights to be in the US.
quote: “Chinaman, go home!”
actual_quote: Chinaman, go home!

caption: A man hitting on me after I told him I wasn’t interested, because I’m gay.
quote: “Of course you like men. As a woman, it’s in your nature.”
actual_quote: Of course you like men. As a woman, it’s in your nature.

caption: Friend, two years ago.
quote: “I’m glad you changed your hair… you were starting to look like Buckwheat!”
actual_quote: I’m glad you changed your hair… you were starting to look like Buckwheat!

caption: Response of white university student in a 3rd Year Sociology of Minority Groups course, after asking several ignorant comments, the professor responded that she should read the textbook to understand.
quote: “Well, what are Aboriginals doing to preserve their culture? They shouldn’t be using computers then.”
actual_quote: Well, what are Aboriginals doing to preserve their culture? They shouldn’t be using computers then.

caption: Friends who know I’m bisexual, and had recently started dating a man after dating only women for a few years. Happened several years ago.
quote: “So do you feel more straight now?”
actual_quote: So do you feel more straight now?

caption: (via colorlines)
Drunken words of a European white male I (African American) approached for a dance in an NYC bar. First words out of his mouth.
quote: “I’m surprised you’re not in jail right now.”
actual_quote: I’m surprised you’re not in jail right now.

caption: In response to me being from an affluent suburb with multi-generational professionals.
quote: “Dude, I’m blacker than you. I watch Comic view on BET every night.”
actual_quote: Dude, I’m blacker than you. I watch Comic view on BET every night.

caption: We were discussing some topic in my Anthropology class, and the professor called on me by referring to me as the “aggressive, African queen in the back.” I was so shocked I looked around to see if she really said that. My classmates just shifted their eyes and said nothing.
quote: We were discussing some topic in my Anthropology class, and the professor called on me by referring to me as the “aggressive, African queen in the back.” I was so shocked I looked around to see if she really said that. My classmates just shifted their eyes and said nothing.

caption: The Microaggressions Project was built entirely with Google Docs, Tumblr, and its wonderful community. You can email us at editors@microaggressions.com.
quote: I was just wondering how expensive and labor intensive is microaggressions to maintain. DId you build it using all social media tools or did you customize it hiring developers or software engineers? i would like to do something similar on a hyper local level around Title IX violations in schools and would love to perhaps hire you as a consultant

caption: Little white girl in the pool in Arkansas when I was 8 years old. I’m Cuban/White and look racially ambiguous. Made me feel confused, hurt.
quote: “Are you Chinese? Then what ARE you? Because you don’t look like us.”
actual_quote: Are you Chinese? Then what ARE you? Because you don’t look like us.

caption: My mother to my Chinese American girlfriend, whose name is Sara.
quote: “How come you don’t have a Chinese name like Ling Ling or something?”
actual_quote: How come you don’t have a Chinese name like Ling Ling or something?

caption: I am Asian American. When my white boyfriend revealed me to his mother (by saying and spelling my last name), she grumbled, “Well, at least she’s not black.”
quote:
I am Asian American. When my white boyfriend revealed me to his mother (by saying and spelling my last name), she grumbled, “Well, at least she’s not black.”
I had so much internalized oppression - I was just relieved that I was acceptable.

caption: A paragraph we added to “About the Project”:
quote:
A paragraph we added to “About the Project”:
This project is not about showing how “ignorant” people can be and simply dismissing their ignorance. Instead, it is about showing how these comments create and enforce uncomfortable, violent and unsafe realities onto peoples’ workplace, home, school, public transportation/space, childhood/adolescence/adulthood  environments.

caption: After emailing a picture of a very hot lady to a straight friend, (I am gay) and signing off with the words “Every dyke’s dream” she told me not to use that word as it was so ‘nasty.’
quote:
After emailing a picture of a very hot lady to a straight friend, (I am gay) and signing off with the words “Every dyke’s dream” she told me not to use that word as it was so ‘nasty.’
Age 18, via email, last week, Kent, England. Made me frustrated, angry at that she felt the need to tell me what I could call myself.

caption: Blond child to her mother while watching brown skinned & black haired me fly a kite at the beach: “Mommy, she looks like one of the bad guys.” Over and over again, getting louder and more insistent despite mother’s shushing.
quote:
Blond child to her mother while watching brown skinned & black haired me fly a kite at the beach: “Mommy, she looks like one of the bad guys.” Over and over again, getting louder and more insistent despite mother’s shushing.
August 2010, Ocracoke Island (North Carolina). This made me feel brown.

caption: My dad continues to use the term “Oriental” to refer to Asians. When I ask him not to, he gets angry and yells at me about “political correctness.” My (South Asian) mother tells me in private that she doesn’t like it either, but that if I would just stop being so offended by things we would be  a better family.
quote:
My dad continues to use the term “Oriental” to refer to Asians. When I ask him not to, he gets angry and yells at me about “political correctness.” My (South Asian) mother tells me in private that she doesn’t like it either, but that if I would just stop being so offended by things we would be  a better family.
I am 22 & this happened last week.

caption: I have OCD and was stuck in the middle of a ritual. This girl looks at me trying to get out of it and says: “Oh don’t stop, it’s funny!”
quote: I have OCD and was stuck in the middle of a ritual. This girl looks at me trying to get out of it and says: “Oh don’t stop, it’s funny!”

caption: I’m Indian & this happens every time I meet an American. Usually a white one.
quote: “Your English is excellent.”
actual_quote: Your English is excellent.

caption: My great-aunt’s explanation of why I was upset about an anti-immigrant rant sent over the family list-serve.  My fiance is an immigrant and speaks English as a second language & we are both US citizens.
quote: “She’s just being extra sensitive because her husband-to-be is not an English citizen.  If he is a citizen, he should not be offended.”
actual_quote: She’s just being extra sensitive because her husband-to-be is not an English citizen.  If he is a citizen, he should not be offended.

caption: My sister commenting on my red nail polish at Thanksgiving dinner.
quote: “I keep getting freaked out whenever I look at your hands – it looks like they’re attached to a woman.”
actual_quote: I keep getting freaked out whenever I look at your hands – it looks like they’re attached to a woman.

caption: The only other Asian in my grade and I were given the roles of stereotypical, lab-coat-wearing scientists in the sixth grade school play.
quote: The only other Asian in my grade and I were given the roles of stereotypical, lab-coat-wearing scientists in the sixth grade school play.

caption: My high school counselor, explaining why he wouldn’t let me take computer science even though I had an A+ in all the prerequisites.My parents fought for me so I could take it. On the first day, I realized I was the only female in the class. My classmates gave each other nicknames; mine was “girl.”
quote: “You’ll fail. Why don’t you take keyboarding instead?”
actual_quote: You’ll fail. Why don’t you take keyboarding instead?

caption: Man outside club asks my name. I tell him. He says, “Wow, that’s so exotic.” I cannot count the number of times I have heard that.
quote: Man outside club asks my name. I tell him. He says, “Wow, that’s so exotic.” I cannot count the number of times I have heard that.

caption: What happens when your white cousin dates a brown guy.
quote: “Your cousin is dating a new man.  I don’t know what he is, but he’s something.”
actual_quote: Your cousin is dating a new man.  I don’t know what he is, but he’s something.

caption: My dad, explaining to an eight-year-old me why he hopes I’m not into girls.
quote: “I just think life is hard enough without being gay on top of it.”
actual_quote: I just think life is hard enough without being gay on top of it.

caption: Facebook status: “My instructor just said women should do all the shopping, while men do manly things. The girls in class flipped out at him. funnest thing I have ever seen in school. I’m drinking rum and red bull.”
