quote: Facebook status: “My instructor just said women should do all the shopping, while men do manly things. The girls in class flipped out at him. funnest thing I have ever seen in school. I’m drinking rum and red bull.”

caption: Vietnamese American male upon finding out I got a higher score than him on the Chinese I midterm.
quote: “Man, outscored by a black guy.”
actual_quote: Man, outscored by a black guy.

caption: Working at an Irish pub means that you tend to chat to the customers quite a bit. I often get the “Where are you from?” question. To which I always reply, “Canada.” To which the response is always, “But where are you really from?” To which I deadpan, “Winnipeg,” and walk away.
quote:
Working at an Irish pub means that you tend to chat to the customers quite a bit. I often get the “Where are you from?” question. To which I always reply, “Canada.” To which the response is always, “But where are you really from?” To which I deadpan, “Winnipeg,” and walk away.
I am a Filipina Canadian who has been mistaken for everything from full on Caucasian to Latina, to all manner of Asian ethnicity.

caption: Mom at crew race.
quote: “It’s not fair that my son has to compete with illegal immigrants for college admissions.”
actual_quote: It’s not fair that my son has to compete with illegal immigrants for college admissions.

caption: Random dudes on street.
quote: “Hey China doll! Ni hao, ma!”
actual_quote: Hey China doll! Ni hao, ma!

caption: My mom, who has food issues.  She spat out the word “fat” like it hurt her to say it.  Made me really sad.
quote: “We don’t keep eating utensils in the car.  That’s what FAT FAT FAT people do.”
actual_quote: We don’t keep eating utensils in the car.  That’s what FAT FAT FAT people do.

quote: “The names black people come up with for their kids are just ridiculous. What’s with all the prefixes? “Te-shawn” and “De-andre.”  Ridiculous. What’s wrong with “Bob?””
actual_quote: The names black people come up with for their kids are just ridiculous. What’s with all the prefixes? “Te-shawn” and “De-andre.”  Ridiculous. What’s wrong with “Bob?”

caption: Mother, after I called her upset about being sexually assaulted.
quote: “You should just get over it and get used to it sweetie.”
actual_quote: You should just get over it and get used to it sweetie.

caption: My mother, disapprovingly
quote: “All your friends are gay. I’m worried that other people will make judgments about you, and… [lowers voice] you should be careful, because they might try to recruit you.”
actual_quote: All your friends are gay. I’m worried that other people will make judgments about you, and… [lowers voice] you should be careful, because they might try to recruit you.

caption: My white cousin and her Nigerian husband have an adorable 2 year-old.  When my cousin is out alone with her daughter she is constantly asked by strangers  where her daughter is from; people assume she’s adopted from another country. My cousin’s response: “My womb.”
quote: My white cousin and her Nigerian husband have an adorable 2 year-old.  When my cousin is out alone with her daughter she is constantly asked by strangers  where her daughter is from; people assume she’s adopted from another country. My cousin’s response: “My womb.”

caption: ‘Friend’ in reference to my financial problems
quote: “If you were skinny you could just mooch off of some sucker who would pay for everything.”
actual_quote: If you were skinny you could just mooch off of some sucker who would pay for everything.

caption: I get on a tram  late one night by myself. A white man looks me up and down and then says to his friend, "Mmm. I feel like curry tonight.“
quote: I get on a tram  late one night by myself. A white man looks me up and down and then says to his friend, "Mmm. I feel like curry tonight.“

caption: Comment on this post about the roots of microaggressions where perpetrators are people of color. We wholeheartedly agree with this comment, and as editors we want to make crystal clear that this is exactly our slant on the topic of microaggressions.It’s never mere ignorance or bias that makes any of the anecdotes we post alarming, but rather it’s the fact that their roots are derived from the social supremacy given to whiteness, maleness, class status, and heterosexual identity, among others. Cross-racial and internalized microaggressions only further illustrate how pervasive these beliefs have become in spite of who they marginalize and oppress.Let’s continue this conversation in the comments below or in the original post!

The menu at my college in “honor” of Black History Month. I saw this and joked to my black friends that the only thing missing on this menu is watermelon and Kool Aid (I’m black myself, and I use racial humor as a way to deal with things like… this.) The menu is a complete joke, and the irony is that most of my white friends couldn’t find what was offensive about this, saying, “This is good southern food!” Made me feel exasperated.
Male best friend after I talked to him about how upset I was on being sexually harassed at my job.
quote: “Well, you do have a nice body… it’s not really their fault.”
actual_quote: Well, you do have a nice body… it’s not really their fault.

caption: 60 year old married coworker after seeing me pick up sweets in the kitchen.
quote: “Don’t you want to get married someday?”
actual_quote: Don’t you want to get married someday?

caption: I am a female attorney. I represented a client at a court hearing where there were five other parties, all represented by male attorneys. The judge was a male. During the hearing, the judge ordered me to take notes while my colleagues made their arguments and at the end, instructed me to type up the minutes and send to him for approval. When I gently pointed out that this wasn’t my job, the judge replied that the state does not provide him with a secretary.
quote: I am a female attorney. I represented a client at a court hearing where there were five other parties, all represented by male attorneys. The judge was a male. During the hearing, the judge ordered me to take notes while my colleagues made their arguments and at the end, instructed me to type up the minutes and send to him for approval. When I gently pointed out that this wasn’t my job, the judge replied that the state does not provide him with a secretary.

caption: Elderly white lady, whose rebellious son married a black woman and moved to a predominantly black neighborhood.
quote: “I love my grandkids, even though they are black.”
actual_quote: I love my grandkids, even though they are black.

caption: My ex-boyfriend in college, after telling him how an acquaintance physically sexually harassed me.
quote: “So?”
actual_quote: So?

caption: My Vietnamese friend who lives in another town when I was visiting her.
quote: “Ugh, I hate living here. There’s so many black people around.”
actual_quote: Ugh, I hate living here. There’s so many black people around.

caption: When I was 9 years old my school decided I was too fat and put me in special physical education classes. I had to put an exercise chart on the fridge at home. Since then I have struggled with feelings of worthlessness and an eating disorder for 20 years; finally at 29 I am getting therapy to learn how to love myself.
quote: When I was 9 years old my school decided I was too fat and put me in special physical education classes. I had to put an exercise chart on the fridge at home. Since then I have struggled with feelings of worthlessness and an eating disorder for 20 years; finally at 29 I am getting therapy to learn how to love myself.

caption: Two young black men in their early 20s come to my door to sell magazine subscriptions that will “help literacy in the ghetto.” One of them tells me how hard it was for him to grow up in the ghetto. I tell him I grew up poor and in a ghetto and he laughs, like I just made a joke. He says, “I’ve never met a poor Asian person. There can’t be Asians in ghettos.”
quote:
Two young black men in their early 20s come to my door to sell magazine subscriptions that will “help literacy in the ghetto.” One of them tells me how hard it was for him to grow up in the ghetto. I tell him I grew up poor and in a ghetto and he laughs, like I just made a joke. He says, “I’ve never met a poor Asian person. There can’t be Asians in ghettos.”
Made me feel like my childhood growing on welfare in Chinatown was a joke. I feel like this guy completely bought into the model minority stereotype thereby denying the existence of all poor Asian Americans struggling to survive.

caption: A man at another restaurant table to a five year-old girl.
quote: “Are you a boy or a girl? Sit up straight!”
actual_quote: Are you a boy or a girl? Sit up straight!

caption: While studying for a medical school parasitology exam about infectious diseases, a classmate says, “Why are we studying all these diseases that are only in Africa? They don’t even have any history.”
quote: While studying for a medical school parasitology exam about infectious diseases, a classmate says, “Why are we studying all these diseases that are only in Africa? They don’t even have any history.”

caption: Conversation overheard between three white females in a theater.
quote: “See, when I think ‘ghetto’, I think names like DeShawn… you know, ethnic-sounding names. Not Allen. Allen sounds like someone who makes money.”
actual_quote: See, when I think ‘ghetto’, I think names like DeShawn… you know, ethnic-sounding names. Not Allen. Allen sounds like someone who makes money.

caption: I stopped getting asked to babysit girls right around the time I came out as a lesbian at age 15 or 16.  It could have been an age thing, but I still got other jobs in a different neighborhood watching boys. Made me paranoid and broke.
quote: I stopped getting asked to babysit girls right around the time I came out as a lesbian at age 15 or 16.  It could have been an age thing, but I still got other jobs in a different neighborhood watching boys. Made me paranoid and broke.

caption: I work at a toy store. This couple was shopping for a two year old and apparently only gay boys play with farm animal toys. I felt angry, uncomfortable, speechless.
quote: “We can’t get him that. Put it back, it’ll make him gay.”
actual_quote: We can’t get him that. Put it back, it’ll make him gay.

caption: A high school friend, grossed out because I had written in my blog the previous night about how intense and painful my menstrual cramps were. Made me feel like my experiences were less important than his desire to ignore them.
quote: “You really shouldn’t talk about that. Nobody wants to hear about it.”
actual_quote: You really shouldn’t talk about that. Nobody wants to hear about it.

caption: Kids in my class are constantly complaining about people who get into college on affirmative action but brag about their legacy credits at Ivies. They say affirmative action is unfair, racist against white people, and dismissive of personal merit, but they don’t realize how hypocritical they are. I am biracial Korean-white junior enrolled at a well-known private day school in New England on full scholarship.
quote: Kids in my class are constantly complaining about people who get into college on affirmative action but brag about their legacy credits at Ivies. They say affirmative action is unfair, racist against white people, and dismissive of personal merit, but they don’t realize how hypocritical they are. I am biracial Korean-white junior enrolled at a well-known private day school in New England on full scholarship.

caption: At the zoo with my boyfriend, who just bought both of us ice cream cones. Young girl asks her father if she can have ice cream too. He smiles at me and says: "If you’re a good girl. See, she was a good girl, so he bought her ice cream!“
quote:
At the zoo with my boyfriend, who just bought both of us ice cream cones. Young girl asks her father if she can have ice cream too. He smiles at me and says: "If you’re a good girl. See, she was a good girl, so he bought her ice cream!“
I was a 20 year-old female and my boyfriend was a 22 year-old male. 2 years ago in New York City.

caption: Business man to business woman, during a business dinner. I was appalled.
quote: “You’re beautiful. Oh, you’re married? So, do you have any sisters?”
actual_quote: You’re beautiful. Oh, you’re married? So, do you have any sisters?

caption: A high school cafeteria aide after I offered to give the Heimlich maneuver to a choking male student. I am a petite, 16 year-old female certified as a lifeguard as well as in CPR. Made me feel helpless and inadequate.
quote: “Honey, you probably aren’t strong enough.”
actual_quote: Honey, you probably aren’t strong enough.

caption: A student talking to me about a friend of hers that she goes out to the club with.  The thing that worries me?  She’s running a girls self-esteem group.
quote: “She always wears such revealing clothing and flirts with all of these guys when we’re out.  It’s just gross and dangerous.  I’m not saying that a person deserves to be raped, but…”
actual_quote: She always wears such revealing clothing and flirts with all of these guys when we’re out.  It’s just gross and dangerous.  I’m not saying that a person deserves to be raped, but…

caption: My partner’s father, a local sheriff, berated me at his dinner table for not knowing enough about vehicle maintenance.   My lack of interest in cars does not define my identity. Made me feel alienated, marginalized, and intimidated.
quote: “Not much of a man, are you?”
actual_quote: Not much of a man, are you?

caption: I’m signing in at the doctors, and they ask my ethnicity. I respond, “white British”, and they say,  "Good, that’s what we like to hear.“
quote: I’m signing in at the doctors, and they ask my ethnicity. I respond, “white British”, and they say,  "Good, that’s what we like to hear.“

caption: I am a German-born light-skinned child of Turkish immigrants. Encountered many times across Europe when people try to guess where I’m from.
quote: “Spain? France? Italy? Greece? Russia? Serbia? Czech? Oh… you are a Turk? Oh…”
actual_quote: Spain? France? Italy? Greece? Russia? Serbia? Czech? Oh… you are a Turk? Oh…

caption: A white man to my friend and me.  Besides having brown skin we look nothing alike.
quote: “Woah, are you two sisters? You look so much alike! It’s just that you both have that ethnic thing going on.”
actual_quote: Woah, are you two sisters? You look so much alike! It’s just that you both have that ethnic thing going on.

caption: I have been hearing this quite often now and it seriously pisses me off.  There are a bunch of guys I hang around with and whenever they say  something that they think sounds slightly homosexual, they would  immediately play it off by saying, “No homo.”
quote: I have been hearing this quite often now and it seriously pisses me off.  There are a bunch of guys I hang around with and whenever they say  something that they think sounds slightly homosexual, they would  immediately play it off by saying, “No homo.”

caption: Male coworker commenting about my appearance. Inappropriate for a work setting, and not really a complement otherwise. This is not the first time a male coworker has made an inappropriate comment about my appearance. And, I never wear tight or revealing clothing. Simply business casual. Not that the way I dress should matter.
quote: “Saw your picture in the company newsletter. WOW WOW WOW!”
actual_quote: Saw your picture in the company newsletter. WOW WOW WOW!

caption: Some guy comes up to me, referring to my hair.
quote: “I mean, I can tell you have some black in you.”
actual_quote: I mean, I can tell you have some black in you.

caption: Colleague at work commenting on the worthiness of my university degree. Made me feel angry.
quote: “Well, of course life is easy for you, you’re Malay. It’s not like you need to be smart to get a scholarship.”
actual_quote: Well, of course life is easy for you, you’re Malay. It’s not like you need to be smart to get a scholarship.

caption: “Gah! A Muslim with a knife! Terror!”
quote:
“Gah! A Muslim with a knife! Terror!”
After (Canadian) Thanksgiving dinner with friends from my graduate  studies program (whom I used to think of as my family away from home,  until this sort of thing kept happening). Made me feel like I’ll  never escape the harm of so-called well-meaning privileged people who  fail to recognize that being ironic about racism can still reproduce it.

caption: When I told her that I was trying to fill that role, she asked me if I’d ever been a boy.  I’m a trans guy, closeted, and I’m trying to do the best I can to be a big brother.  Her comment made me feel inadequate and ashamed of my genetic history.
quote: “(My teenaged brother) needs a man to explain this stuff to him.”
actual_quote: (My teenaged brother) needs a man to explain this stuff to him.

caption: Riding my bike home from work, the kid next door, without looking, almost backs his car into me.  I think, Hey, new driver, I’ll just point out that he should be more careful when backing out.
quote:
Riding my bike home from work, the kid next door, without looking, almost backs his car into me.  I think, Hey, new driver, I’ll just point out that he should be more careful when backing out.
He says, “Well, you need to lose some weight, anyway!” and drives away.  I just stand there thinking that, well, yeah, but what does that have to do with your bad driving?

caption: My friend, in reference to his drunk friend hitting on every girl in the vicinity. On my Saturday night out.
quote: “It’s okay, he won’t bother you. He doesn’t like black girls.”
actual_quote: It’s okay, he won’t bother you. He doesn’t like black girls.

caption: While it’s never our intention to cause feelings of invalidation, we haven’t been able to post every one we get! We get hundreds of submissions per week, and to keep our blog sustainable, we can only post so many during that time.But we also choose not to post some submissions that we receive. For the purposes of this site, hate crimes and slurs - though incredibly hurtful - don’t always apply. Anecdotes that don’t illustrate an exercise of power and privilege or lack appropriate context/details also don’t work for us. Most submissions are fine, but we just have so many!
quote: What determines which submissions are posted? I have submitted several and never seen them posted. It feels a little slighted and invalidating to offer personal, hurtful examples and not see them approved for reasons I can only guess.

caption: A professor asked the class if anyone knew the transmission pathway of sound to humans. I replied, “The sound waves hit the tympanic membrane which then vibrates the tiny ossciles in the middle ear which then hit the cochlea which sends an action potential to the auditory cortex.” His reply? “You must be a nursing major!”
quote:
A professor asked the class if anyone knew the transmission pathway of sound to humans. I replied, “The sound waves hit the tympanic membrane which then vibrates the tiny ossciles in the middle ear which then hit the cochlea which sends an action potential to the auditory cortex.” His reply? “You must be a nursing major!”
I am a 23 year old female who is studying to pursue a PhD in Cognitive Science. Not that being a nurse is a bad thing, but because I’m a female, I must be a nurse.

caption: I am a 19 year old genderqueer, and as long as I can remember the idea that I would develop breasts made me uncomfortable. Everytime I’ve mentioned the idea of a breast reduction I have been shot down with comments that I would be “ruining my body” or that I have no “real” need for a breast reduction. I feel as though my physical appearance takes precedance over my emotional well-being. I feel dehumanized and isolated.
quote: I am a 19 year old genderqueer, and as long as I can remember the idea that I would develop breasts made me uncomfortable. Everytime I’ve mentioned the idea of a breast reduction I have been shot down with comments that I would be “ruining my body” or that I have no “real” need for a breast reduction. I feel as though my physical appearance takes precedance over my emotional well-being. I feel dehumanized and isolated.

caption: My female friend at lunch the other week. Made me feel like an outcast, awkward, and not a “proper” woman. I’ve also been shouted down by the same person and her husband for saying I don’t believe in marriage and that I’m not sure if I want kids. According to them I “just haven’t met the right man.”
quote: “You’re so weird [insert my name here]! You’re the only other girl I know that likes video games!”
actual_quote: You’re so weird [insert my name here]! You’re the only other girl I know that likes video games!

caption: Anger that inspires action is a great feeling to have.
quote: I hate this but I love this. It makes me so incredibly angry at the world, but it fuels my desire for change.

caption: I listened to a young male in a comic book store reference rape casually, and use the word faggot in a joke, and use the word retarded to describe something stupid. I later referred to something as skanky. I wasn’t sure who was worse here; I don’t think either of us is worse. Just bad.
quote:
I listened to a young male in a comic book store reference rape casually, and use the word faggot in a joke, and use the word retarded to describe something stupid. I later referred to something as skanky. I wasn’t sure who was worse here; I don’t think either of us is worse. Just bad.
I felt angry, but also powerless and afraid to address the issue for fear of being called out, and blind for casually using a gendered slur myself. I am 23 & male.

caption: Bitch Media | “Microaggressions: Because it IS a Big Deal”
quote:
Bitch Media | “Microaggressions: Because it IS a Big Deal”
A post about this project! Check out their blog, too.

caption: In a meeting of department chairs (nearly all men), one professor disdainfully refers to “The Southwest Needlepoint Journal” (a publication he invents as an example of worthless research). I don’t do needlepoint, but there are plenty of women in his department who knit. I guess it didn’t occur to him that someone at the table might see the gendered bias of his example. I’m 41 & e’s 60-something. We’re at a 4-year university. Made me feel sad.
quote: In a meeting of department chairs (nearly all men), one professor disdainfully refers to “The Southwest Needlepoint Journal” (a publication he invents as an example of worthless research). I don’t do needlepoint, but there are plenty of women in his department who knit. I guess it didn’t occur to him that someone at the table might see the gendered bias of his example. I’m 41 & e’s 60-something. We’re at a 4-year university. Made me feel sad.

caption: My mother-in-law telling me what a relative I had just met thought of me. I wanted to crawl under a rock
quote: “She thought you were wonderful and not as fat as everyone had told her.”
actual_quote: She thought you were wonderful and not as fat as everyone had told her.

caption: Chatting light-heartedly with a friend about whether Prince William could marry a Catholic (which she is). I joked that it would be cool if he married a Hindu or a Muslim (which I am). She said, “If he can’t marry a Catholic why would he marry a Muslim??” in such a way that made it seem like it would be beyond distasteful and impossible for him to want to marry any Muslim ever.
quote:
Chatting light-heartedly with a friend about whether Prince William could marry a Catholic (which she is). I joked that it would be cool if he married a Hindu or a Muslim (which I am). She said, “If he can’t marry a Catholic why would he marry a Muslim??” in such a way that made it seem like it would be beyond distasteful and impossible for him to want to marry any Muslim ever.
I was just joking around, but her comment made me feel like she’d labelled me and people like me as unloveable, unwanted, and ‘beneath’ Catholics. I am 20 & it made me feel singled out, hurt.

caption: I was going to pay for parking at the new payment machines at my campus (which are confusing, but I had used them before). The older male construction worker asks if I’ve used them, and when I say I have, he still grabs my credit card and does it for me (younger female). Made me feel angry, confused and belittled.
quote: I was going to pay for parking at the new payment machines at my campus (which are confusing, but I had used them before). The older male construction worker asks if I’ve used them, and when I say I have, he still grabs my credit card and does it for me (younger female). Made me feel angry, confused and belittled.

caption: Yes, please do! Click “Contribute” on the side or email us.
quote: Can we make submissions?

caption: Example for workshop on a programming language that my (genderqueer, trans, neither M nor F) partner was taking.
quote: “Say I wanted to categorize the people in this room into boys and girls…”
actual_quote: Say I wanted to categorize the people in this room into boys and girls…

caption: I live in the UK and I’m tired of people yelling out “Ni hao ma!” at me on the streets. I get it, I’m Asian. I know I’m Asian. I don’t need you to yell Mandarin greetings at me to validate my existence. Btw Asia is more than just the Chinese. There exist different ethnic groups in South East Asia. We’re not interchangeable. And I’m not Chinese. Makes me feel annoyed, angry, alienated.
quote: I live in the UK and I’m tired of people yelling out “Ni hao ma!” at me on the streets. I get it, I’m Asian. I know I’m Asian. I don’t need you to yell Mandarin greetings at me to validate my existence. Btw Asia is more than just the Chinese. There exist different ethnic groups in South East Asia. We’re not interchangeable. And I’m not Chinese. Makes me feel annoyed, angry, alienated.

caption: This was said by my fiance’s aunt tonight. I’m 22, cis female, Mexican. Made me feel ashamed, isolated, upset, and angry.
quote: “My daughter said, ‘Mom, I hate Mexicans!’ I told her you can’t judge all Mexicans because of one but, you can say they are all short.”
actual_quote: My daughter said, ‘Mom, I hate Mexicans!’ I told her you can’t judge all Mexicans because of one but, you can say they are all short.

caption: One of my coworkers, who of course never mentions race when white people undertip her. Afterwards, I discovered our lunch special was “Navajo Tacos.”
quote: “Their bill came to $65 and they left me a $1 tip. Indians!”
actual_quote: Their bill came to $65 and they left me a $1 tip. Indians!

caption: Upon meeting a new [gay, cis male] member of my university’s queer organization, he asks me if I am gay. When I say yes, he responds, “I didn’t think you were a lesbian or gay at all. I just thought you were here for the fun of it!” I am a member of the executive board for the queer group, and I am very out and open about my queer identity, but I’m also a femme. Made me feel invisible and invalidated.
quote: Upon meeting a new [gay, cis male] member of my university’s queer organization, he asks me if I am gay. When I say yes, he responds, “I didn’t think you were a lesbian or gay at all. I just thought you were here for the fun of it!” I am a member of the executive board for the queer group, and I am very out and open about my queer identity, but I’m also a femme. Made me feel invisible and invalidated.

caption: My boyfriend, in response to me being upset because a woman at a coffee shop in my neighborhood was raped during a robbery at her workplace. It was a two-hour conversation to convince him that walking around late at night is not “wrong.”
quote: “It’s terrible!  And it’s not like she was doing something wrong, like walking around late at night.”
actual_quote: It’s terrible!  And it’s not like she was doing something wrong, like walking around late at night.

caption: My co-worker at a history textbook publishing house always whispers “historically black” when saying Historically Black College (HBCs).
quote: My co-worker at a history textbook publishing house always whispers “historically black” when saying Historically Black College (HBCs).

caption: My white college roomate when she found out that I was a Classical Music major.
quote: “You’re a white girl in a black girls body.”
actual_quote: You’re a white girl in a black girls body.

caption: Overheard my coworkers laughing and saying something about a “little Asian girl”. I wonder if that’s how they think of me.
quote: Overheard my coworkers laughing and saying something about a “little Asian girl”. I wonder if that’s how they think of me.

caption: American Apparel jumps on the racist bandwagon with its own interpretation of the Hipster Headdress — a sacred array of $14 twist scarves?  Oh, look, you can even take fifteen dollars off the entire costume if you enter the code “NativeAmerican15” upon payment.
quote:
American Apparel jumps on the racist bandwagon with its own interpretation of the Hipster Headdress — a sacred array of $14 twist scarves?  Oh, look, you can even take fifteen dollars off the entire costume if you enter the code “NativeAmerican15” upon payment.

(via )

caption: Taking my money before you give me my coffee — after doing the opposite with every other customer.
quote: Taking my money before you give me my coffee — after doing the opposite with every other customer.

caption: A maintenance man to me, in all seriousness, about a woman he had to help out of a broken elevator who was having a panic attack about it.
quote: “If I had a wife like that, I’d HAVE to beat her.”
actual_quote: If I had a wife like that, I’d HAVE to beat her.

caption: An Asian American man brings his adorable infant daughter to the reception desk. The receptionist, after exchanging pleasantries, says out of nowhere, “I hope you get a son next so you can carry on your family name. I know how important that is to your people.”
quote: An Asian American man brings his adorable infant daughter to the reception desk. The receptionist, after exchanging pleasantries, says out of nowhere, “I hope you get a son next so you can carry on your family name. I know how important that is to your people.”

caption: My mother after I explained to her that I am attracted to other women. Made me feel shamed, confused.
quote: “That’s okay, no judgment. Just, don’t tell anyone yet.”
actual_quote: That’s okay, no judgment. Just, don’t tell anyone yet.

caption: My friend called my birthday cake gay. I told him that that was highly improbable. Because it is a cake. Made me feel momentarily annoyed, but not any less hungry.
quote: My friend called my birthday cake gay. I told him that that was highly improbable. Because it is a cake. Made me feel momentarily annoyed, but not any less hungry.

caption: I am filling out a volunteer form for a local AIDS awareness agency. On one page they ask the applicant to select their “population group”, gender and language spoken at home. You can only select one box. There is no multiethnic/racial category (besides “other”) and male and female are the only options for gender. Apparently it is for “funding purposes only” but for me that only raises more questions.
quote:
I am filling out a volunteer form for a local AIDS awareness agency. On one page they ask the applicant to select their “population group”, gender and language spoken at home. You can only select one box. There is no multiethnic/racial category (besides “other”) and male and female are the only options for gender. Apparently it is for “funding purposes only” but for me that only raises more questions.
Made me feel invisible, powerless to define my own identity.

caption: A straight married woman college-aged acquaintance on Facebook. Made me feel fetishized as a gay person; invisible as a lesbian.
quote: “wants a gay male friend… I miss having one, gay people are so much fun! :D”
actual_quote: wants a gay male friend… I miss having one, gay people are so much fun! :D

caption: My partner, a black man, to me, a black woman.
quote: “Your point that racism and sexism are at similar levels for me is a bit extreme… that is just what I’m saying.”
actual_quote: Your point that racism and sexism are at similar levels for me is a bit extreme… that is just what I’m saying.

caption: Every time I (female) tell someone that my boyfriend moved across the country with me so that I can go to law school, they tell me that he is “so sweet” and that I “am so lucky to have someone who would  do that for [me].” When a male student’s wife or girlfriend has done the same thing, it isn’t sweet or lucky at all.
quote:
Every time I (female) tell someone that my boyfriend moved across the country with me so that I can go to law school, they tell me that he is “so sweet” and that I “am so lucky to have someone who would  do that for [me].” When a male student’s wife or girlfriend has done the same thing, it isn’t sweet or lucky at all.
Made me feel like I have to explain why I deserve a devoted partner, like I have to explain why he came with me.

caption: Coming out as bisexual to my mother, a lesbian: “I don’t think you’re bisexual because I can’t picture you actually being with another woman. Or having a relationship with a woman."
quote:
Coming out as bisexual to my mother, a lesbian: “I don’t think you’re bisexual because I can’t picture you actually being with another woman. Or having a relationship with a woman."
Made me feel like I was being erased, silenced, belittled. I was gaybashed throughout my childhood/preteen years because of my lesbian mom, so for her to say this to me was heartbreaking. I thought she would understand.

caption: At Sundance, someone criticized Justin Lin for his portrayal of Asians in “Better Luck Tomorrow,” implying that it didn’t fit the stereotype of Asians as hardworking, obedient students.
quote:
At Sundance, someone criticized Justin Lin for his portrayal of Asians in “Better Luck Tomorrow,” implying that it didn’t fit the stereotype of Asians as hardworking, obedient students.
Response: Roger Ebert got on a chair and “… went on to say that Asian-Americans should be free to take on any types of roles they choose without fear of misrepresenting the entire community.”
Edit: Here’s the video of the comments Roger Ebert made.

caption: Great-aunt: I don’t think that she should be dating a black man. It’s just not right. [turns to me] I want you to know that I’m not racist. I just want my granddaughter to end up with the right colour.
quote:
Great-aunt: I don’t think that she should be dating a black man. It’s just not right. [turns to me] I want you to know that I’m not racist. I just want my granddaughter to end up with the right colour.
Made me feel angry & confused.

caption: Random men on the street who feel like they can waste my time while I’m on my way to work. This happens to me almost every day in NYC. Makes me feel objectified.
quote: “Hey girl! Come talk to me!”
actual_quote: Hey girl! Come talk to me!

caption: A classmate of mine. We are both cis women; she doesn’t know I’m queer. Made me feel ashamed, like my sexuality is a joke.
quote: “I’m not gay, but I’ll sometimes, you know, flirt with other girls or pretend to make out with them because that’s funny.”
actual_quote: I’m not gay, but I’ll sometimes, you know, flirt with other girls or pretend to make out with them because that’s funny.

caption: My boyfriend’s cousin to her sister’s 17-month-old son. Made me feel sad & annoyed.
quote: “That’s a girl’s toy.”
actual_quote: That’s a girl’s toy.

caption: Said to me by the black Dominican-American boyfriend of my biracial (black/white) friend visiting us during Spring Break. I am a 20 year old black American woman with naturally kinky-curly hair. Made me feel shocked, ugly, unimportant.
quote: ““You could pass for Dominican; some of them are really dark and have bad hair like you. Luckily, I got the GOOD hair”.”
actual_quote: “You could pass for Dominican; some of them are really dark and have bad hair like you. Luckily, I got the GOOD hair”.

caption: Said to me, a closeted bisexual cis-woman, by a very religious friend. Her tone made it clear that even if she’d wouldn’t tell someone they were going to hell, she sure believed they were. Made me feel erased, judged and very sad.
quote: “I think it’s mean to tell someone they’re going to hell. I mean, I believe that men and women were made for each other, but my roommate’s a lesbian, and I don’t tell her I think she’s going to hell.”
actual_quote: I think it’s mean to tell someone they’re going to hell. I mean, I believe that men and women were made for each other, but my roommate’s a lesbian, and I don’t tell her I think she’s going to hell.

caption: Random 40-something straight cis-female, online, trying to be progressive about queer issues. Furious and marginalized - I’m queer and I don’t have a choice about who I find attractive or an alternative to being who I am. Made me feel sad and hopeless - she so obviously meant well and got so much approval for her statement. This is progress?
quote: “I’m 100% supportive of my daughter’s choice of an alternative lifestyle!”
actual_quote: I’m 100% supportive of my daughter’s choice of an alternative lifestyle!

caption: “Ask your grandparents about Nixon…” and
quote:
“Ask your grandparents about Nixon…” and
“When your parents were in school, they heard about [insert US policy] daily.”
At school, by different teachers. Makes me feel frustrated because they assume everyone’s parents grew up in the US, and that as real “Americans” we’ve been here for generations. These were offhanded remarks, but they made me feel isolated for having parents who are immigrants.

caption: An African American co-worker at a team dinner.
quote: ““I would never, ever hire someone with a "black” name on their resume.  I wouldn’t even interview them.“”
actual_quote: “I would never, ever hire someone with a "black” name on their resume.  I wouldn’t even interview them.“

caption: My parents say they’ll love me even if I turn out to be a lesbian. I’m bisexual, I’ve told them. Every time I take a guy home, they’re relieved. When I date a girl, they accuse me of not knowing myself. Throughout adolescence, made me feel invalidated.
quote: My parents say they’ll love me even if I turn out to be a lesbian. I’m bisexual, I’ve told them. Every time I take a guy home, they’re relieved. When I date a girl, they accuse me of not knowing myself. Throughout adolescence, made me feel invalidated.
“Don’t you think it would be better if gay people adopted the older kids that nobody else wants, leaving the babies for normal people?”
actual_quote: Don’t you think it would be better if gay people adopted the older kids that nobody else wants, leaving the babies for normal people?

caption: Ad presumably targeting computer programmers on the red line of the Boston subway system, which connects Boston to Harvard and MIT. The picture is a bit blurry, but the graffiti says, “My mom has a PhD in computer science.”

I’m assigned to a counselor to match scholarships to my interests. We go through applications one by one, and she hesitates at a gay and lesbian scholarship, finally skipping to the next application without saying a word. I take the application. She looks pointedly at me and underlines “Gay and Lesbian” on the form. I say yes. Made me feel: angry that queer students are scrutinized and ignored; guilty that I mostly present as straight and benefit from straight privilege.
quote: I’m assigned to a counselor to match scholarships to my interests. We go through applications one by one, and she hesitates at a gay and lesbian scholarship, finally skipping to the next application without saying a word. I take the application. She looks pointedly at me and underlines “Gay and Lesbian” on the form. I say yes. Made me feel: angry that queer students are scrutinized and ignored; guilty that I mostly present as straight and benefit from straight privilege.

caption: My (white) stepfather regarding one of his renters. Made me ashamed because I’m Hispanic, too.
quote: “He was pretty dark, so he’s probably not paying rent because he’s an illegal and doesn’t know English.”
actual_quote: He was pretty dark, so he’s probably not paying rent because he’s an illegal and doesn’t know English.

caption: Said to me, a person of Southeast Asian heritage who experiences the effects of racial profiling every time I travel. Made me feel mocked, stereotyped, and misunderstood.
quote: “I support racial profiling one hundred percent. I mean - let’s be serious here - how many white terrorists do you see?”
actual_quote: I support racial profiling one hundred percent. I mean - let’s be serious here - how many white terrorists do you see?

caption: On a school camping trip, the was a mix up and someone brought a two man tent along. I ended up up sharing it with another guy in my group. He is gay, and I am bi. All the other guys started making jokes about us having sex that night. Made me feel embarrassed and uncomfortable looking my tent partner in the eyes.
quote: On a school camping trip, the was a mix up and someone brought a two man tent along. I ended up up sharing it with another guy in my group. He is gay, and I am bi. All the other guys started making jokes about us having sex that night. Made me feel embarrassed and uncomfortable looking my tent partner in the eyes.

caption: The Simpsons makes a skit about Precious.

In 3rd grade, when asked what I wanted to be when I grew up, I said President. My teacher said “You’ll never be President, you’re a girl.” At the time I didn’t realize how offensive her comment was, but now all I want to do is prove her wrong.
quote: In 3rd grade, when asked what I wanted to be when I grew up, I said President. My teacher said “You’ll never be President, you’re a girl.” At the time I didn’t realize how offensive her comment was, but now all I want to do is prove her wrong.

caption: microprogressions:
quote:
microprogressions:
My university is holding a fashion show. There are no weight requirements to enter, and the program’s goal is to discourage fat shaming. At the registration table, there is a mirror. Registrants are encouraged to write a positive message (one entrant writes “I’m proud of my curves!”, for instance) on a sticky note and place it on the mirror.
(via )

caption: I was in NY yesterday, meeting my future in-laws for the first time when my fiance’s father said this. He is a white man in his 70s. I am a 22 year old biracial black cis woman …who lives in Vermont. It made me feel furious, invisible, helpless, rejected.
quote: “You know why Vermont is so safe, don’t you? There’s hardly any minorities in it!”
actual_quote: You know why Vermont is so safe, don’t you? There’s hardly any minorities in it!

caption: Years ago I used the word ‘nigga’ as part of a greeting and generally hated feminism. Bonus: I’m white and female. I just want to apologize for everyone who put up with me while I was stupid. This changed for me when I learned it was okay to be angry at men who told me to smile, and when people assumed I was my lesbian roommate’s new girlfriend after I cut my hair and gained weight. Sorry’s never good enough but I do what I can to help now.
quote: Years ago I used the word ‘nigga’ as part of a greeting and generally hated feminism. Bonus: I’m white and female. I just want to apologize for everyone who put up with me while I was stupid. This changed for me when I learned it was okay to be angry at men who told me to smile, and when people assumed I was my lesbian roommate’s new girlfriend after I cut my hair and gained weight. Sorry’s never good enough but I do what I can to help now.

caption: Teenage boy to me a me, a 20 year-old woman at a Crystal Castles concert. Made me feel objectified and dehumanized.
quote: “You wore a skirt to this show? What, are you trying to get raped?”
actual_quote: You wore a skirt to this show? What, are you trying to get raped?

caption: My mother was looking at a photography project with twenty pictures of gay and trans identified people.
quote: “Are there really that many gay people?!”
actual_quote: Are there really that many gay people?!

quote: We have a Facebook Page! Feel free to head on over and like it. :)

caption: A white job-training counselor speaking to a young man of color about his upcoming job-interview.
quote: “You’ll be fine! Just talk like a white person.”
actual_quote: You’ll be fine! Just talk like a white person.

caption: I am a 19 year-old bisexual woman and an RA at my college. Among many other events that I planned last fall for my residents, I included two that involved LGBT issues. My supervisor said, “I know that’s like your ‘thing,’ but please branch out and do other kinds of events.” Made me feel misunderstood, marginalized, and unable to stand up for what I believe in.
quote: I am a 19 year-old bisexual woman and an RA at my college. Among many other events that I planned last fall for my residents, I included two that involved LGBT issues. My supervisor said, “I know that’s like your ‘thing,’ but please branch out and do other kinds of events.” Made me feel misunderstood, marginalized, and unable to stand up for what I believe in.

caption: I’m an Asian woman, he is white Australian male. During a conversation on the phone. Made me feel insulted and perplexed at his stupidity.
quote: “You guys can blame racism and sexism if you fail. If you’re a white male and you fail at life, what can you blame?”
actual_quote: You guys can blame racism and sexism if you fail. If you’re a white male and you fail at life, what can you blame?

caption: Wheeling down the road in my neat little sporty wheelchair, and a group of men sticking their heads out of the betting shop door to  clap at me and cheer me on. Made me feel patronised and mildly unsafe.
quote: Wheeling down the road in my neat little sporty wheelchair, and a group of men sticking their heads out of the betting shop door to  clap at me and cheer me on. Made me feel patronised and mildly unsafe.

caption: People continually poke fun at me for having bad  driving skills simply because I am an Asian woman. In reality, most people I know failed their driving tests at least once, whereas I passed my first time with not a single point off.
quote: People continually poke fun at me for having bad  driving skills simply because I am an Asian woman. In reality, most people I know failed their driving tests at least once, whereas I passed my first time with not a single point off.

caption: Donate
quote:
Donate
Dear friends and allies,
This project’s work has always demanded a bit of time and, recently, a bit of funding as well. Please think about donating any amount you can to help us keep this project growing! (Literally any amount of currency could help out a lot - we’ve been paying out of pocket for the tumblr template and domain.)
You can click here to make a donation via PayPal.
All of our proceeds will go toward maintaining the site and, hopefully in the future (with your input!) community outreach. Please check the #meta tag to see what we are doing outside of the blog!
Love, Microaggressions

caption: Student referring to rural Chinese children featured in an ethnographic article in my university women’s studies class in March 2011.
quote: “It’s just so sad. It’s like… how can they even begin to think about gender when they have all of this class stratification. I can’t imagine what it would be like to that kind of division in *our* society.”
actual_quote: It’s just so sad. It’s like… how can they even begin to think about gender when they have all of this class stratification. I can’t imagine what it would be like to that kind of division in *our* society.

caption: I was in court representing a developmentally disabled client and the judge kept equating disabled people with children. It was incredibly condescending and paternalistic. He kept acting  as if he was her protector and the only one who cared about her well-being, when he did nothing for her benefit. Made me feel powerless to correct this authority figure.
quote: I was in court representing a developmentally disabled client and the judge kept equating disabled people with children. It was incredibly condescending and paternalistic. He kept acting  as if he was her protector and the only one who cared about her well-being, when he did nothing for her benefit. Made me feel powerless to correct this authority figure.

caption: Said to me when (I, a female medical student) entered the exam room of this elderly man to discuss his diabetes.
quote: “You must be new, they keep getting such cute nurses!  I heard a medical student was coming in to discuss my medications with me, where is he?”
actual_quote: You must be new, they keep getting such cute nurses!  I heard a medical student was coming in to discuss my medications with me, where is he?

caption: Older male aviation worker while I was ordering a small frozen yogurt to go with my meal at a healthy food/snacks place. I’m pretty thin and get a lot of comments about it. This one was the creepiest. I was 18 and traveling home for spring break through Dallas-Ft. Worth Airport. I felt irked, awkward and really weird about eating some froyo. Like I was being leered at.
quote: “How do you keep your schoolgirl figure?”
actual_quote: How do you keep your schoolgirl figure?

caption: A well-dressed, male presenting university student. Made me feel like wanting to teach more than ever before.
quote: “If I did do Teach For America I’d probably be placed in the Mississippi Delta and would just end up being like, ‘OK kids! Go outside and make some mud pies to prepare for your future careers.’”
actual_quote: If I did do Teach For America I’d probably be placed in the Mississippi Delta and would just end up being like, ‘OK kids! Go outside and make some mud pies to prepare for your future careers.’

caption: The lecturer in a university lecture mentioned how the second-wave feminist movement was criticised by black feminists for privileging white, middle-class women. The white middle class guy behind me scoffed and said, “There’s no pleasing some people,” loud enough for everyone to hear.
quote: The lecturer in a university lecture mentioned how the second-wave feminist movement was criticised by black feminists for privileging white, middle-class women. The white middle class guy behind me scoffed and said, “There’s no pleasing some people,” loud enough for everyone to hear.

caption: Said to me, a cis woman, countless times when I’ve been angry.
quote: “Are you on your period?”
actual_quote: Are you on your period?

caption: My friend discussing racist comments made by another friend. Made me sad, angry, exasperated, ashamed.
quote: “There’s a difference between a racist and someone who tells racist jokes.”
actual_quote: There’s a difference between a racist and someone who tells racist jokes.

caption: Said to me by someone in my class. I am bisexual. Made me feel  angry and frusterated, like I had to pick one or the other.
quote: “How come you act so gay but you’re like the straightest guy ever?”
actual_quote: How come you act so gay but you’re like the straightest guy ever?

caption: White American Gender Studies professor in a War Narratives class. A Romanian citizen and immigrant, I was crying.
quote: “Eastern Europeans are trashy. I know, because when my Eastern European brother-in-law got married, women at his reception wore fishnet tights and black lace gloves. This hyper-sexual culture is one of the main causes of the sex trafficking problem in Eastern Europe. We all, as Westerners, have difficulty understanding this type of culture.”
actual_quote: Eastern Europeans are trashy. I know, because when my Eastern European brother-in-law got married, women at his reception wore fishnet tights and black lace gloves. This hyper-sexual culture is one of the main causes of the sex trafficking problem in Eastern Europe. We all, as Westerners, have difficulty understanding this type of culture.

caption: In high school, my college counselor implored me to take the Spanish SAT II and apply to specific small liberal arts colleges that have “great financial aid programs for impoverished minorities”, despite the fact that my parents are doctors and, as a Pacific Islander, I speak very little Spanish.
quote: In high school, my college counselor implored me to take the Spanish SAT II and apply to specific small liberal arts colleges that have “great financial aid programs for impoverished minorities”, despite the fact that my parents are doctors and, as a Pacific Islander, I speak very little Spanish.

caption: I walk into a gas station market in California with about ten of my Latina/o and black high school students to buy snacks for our college road trip, and within five minutes, we hear, “SECURITY CHECK ON ALL AISLES.” We were all people of color.
quote: I walk into a gas station market in California with about ten of my Latina/o and black high school students to buy snacks for our college road trip, and within five minutes, we hear, “SECURITY CHECK ON ALL AISLES.” We were all people of color.

caption: Friend, to me, 21 and gay.
quote: “Look at all those hot chicks. Doesn’t that make you want to at least try being straight?”
actual_quote: Look at all those hot chicks. Doesn’t that make you want to at least try being straight?

caption: News
quote:
News
* We’ve just reached 3,000 Tumblr followers!
* As you may have noticed, our URL has changed. You can now find us simply at http://microaggressions.com. If you have any problems accessing our new site, please let us know.
* We think it’s a good time to publish a F.A.Q., for those of you curious about our project. If you have any questions you would like answered, please ask us at http://microaggressions.com/ask.
* We are always interested in expanding this project. Some of our ideas have included: working with educators and classrooms, designing a visual art piece or space (virtual or physical), and other activisms. If you have any ideas, talk to us at editors@microaggressions.com. We’d like to work with you!

caption: I asked for advanced science in 9th grade because I wanted my courses to count towards college admission. My high school counselor said, “Oh, but  you’re not going to college.”  I was 14 and in east Los Angeles. I am Latina and about to finish my PhD.
quote: I asked for advanced science in 9th grade because I wanted my courses to count towards college admission. My high school counselor said, “Oh, but  you’re not going to college.”  I was 14 and in east Los Angeles. I am Latina and about to finish my PhD.

caption: Everyone at the hospital where I work wears scrubs, so it is sometimes hard to tell what any particular person’s role is. Invariably when a new Latina woman shows up, someone will ask if she’s a new housekeeper. And usually she’s a doctor.
quote: Everyone at the hospital where I work wears scrubs, so it is sometimes hard to tell what any particular person’s role is. Invariably when a new Latina woman shows up, someone will ask if she’s a new housekeeper. And usually she’s a doctor.

caption: I’m a queer but straight-looking butch-loving femme with a picture of my butch wife at my desk. In a diversity awareness course. I wish the facilitator had picked up on it and addressed it.
quote: “There’s nothing wrong with a woman having a picture of her girlfriend at your desk. I mean, everyone likes to have pictures of their loved ones at their workplace. Unless, *giggles* she’s butch! Hahaha!”
actual_quote: There’s nothing wrong with a woman having a picture of her girlfriend at your desk. I mean, everyone likes to have pictures of their loved ones at their workplace. Unless, *giggles* she’s butch! Hahaha!

caption: A white guy in my grade to me, an Asian female, when I said I didn’t think architecture was interesting.
quote: “That’s because you’re a girl; you don’t get what it’s all about.”
actual_quote: That’s because you’re a girl; you don’t get what it’s all about.

caption: Said to me, a white Latino, in New York when I was 30 years old.
quote: “You know how how Latinos are… they aren’t as motivated.”
actual_quote: You know how how Latinos are… they aren’t as motivated.

caption: Miss Universe 1996, in reference to her Twitter post calling North and South Korea “the Chinas”.
quote: “We call Chinese to everyone who looks Asian. That’s what I meant.”
actual_quote: We call Chinese to everyone who looks Asian. That’s what I meant.

caption: Youtube: ‘Hir’ Poem - Brave New Voices
My grandma after dinner. My parents just sat there silently. Made me feel like crying.
quote: “You don’t need any dessert. You could live off your body fat for three months.”
actual_quote: You don’t need any dessert. You could live off your body fat for three months.

caption: I go to a store with my girlfriend and she stands next to me. As I pay for my goods, the clerk always strikes up a conversation with her and not me, despite me being the one paying. I am completely ignored even during my attempts to make conversation. The clerk even goes so far as to bid my girlfriend goodbye. We’re an interracial (lesbian couple) - she’s white and I’m Indian. This happens every day we go shopping together. Makes me feel invisible, pointless, like an accessory.
quote: I go to a store with my girlfriend and she stands next to me. As I pay for my goods, the clerk always strikes up a conversation with her and not me, despite me being the one paying. I am completely ignored even during my attempts to make conversation. The clerk even goes so far as to bid my girlfriend goodbye. We’re an interracial (lesbian couple) - she’s white and I’m Indian. This happens every day we go shopping together. Makes me feel invisible, pointless, like an accessory.

caption: As I was complaining to an aquaintance about an anti-Muslim teacher. Made me feel hurt, angry, shocked.
quote: “Well face it, whenever you see a guy with a rag on his head on the street you get a bit nervous, you know?”
actual_quote: Well face it, whenever you see a guy with a rag on his head on the street you get a bit nervous, you know?

caption: My mom is very supportive of my little sister’s relationship with her boyfriend but says I can’t know yet and doesn’t want me to find a girlfriend because I’m gay. I’m 17 and my sister is 16.
quote: My mom is very supportive of my little sister’s relationship with her boyfriend but says I can’t know yet and doesn’t want me to find a girlfriend because I’m gay. I’m 17 and my sister is 16.

caption: High school students demonstrating an jump-rope chant they used to use. Made me frustrated that, by 18, my students still didn’t see anything wrong with this.
quote:
“Hey mister mailman,
Do you duty!
Here comes the lady with the African booty!
She can do the pom-poms
She can do the splits.
Most of all, she can kiss, kiss, kiss!”
actual_quote:
Hey mister mailman,
Do you duty!
Here comes the lady with the African booty!
She can do the pom-poms
She can do the splits.
Most of all, she can kiss, kiss, kiss!

caption: Male friend and Gender Studies major, to a group of girls, all of whom have struggled with disordered eating and body image.
quote: “I just think that the feminist movement glorifies obesity. It should focus on being healthy, because what it’s doing now is just as bad as the mainstream media!”
actual_quote: I just think that the feminist movement glorifies obesity. It should focus on being healthy, because what it’s doing now is just as bad as the mainstream media!

caption: Friend from the same rural, blue-collar (in which I represented 33% of the non-white student body) town I’d lived in since kindergarten, in response to a Chinese boy moving into our town.
quote: “You and [the only other Asian kid in the school] should go to homecoming together. I mean, he’s cute, isn’t he? I wouldn’t know, I’m not Asian…”
actual_quote: You and [the only other Asian kid in the school] should go to homecoming together. I mean, he’s cute, isn’t he? I wouldn’t know, I’m not Asian…

caption: We’re in the process of moving onto http://www.microaggressions.com! Please hold tight!
quote: We’re in the process of moving onto http://www.microaggressions.com! Please hold tight!

caption: My mother while talking about my argumentative paper about microaggressions - “they” being other races, sexualities, genders, etc. Made me feel confused, shocked.
quote: “Don’t you ever think that they only look for ways to be offended?”
actual_quote: Don’t you ever think that they only look for ways to be offended?

caption: My liberal white male live-in partner of 15 years. I am a white woman, 30s, home, candlelit dinner that I cooked for our night together. Made me feel blindsided, nauseous, unsafe, sad.
quote: “I wouldn’t call myself a feminist anymore.  I think I’m a realist now. I think maybe we’re in denial and that men and women aren’t necessarily capable of the same things. Maybe women need to make some sacrifices.”
actual_quote: I wouldn’t call myself a feminist anymore.  I think I’m a realist now. I think maybe we’re in denial and that men and women aren’t necessarily capable of the same things. Maybe women need to make some sacrifices.

caption: A black girl snapped at me when she asked me for help on some calculus homework and I said I don’t know how. I hate math and can’t wrap my head around higher math. Made me feel angry and ready to fight.
quote: “You should know this! You’re Asian!”
actual_quote: You should know this! You’re Asian!

caption: Partner in our firm (i.e. my boss) re: another woman associate and I potentially attending an outside event.
quote: “You know, it’s just - if two women walk in, it kind of discredits us as a firm.”
actual_quote: You know, it’s just - if two women walk in, it kind of discredits us as a firm.

caption: I’m among a group of Chinese Americans at a Chinese restaurant for my mother’s birthday dinner. Seated next to us are a group of white couples. The Chinese waiter ask them if they would like “forks” but because of his accent, it sounds like the f-word. They burst out laughing in his face and don’t stop for a couple of minutes. Later, one of them orders a Chinese beer, a Tsingtao. The guys start loudly echoing the pronounciation in their most exaggerated “Chinese” accent: “SING DOW SING DOW SING DOW.” They clown around, picking at the food and  trying out their accents the rest of the meal. I like how Chinese people can be made to feel uncomfortable even in a Chinese restaurant, eating Chinese food.
quote: I’m among a group of Chinese Americans at a Chinese restaurant for my mother’s birthday dinner. Seated next to us are a group of white couples. The Chinese waiter ask them if they would like “forks” but because of his accent, it sounds like the f-word. They burst out laughing in his face and don’t stop for a couple of minutes. Later, one of them orders a Chinese beer, a Tsingtao. The guys start loudly echoing the pronounciation in their most exaggerated “Chinese” accent: “SING DOW SING DOW SING DOW.” They clown around, picking at the food and  trying out their accents the rest of the meal. I like how Chinese people can be made to feel uncomfortable even in a Chinese restaurant, eating Chinese food.

caption: Any time a male stranger refers to me, a petite woman, as  cute, tiny, adorable, or wants to pick me up - and how they’ll laugh when I tell them it’s inappropriate. Makes me angry, frustrated.
quote: Any time a male stranger refers to me, a petite woman, as  cute, tiny, adorable, or wants to pick me up - and how they’ll laugh when I tell them it’s inappropriate. Makes me angry, frustrated.

caption: I was watching a documentary for a class and my roommate’s boyfriend saw what I was watching. This made me, as a gay woman, feel that my own dorm room wasn’t safe from homophobia.
quote: “Ew, why are there two black guys kissing?”
actual_quote: Ew, why are there two black guys kissing?

caption: Oh yeah, sorry, I forgot disabled people can’t be those things. My bad. My Chinese professor pulled me aside after class on March 15, 2011. I’m a 22 year-old college student with an invisible disability. Made me feel othered and silenced.
quote: “I was so surprised when you handed me this letter [from the school’s disability office, requesting accommodations]! You are so smart and so pretty!”
actual_quote: I was so surprised when you handed me this letter [from the school’s disability office, requesting accommodations]! You are so smart and so pretty!

caption: Young white college student from Louisiana who had just finished talking about how awful and scary the KKK and racism are. Made me feel terrified and alienated.
quote: “But there’s a difference between “black people” and “niggers”. You shouldn’t deny that until you’ve been to the South and have seen the difference.”
actual_quote: But there’s a difference between “black people” and “niggers”. You shouldn’t deny that until you’ve been to the South and have seen the difference.

caption: Made me feel isolated.
quote: “Men can’t be raped. If you’re a man you consent by default.”
actual_quote: Men can’t be raped. If you’re a man you consent by default.

caption: Multiple female friends on multiple occasions, after I’ve explained that my body is a mess after fighting off an eating disorder and I now have difficulty affording enough food, staying full, and keeping weight on. Makes me feel frustrated, confused, and angry at my own body.
quote: “But still, you’re so skinny! I wish I had your metabolism!”
actual_quote: But still, you’re so skinny! I wish I had your metabolism!

caption: A man I’d just met to me outside a bar in response to one of the (many) reasons I would not sleep with his friend. Made me feel angry, hurt, trivialized, commodified.
quote: “So, are you a lesbian because you are plus sized, or because some man treated you wrong?”
actual_quote: So, are you a lesbian because you are plus sized, or because some man treated you wrong?

caption: Middle school art teacher, passing out paint for an art project. Made me feel shocked, isolated, hurt. Rural middle school with a 99% white population, March 7, 2011. Made me feel shocked, isolated, and hurt.
quote: “Who needs skin-colored paint? Ok. Now who needs paint that isn’t skin-colored, like purple or brown?”
actual_quote: Who needs skin-colored paint? Ok. Now who needs paint that isn’t skin-colored, like purple or brown?

caption: I am driving my friend home.  He asks me to “put some black people music on” and grabs my iPhone to search for songs.  I have hundreds of songs to choose from that are written, produced, or performed by black people. He goes to the rap genre, sees only 20 songs and exclaims, “This is all the  black people music you have?  You should be ashamed of yourself!" I’m a black cis woman and he’s an Asian cis man. We live in Toronto, Ontario. Made me feel defensive and insecure, like my blackness was somehow lacking authenticity.
quote: I am driving my friend home.  He asks me to “put some black people music on” and grabs my iPhone to search for songs.  I have hundreds of songs to choose from that are written, produced, or performed by black people. He goes to the rap genre, sees only 20 songs and exclaims, “This is all the  black people music you have?  You should be ashamed of yourself!" I’m a black cis woman and he’s an Asian cis man. We live in Toronto, Ontario. Made me feel defensive and insecure, like my blackness was somehow lacking authenticity.

caption: My coworker to me after it came out that I hadn’t had a girlfriend for a while. He’s a white male, and as I stood there trying to think of a response, he grabbed three other white male coworkers and expressed his disbelief to them. They all agreed with him and stood in a semi circle around me, laughing. Made me feel like my sexuality was freakish, a joke.
quote: “How can you go so long without having sex?! You’re a BLACK GUY.”
actual_quote: How can you go so long without having sex?! You’re a BLACK GUY.

caption: When #waystopissoffafatperson was trending on Twitter. I just feel sick.

I roll down my window to ask for directions in a white neighborhood. The white jogger I ask just gives me a mean stare. He doesn’t offer directions, he doesn’t say he doesn’t know the way. He hears me and he doesn’t even walk away. He just stares at me until I drive off.
quote: I roll down my window to ask for directions in a white neighborhood. The white jogger I ask just gives me a mean stare. He doesn’t offer directions, he doesn’t say he doesn’t know the way. He hears me and he doesn’t even walk away. He just stares at me until I drive off.

caption: New York Times about the gang-rape of an 11-year-old girl.
quote: “They said she dressed older than her age, wearing makeup and fashions more appropriate to a woman in her 20s. She would hang out with teenage boys at a playground, some said.”
actual_quote: They said she dressed older than her age, wearing makeup and fashions more appropriate to a woman in her 20s. She would hang out with teenage boys at a playground, some said.

caption: My mother explaining to my father something she had heard on the news that day. Made me confused, annoyed, angry.
quote: “They hit a state trooper head on. And they were both illegals. Well, I don’t know if they were illegals, but they had illegal sounding names.”
actual_quote: They hit a state trooper head on. And they were both illegals. Well, I don’t know if they were illegals, but they had illegal sounding names.

caption: Some insightful points about the response to the “Asians in the Library” Youtube video.
quote: re/write:: thoughts on a. wallace & asian am response

caption: People call me “fobby” when they find out I received an education before high school in an Asian country. When I make a grammatical mistake, pronounce something wrong or with an accent, or use the words or references that aren’t American, people say, “You’re so fobby,” usually with a mocking tone as if it’s just another way of saying “you’re not cool enough.” I get this daily since the day I landed in America. Makes me upset, like I don’t belong.
quote: People call me “fobby” when they find out I received an education before high school in an Asian country. When I make a grammatical mistake, pronounce something wrong or with an accent, or use the words or references that aren’t American, people say, “You’re so fobby,” usually with a mocking tone as if it’s just another way of saying “you’re not cool enough.” I get this daily since the day I landed in America. Makes me upset, like I don’t belong.

caption: Spoken to me, a young black man, as I went to board my train in first class. Two white gentlemen boarded before me and the attendant said nothing and made no attempt to check their tickets.
quote: “Where do you think you’re going?”
actual_quote: Where do you think you’re going?

caption: The many Facebook statuses after the 2011 tsunami. Made me feel sick, crushed, and ashamed of America. (Click the image to enlarge.)
I was having drinks with three male friends, late 2010. Made me feel more sad than anything, because I actually thought this guy was alright until he said that.
quote: “You’re the only girl here. We could take you off somewhere and rape you.”
actual_quote: You’re the only girl here. We could take you off somewhere and rape you.

caption: Youtube: “Asians in the Library” | Only because about 10 of you sent this in to us. It (more than) borders on macroaggressive. Does the fact that it went viral mean something good for the state of resistance? Let’s discuss in the comments.
“I AM NOT YOUR AVERAGE GIRL"

I’m watching a news clip about the death of a transgender woman in Arkansas. She was shot and dragged along the road by a car in what some believe to be a transphobic attack. Even though she was “openly transgender”, they keep referring to her with  male pronouns. Made me angry that even in death they could not respect her as the woman she was.
quote: I’m watching a news clip about the death of a transgender woman in Arkansas. She was shot and dragged along the road by a car in what some believe to be a transphobic attack. Even though she was “openly transgender”, they keep referring to her with  male pronouns. Made me angry that even in death they could not respect her as the woman she was.

caption: Forever 21, “Indian Chief Ring”

The kids in my class played Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles on the playground at recess.  No matter how many of us there were, I was  never allowed to be a Turtle. They always made me be April. We were all 5 year-olds and in kindergarten. I felt confused and hurt. This was my first experience with sexism and tokenism.
quote: The kids in my class played Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles on the playground at recess.  No matter how many of us there were, I was  never allowed to be a Turtle. They always made me be April. We were all 5 year-olds and in kindergarten. I felt confused and hurt. This was my first experience with sexism and tokenism.

caption: A 14 year-old boy in class to a teacher in her late 20s, patronizingly and without realising how moronic and sexist his comment was. When she told him how serious it was, he shrugged. Girls of the same age said they didn’t understand why it was wrong. “It’s a compliment.”
quote: “Sorry, beautiful.”
actual_quote: Sorry, beautiful.

caption: (via cnqmdi)

After learning of the earthquake and tsunami in Japan, my class was watching videos of the coverage. I have two friends in Yokohama I was worried about. My classmates made jokes about Japanese people, mentioning Godzilla and saying “ching chong ching.” I burst into tears and they still continued.
quote: After learning of the earthquake and tsunami in Japan, my class was watching videos of the coverage. I have two friends in Yokohama I was worried about. My classmates made jokes about Japanese people, mentioning Godzilla and saying “ching chong ching.” I burst into tears and they still continued.

caption: A Chinese friend of mine said people have been approaching her on the street, telling her how sorry they are about the earthquake.
quote: A Chinese friend of mine said people have been approaching her on the street, telling her how sorry they are about the earthquake.

caption: I’m at the doctor’s office. My name is Jane and I am Asian (I have an Asian last name). I heard them call the next appointment and all I heard was the long “a” in the name, and a nurse (a Caucasian woman) appeared, so I stood up. Another girl (a Caucasian girl) also stands up and asks for clarification. Nurse says she called Amy, so I sat down. Nurse laughed and said to Amy, “You look more like ‘Amy’.”
quote:
I’m at the doctor’s office. My name is Jane and I am Asian (I have an Asian last name). I heard them call the next appointment and all I heard was the long “a” in the name, and a nurse (a Caucasian woman) appeared, so I stood up. Another girl (a Caucasian girl) also stands up and asks for clarification. Nurse says she called Amy, so I sat down. Nurse laughed and said to Amy, “You look more like ‘Amy’.”
I know the nurse meant no offense, but what, are Asian people only allowed to have Asian names? My first name is a very Western name, and my last name could have been too, for all the nurse knew (if I were adopted, married, had a non-Asian parent, had a name change through an identity protection service, etc.)

caption: Personally, I think I was right to be outraged when my friend’s boyfriend said, and I quote,  “It’s not rape if you enjoy it.” Tried to explain my point of view to friends. They didn’t understand. To them, enjoyment = consent. I simply don’t think that’s the case. It’s not about whether or not you enjoyed it, it’s about whether or not you agreed to do it. There is a line. Am I the only one who thinks there is?
quote: Personally, I think I was right to be outraged when my friend’s boyfriend said, and I quote,  “It’s not rape if you enjoy it.” Tried to explain my point of view to friends. They didn’t understand. To them, enjoyment = consent. I simply don’t think that’s the case. It’s not about whether or not you enjoyed it, it’s about whether or not you agreed to do it. There is a line. Am I the only one who thinks there is?

caption: My ex-boyfriend. Made me feel like a really angry feminist.
quote: “I’m glad you’re over your angry feminist phase. You used to be really abrasive with it.”
actual_quote: I’m glad you’re over your angry feminist phase. You used to be really abrasive with it.

caption: Asked by a white girl in my intro economics class when our professor showed us breakdowns of unemployment rates by race and gender and asked us why it was important for economists as social scientists to do this.
quote: “Why does this matter? Why do we HAVE TO do that?”
actual_quote: Why does this matter? Why do we HAVE TO do that?

caption: (via karmajapan-deactivated20110318)
(via karmajapan-deactivated20110318)
My professor mentioned that his mentor at university made female students sleep with him or he wouldn’t let them in the class. He laughed. Everyone laughed. I was horrified.
quote: My professor mentioned that his mentor at university made female students sleep with him or he wouldn’t let them in the class. He laughed. Everyone laughed. I was horrified.

caption: Male coworker when I cheerfully asked, “Who wants to take care of a spider?”
quote: “What, aren’t you a modern, empowered woman? Pssh. These women are only unempowered when they don’t feel like doing something.”
actual_quote: What, aren’t you a modern, empowered woman? Pssh. These women are only unempowered when they don’t feel like doing something.

caption: I work as a diversity affairs educator on a college campus. Whenever I talk about the negative experiences of students of color on campus, they are often ignored, justified, explained away or glossed over. I once passed along concerns about the fallout from a scuffle that took place during a cultural student organization party; the student leaders of color were concerned that this incident would cast a negative light on minority student groups as a whole. I was told, “the facts are that whenever there’s a cultural student organization party, there are fights and damage” (not true) and we need to increase police presence at these parties because we have to "protect the university.“ Racial profiling, anyone?
quote: I work as a diversity affairs educator on a college campus. Whenever I talk about the negative experiences of students of color on campus, they are often ignored, justified, explained away or glossed over. I once passed along concerns about the fallout from a scuffle that took place during a cultural student organization party; the student leaders of color were concerned that this incident would cast a negative light on minority student groups as a whole. I was told, “the facts are that whenever there’s a cultural student organization party, there are fights and damage” (not true) and we need to increase police presence at these parties because we have to "protect the university.“ Racial profiling, anyone?

caption: My professor when I tried to correct my class’s gross misconceptions about psychotherapy by sharing my personal experience. I felt silenced and like my personal experience of my therapists’ methods were completely worthless, compared to what the author of our class materials had to say, who claims that some obscure number of psychotherapists intentionally cause patients to have false memories of child sexual abuse. I am a child sexual abuse survivor being treated for PTSD. Now I know not to tell my professor.
quote: “We don’t need to go into your therapy sessions.”
