actual_quote: We don’t need to go into your therapy sessions.

caption: My dad, to me, circa 7 years old, a few months after he and mom split due to his 7+ affairs. Made me feel sad, fat, ugly, and lasted until my 30’s. Saddest thing is, many men would agree.
quote: “If you keep getting fatter, men won’t want to date you when you get older.”
actual_quote: If you keep getting fatter, men won’t want to date you when you get older.

caption: A lot of things. Social justice makes us happy. Exposing privilege and power makes us happy. Offering a safe space for marginalized peoples makes us very happy. Empowering them with a term to call the small indignities that they must suffer in a hegemonic society makes us delighted. Snark that reveals a level of skepticism about our intentions does not make us happy.
quote: I'm curious to know what makes you happy.

caption: My roommate to his friend who denied being gay, referring to me, a gay male.
quote: “Don’t worry, you’re not alone. I’ve got a butt-buddy right here for you.”
actual_quote: Don’t worry, you’re not alone. I’ve got a butt-buddy right here for you.

caption: Friend of a friend defending her living requirements for next term. Made me feel angry, confused.
quote: “I’ve got no problem with blacks, I just don’t want to live with any.”
actual_quote: I’ve got no problem with blacks, I just don’t want to live with any.

caption: Maxim Magazine, November 2003.thefeministhub:Well, two things jump to my mind when I see this which is 1) where is the corresponding Cosmo article on how to turn some dude who reads Maxim into a man you’d want to interact with and b) why would Jennifer Baumgardner do this?- psychotropicpolitics

I go to the health center on campus to get my health physical required for students who are studying abroad. While the older, white nurse prepares the x-ray machines, she asks me where I’m going to study abroad and what I’m studying. She asks me if I’ve ever been to the country where I’m studying. I tell her yes, it’s where my family is from; and she asks if I was born in the US. Then she tells me I speak English “beautifully.”
quote: I go to the health center on campus to get my health physical required for students who are studying abroad. While the older, white nurse prepares the x-ray machines, she asks me where I’m going to study abroad and what I’m studying. She asks me if I’ve ever been to the country where I’m studying. I tell her yes, it’s where my family is from; and she asks if I was born in the US. Then she tells me I speak English “beautifully.”

caption: nehrujackets:OH HELL NAW(via nehrujackets-deactivated2016071)

I’m having lunch with a few classmates. One of them: “I have nothing against homosexuals but when I will be a mother, if my children are  I would be disappointed and just won’t accept the fact they aren’t normal.” And the others around us don’t seems to be shocked. Those are not from my group of classmates-friends, but when the girls of my group are talking about love and men, I can’t say “I like girls!” Even if I believe my friends to be open-minded, I just can’t.
quote: I’m having lunch with a few classmates. One of them: “I have nothing against homosexuals but when I will be a mother, if my children are  I would be disappointed and just won’t accept the fact they aren’t normal.” And the others around us don’t seems to be shocked. Those are not from my group of classmates-friends, but when the girls of my group are talking about love and men, I can’t say “I like girls!” Even if I believe my friends to be open-minded, I just can’t.

caption: I hate it when random non-Black Yalies ask me absurd questions about ‘blackness’: my hair, can you show me this dance, my skin-AAAH! Yale has one of the greatest Af-Am departments in the world. Take your questions THERE, because I’m not here to be your cultural experience.
quote: I hate it when random non-Black Yalies ask me absurd questions about ‘blackness’: my hair, can you show me this dance, my skin-AAAH! Yale has one of the greatest Af-Am departments in the world. Take your questions THERE, because I’m not here to be your cultural experience.

caption: “Walking Home”, A Third World Newsreel Workshop Production in collaboration with Messages in Motion, directed by Nuala Cabral
My boyfriend’s flatmate, talking about scholarships for Maori studying science. Talking about me, even if he didn’t know it. Made me feel angry, excluded.
quote: “I think anyone who is white and identifies as Maori [indigenous New Zealander] is just trying to rob the Government and University of money.”
actual_quote: I think anyone who is white and identifies as Maori [indigenous New Zealander] is just trying to rob the Government and University of money.

caption: Almost every time someone asks me “What are you?” and I respond “Taiwanese American,” they feel the need to correct my response. Yes, I’m aware of the controversy.  But I also know who I am better than you do, so at least give me the right to decide what I am for myself.
quote: “Oh, you mean you’re Chinese, right?”
actual_quote: Oh, you mean you’re Chinese, right?

caption: My best friend in college talking about running into her friend from kindergarden at a party. I’m openly gay. Made me feel hurt, peeved, angry, upset that I didn’t speak up.
quote: “Oh and I ran into Zach.  He was so flaming. Like, super gay. I don’t know, the guys were like, ‘okay…’ It was really bad.”
actual_quote: Oh and I ran into Zach.  He was so flaming. Like, super gay. I don’t know, the guys were like, ‘okay…’ It was really bad.

caption: “I find it rather funny when girls who wear rather revealing clothing complain about being touched inappropriately. It’s like walking around with expensive jewelry and getting robbed, then complaining you got robbed. It’s like don’t advertise yourself if you don’t want it to happen to you.”
quote:
“I find it rather funny when girls who wear rather revealing clothing complain about being touched inappropriately. It’s like walking around with expensive jewelry and getting robbed, then complaining you got robbed. It’s like don’t advertise yourself if you don’t want it to happen to you.”
- A straight male acquaintance on Facebook. Made me so angry I was shaking.

caption: My boss introduces me this way repeatedly to everyone, even after I have told him how it is a backhanded compliment.  He laughs and says I am too easily offended.  I am the only female in an aircraft maintenance facility with 12 mechanics. Makes me feel diminished, invisible.
quote: “This is my best female mechanic.”
actual_quote: This is my best female mechanic.

caption: My mother-in-law commented as my 2 year old son and his 3 year old cousin played with toys. She didn’t notice that my son had a doll in the bed of his toy pickup truck.
quote: “See, it is just natural that boys like cars & trucks and girls like dolls.”
actual_quote: See, it is just natural that boys like cars & trucks and girls like dolls.

caption: When people assume I, a woman of color, am not a law student - especially when I’m in the law library, or with male law students representing our school. I am 23 in Toronto, and it makes me feel ignored, disempowered, and like my hard work is invisible.
quote: When people assume I, a woman of color, am not a law student - especially when I’m in the law library, or with male law students representing our school. I am 23 in Toronto, and it makes me feel ignored, disempowered, and like my hard work is invisible.

caption: Man selling t-shirts at a team meeting for scientists working on a NASA mission. I was one of only a few women scientists on the team. Made me feel isolated, unimportant.
quote: “We don’t have any women’s shirts left. Everyone must have bought them for their wives.”
actual_quote: We don’t have any women’s shirts left. Everyone must have bought them for their wives.

caption: Senior NASA official at a scientist team meeting for the mission I work on. We were having a group discussion about what makes a scientific result worthy of a press conference. I was only of only a few women in a room of about 50 scientists. I was 26, in a NASA meeting, January 2011. Made me feel self-conscious, objectified, anxious.
quote: “It’s like pornography; you know it when you see it.”
actual_quote: It’s like pornography; you know it when you see it.

caption: Dealing with microaggression is a bit like standing in a hail storm. Though each individual pellet of ice may sting, no single one on its own can do real damage. But together, they can punch through car wind shields and strip the bark off trees.Each microaggression impacts the self-worth of an oppressed person, makes them feel invisible, makes them feel uncared for, makes them feel hopeless that anything will ever change. Over time, it all adds up.To help illustrate the way microaggressions work, I offer you this dramatized “day in the life” of a young urban trans guy—specifically, me. All of the incidents described herein have actually happened, though not all in the same day. I have compressed time somewhat in order to quickly give you a sense of the impact that microaggressions can have, when in reality these incidents may have occurred over many months. Think of it as being like a time-lapse video—it shows a process exactly as it occurs, except for its being very accelerated.(via tranarchism)
quote: A Day In The Life Of An Angry Transsexual

caption: My dad while watching American Idol, about a contestant who was autistic with Tourette’s Syndrome. This is not the first time he has armchair diagnosed, either attributing mental illness toward awkward or high-energy behavior, or discounting it because they “look/act normal.”My dad is neurotypical, while I have autism myself; the kicker is that I do get “I can’t tell!” a lot. Made me feel angry, frustrated, even erased.
quote: “He doesn’t look like he has Tourette’s.”
actual_quote: He doesn’t look like he has Tourette’s.

caption: My friend views Japanese men and gay men as her entertainment. When we go out in public she squeals loudly and points if there is a gay couple walking by. More than once she has tried to drag me with her to stalk them. I’ve told her how I feel about this. Her excuse: “But it’s so cute!” Like we were talking about kittens, not human beings. She wants to get pregnant by a Japanese man and have a gay Japanese baby boy. She has already bought clothes, even a shirt with the word “homosexual” written on it in Japanese.
quote:
My friend views Japanese men and gay men as her entertainment. When we go out in public she squeals loudly and points if there is a gay couple walking by. More than once she has tried to drag me with her to stalk them. I’ve told her how I feel about this. Her excuse: “But it’s so cute!” Like we were talking about kittens, not human beings. She wants to get pregnant by a Japanese man and have a gay Japanese baby boy. She has already bought clothes, even a shirt with the word “homosexual” written on it in Japanese.
We’re both 20 year old white girls from Sweden. It made me feel creeped out, sad and concerned. I want to end this friendship.

caption: At work during lunch break, different ethnicities all around including black people, white girl of 18 years old was saying this. I was confused and offended.
quote: “That’s why black men, like my boyfriend, date us white women. They like REAL hair, real nails, and none of that attitude.  Black girls are way too ghetto and too much work.”
actual_quote: That’s why black men, like my boyfriend, date us white women. They like REAL hair, real nails, and none of that attitude.  Black girls are way too ghetto and too much work.

caption: My family member in response to the fact that I am an applicant for Teach for America. (“Uneducatable” is not a word.)
quote: “Well you know, you are going to have to deal with some uneducatable black kids.”
actual_quote: Well you know, you are going to have to deal with some uneducatable black kids.

quote: “I wish you’d stop calling me a feminist. I’m not a feminist. It’s really insulting. I love all that traditional woman stuff, cooking, cleaning, like that.”
actual_quote: I wish you’d stop calling me a feminist. I’m not a feminist. It’s really insulting. I love all that traditional woman stuff, cooking, cleaning, like that.

caption: Makes me feel ignored.
quote: “We need 3-4 men to help us carry these boxes.”
actual_quote: We need 3-4 men to help us carry these boxes.

caption: To me, a woman, from the salesperson at a convenience store. This happens to me all the time. I am a cis woman, in my 60’s, with a short haircut and no makeup, often wearing gender neutral style clothing. Annoyed, and wondering why the most casual encounter between strangers has to have include a gender marking word.
quote: “Thank you, Sir.”
actual_quote: Thank you, Sir.

caption: Overheard conversation between two faculty members at my university. I’m a woman living with  bipolar disorder. Made me feel silenced, undesirable, broken.
quote: “I wish my son would dump the girl he’s dating…she’s bipolar! You know how those people are.”
actual_quote: I wish my son would dump the girl he’s dating…she’s bipolar! You know how those people are.

caption: yo u ‘minorities’ have to stop complain. “oh if this was a black guy, the comments and headline would read scum.” stfu honestly, they rnt praising him for stabbing ppl u idiots, the fact that u have to be self centered and make this about yourselves and race just shows how you guys are racist against whites. you guys have it made. college scholarships, welfare, jobs galore. so stop bitching.
quote:
yo u ‘minorities’ have to stop complain. “oh if this was a black guy, the comments and headline would read scum.” stfu honestly, they rnt praising him for stabbing ppl u idiots, the fact that u have to be self centered and make this about yourselves and race just shows how you guys are racist against whites. you guys have it made. college scholarships, welfare, jobs galore. so stop bitching.
- White middle-class friend’s facebook status. Made me feel flustered, upset, defensive, angry, hurt, humiliated, alone and like I wanted to kill myself because everyone was agreeing with her.

caption: A note left on my desk in my office. Made me feel insecure, flabbergasted.
quote: “Do you have a man? Write back!”
actual_quote: Do you have a man? Write back!

caption: Male co-worker trying to get me, a female, to watch a TV show he likes and having no clue that he’s insulting me right to my face. Made me feel insulted and semi-invisible even though he was speaking directly to me.
quote: “I know it’s for girls, but it’s actually really good!”
actual_quote: I know it’s for girls, but it’s actually really good!

caption: My fiance and I just moved to the Tennessee. All our new neighbors, when they introduce themselves, ask him what he does for a living. None of them ask me. I support us both. Made me feel angry, unimportant, small.
quote: My fiance and I just moved to the Tennessee. All our new neighbors, when they introduce themselves, ask him what he does for a living. None of them ask me. I support us both. Made me feel angry, unimportant, small.

caption: Ryan Murphy, on the Glee character Blaine.
quote: “Blaine is NOT bi. He is gay, and will always be gay. I think it’s very important to young kids that they know this character is one of them.”
actual_quote: Blaine is NOT bi. He is gay, and will always be gay. I think it’s very important to young kids that they know this character is one of them.

caption: I own a home. Whenever my boyfriend accompanies me to the hardware store, the clerks address all the comments to him, even if I’m the one answering all the questions. In Nashville, 2010 & made me feel angry, frustrated, inefficient.
quote: I own a home. Whenever my boyfriend accompanies me to the hardware store, the clerks address all the comments to him, even if I’m the one answering all the questions. In Nashville, 2010 & made me feel angry, frustrated, inefficient.

caption: The delivery person from a specialized pharmacy came to my door to deliver my month’s worth of medical supplies for an invisible disability. As I open the door, the delivery person says “Supplies for Ms. X?” And I say “Yes thank you”. He says “Oh, that must be your grandmother…”. I say “No, that’s me”. Confused, he says “But you are so young!” And I say “yup”.Age does not equal ability / disability. I expected someone who provides home-delivery services to people with disabilities / ongoing medical needs, to get that. I am a 33 year old female with multiple invisible disabilities. Makes me feel invisible, angry, tired of always educating others.
quote: The delivery person from a specialized pharmacy came to my door to deliver my month’s worth of medical supplies for an invisible disability. As I open the door, the delivery person says “Supplies for Ms. X?” And I say “Yes thank you”. He says “Oh, that must be your grandmother…”. I say “No, that’s me”. Confused, he says “But you are so young!” And I say “yup”.Age does not equal ability / disability. I expected someone who provides home-delivery services to people with disabilities / ongoing medical needs, to get that. I am a 33 year old female with multiple invisible disabilities. Makes me feel invisible, angry, tired of always educating others.

caption: My (thin and attractive) ex-boyfriend and I (fat) used to go out to eat a  lot. He would always order a water and I would always order a soda.  Guess who the server would always give the water to? Humiliating. Every time. I tried to laugh it off with him, but this  wasn’t an isolated incident, and while I don’t think they were doing it  consciously, the fact remains that it happened all the time. Those things never used to happen like that when I was thin.
quote: My (thin and attractive) ex-boyfriend and I (fat) used to go out to eat a  lot. He would always order a water and I would always order a soda.  Guess who the server would always give the water to? Humiliating. Every time. I tried to laugh it off with him, but this  wasn’t an isolated incident, and while I don’t think they were doing it  consciously, the fact remains that it happened all the time. Those things never used to happen like that when I was thin.

caption: A 40ish white man to me, a female college student.  It made me feel as though my only worth is in my appearance.
quote: “You should be a fashion major.”
actual_quote: You should be a fashion major.

caption: The question a man asked me when I moved away from the back door and told him to go ahead when the bus was still moving. I’m a Black Muslim girl wearing hijab, so he must have felt this was a valid question. I told him I was born here, and he laughed the whole way off the bus. It made me angry, because he assumed that I was ignorant because I’m an immigrant. I’ve been riding the city bus for years, I was just having an off day.
quote: “How long have you been in Canada for?”
actual_quote: How long have you been in Canada for?

caption: Said by a conservative white straight cis-male in the student lounge today. My college is known for having a very high LGBTQ population. Made me feel frustrated, tired.
quote: “I’m fine with gays, and I’m fine with lesbians, but it’s the people who can’t decide that bother me. Like, the ones who can’t decide which ones they like more, or what gender they are. You have to pick a side people!”
actual_quote: I’m fine with gays, and I’m fine with lesbians, but it’s the people who can’t decide that bother me. Like, the ones who can’t decide which ones they like more, or what gender they are. You have to pick a side people!

caption: The highest rated comment on a very old and very racist Bugs Bunny cartoon shown on YouTube.
quote: “If the Japs are offended, then screw them. They should have stayed away from Pearl Harbor."﻿”
actual_quote: If the Japs are offended, then screw them. They should have stayed away from Pearl Harbor."﻿

caption: My fourth grade teacher remarks (I was 10 years old) when I showed her my carefully rendered drawing of me playing soccer. I’m White-Asian/Asian-White mix. At the time, I was proud someone noticed my “Asian-ness”… now I don’t even know how to comprehend how messed up my education towards race and heritage was… Makes me feel dissected.
quote: “Ah, now, there’s the Asian in you.”
actual_quote: Ah, now, there’s the Asian in you.

caption: “In honor of Black History Month”, my school’s broadcast team decided to rap the video announcements.
quote: “In honor of Black History Month”, my school’s broadcast team decided to rap the video announcements.

caption: Every time at Christmas when I watch my younger brother open up the present I wanted but will never receive because it’s considered too “boyish.”
quote: Every time at Christmas when I watch my younger brother open up the present I wanted but will never receive because it’s considered too “boyish.”

caption: Client (white, mid 50s), to me (Hispanic, mid 20s)
quote: “I’m so impressed - I can’t hear any accent when you talk!”
actual_quote: I’m so impressed - I can’t hear any accent when you talk!

caption: Said by some high school boys as a girl walked down the hallway, next to my locker. My brother, standing beside me, asked me not to say anything - he’s friends with some of the boys, and didn’t want me to “embarrass” him. Made me feel angry and tired.
quote: “Look at her ass!”
actual_quote: Look at her ass!

caption: Regularly, at the bookstore where I work, when I suggest books that don’t have cartoon princesses or disembodied midriffs on the cover.
quote: “No, no, I’m looking for a book for a little GIRL.”
actual_quote: No, no, I’m looking for a book for a little GIRL.

caption: In response to the discussion surrounding Justin Bieber’s remarks on abortion. I spoke up against what I consider adultist/ageist language surrounding the political opinions of teenagers. Made me feel angry, frustrated, invisible, silenced.
quote: “I don’t think this is "adultist”. I work with teens. They don’t know shit. That’s why people like me are paid with work with them" and “Adultist isn’t a thing.”
actual_quote: I don’t think this is "adultist”. I work with teens. They don’t know shit. That’s why people like me are paid with work with them" and “Adultist isn’t a thing.

caption: I’m walking down my school hallway and two white guys I’ve never met walking past me yell out, “Whoo hoo. Yeah, dark chocolate.” at me. Happened yesterday in high school and made me feel confused, annoyed.
quote: I’m walking down my school hallway and two white guys I’ve never met walking past me yell out, “Whoo hoo. Yeah, dark chocolate.” at me. Happened yesterday in high school and made me feel confused, annoyed.

caption: A white dorm hall-mate that I had been studying with. I look “Asian” but am fifth generation US-born. I felt conspicuous, invisible.
quote: “No offense, but honestly, I don’t think of you as Asian.”
actual_quote: No offense, but honestly, I don’t think of you as Asian.

caption: As a transman I am now included in “bonding-through-misogyny” with male strangers.
quote:
As a transman I am now included in “bonding-through-misogyny” with male strangers.
A guy asked me about my kid. I said she’s amazing. He said, how are you with having a daughter? I asked, what do you mean? I’m delighted that she is healthy and wonderful and amazing. He said, yes, but it’s a daughter. Do people not think less of you? Did you not want a son?
In London, 2010 & made me feel sad and subject to patriarchy.

caption: My ex-flatmate, about the banning of burqa. I’m 22 from France.
quote: “At least, this time, Muslims are not privileged.”
actual_quote: At least, this time, Muslims are not privileged.

caption: Nearly every day, someone refers to my boyfriend as “my Asian.” Nearly every day, someone makes a joke about penis size. Nearly every day, my relationship is someone’s joke because I am a white girl and he is an Asian boy, and I guess that’s just “not how it goes.” In high school, among friends & makes me feel angry.
quote: Nearly every day, someone refers to my boyfriend as “my Asian.” Nearly every day, someone makes a joke about penis size. Nearly every day, my relationship is someone’s joke because I am a white girl and he is an Asian boy, and I guess that’s just “not how it goes.” In high school, among friends & makes me feel angry.

caption: A non-Roma telling me why she used the word “gypsy” in her username, never mind that it’s a racial slur. Made me feel frustrated, appalled.
quote: ““I use the word "gypsy” because I identify with the lifestyle.“”
actual_quote: “I use the word "gypsy” because I identify with the lifestyle.“

caption: I have only recently come to terms with being transgender. I call my mom who I don’t talk to much about a few things. I casually ask if I ever said I wanted to be a boy as a kid. She says: “Other than [one time] I don’t remember, but don’t go cutting your tits off!” Thanks mom, for caring about my boobs more than my happiness and deciding what I as an adult person can or can’t do with my body.
quote: I have only recently come to terms with being transgender. I call my mom who I don’t talk to much about a few things. I casually ask if I ever said I wanted to be a boy as a kid. She says: “Other than [one time] I don’t remember, but don’t go cutting your tits off!” Thanks mom, for caring about my boobs more than my happiness and deciding what I as an adult person can or can’t do with my body.

caption: Comment made by a male colleague when we were discussing safety precautions at university campuses. Made me feel like an object, horrified and like a second class citizen.
quote: “Women who are out after dark in skirts or dresses deserve to be raped.”
actual_quote: Women who are out after dark in skirts or dresses deserve to be raped.

caption: The implication being that the only possible way to be a good/moral/nice person is to have a religion.  This is often followed up by statements such as “Are you sure?” or “No, you can’t be, because you don’t behave like an atheist” or “Well, have you ever considered [insert person’s religious denomination here].” Makes me feel frustrated, misunderstood, unheard.
quote: “An atheist?!  But you are so nice!”
actual_quote: An atheist?!  But you are so nice!

caption: At a business lunch with co-workers and a client, celebrating his recent promotion. The waiter drops off my lemonade and says “Here you go, sweetie”. I am a woman. My male supervisor is on one side of me, the male department head on the other, and I am frozen with shame. I am 27, and it made me feel angry, embarrassed, frustrated that I didn’t speak up.
quote: At a business lunch with co-workers and a client, celebrating his recent promotion. The waiter drops off my lemonade and says “Here you go, sweetie”. I am a woman. My male supervisor is on one side of me, the male department head on the other, and I am frozen with shame. I am 27, and it made me feel angry, embarrassed, frustrated that I didn’t speak up.

caption: My friend commenting on the topic of rape. I was 17 in high school Psychology class. Made me feel disgusted, uncomfortable.
quote: “Oh, it doesn’t count if it’s your boyfriend. That’s basically implied consent.”
actual_quote: Oh, it doesn’t count if it’s your boyfriend. That’s basically implied consent.

caption: Girl in high school. Made me feel offended, angry, frustrated.
quote: “I call you that because that’s what you are. You’re Chinese. You’re Oriental. It’s what you are.”
actual_quote: I call you that because that’s what you are. You’re Chinese. You’re Oriental. It’s what you are.

caption: A performance called “Me Too” examining the racial gender structure. Made me feel angry that you believe in unicorns.
quote: “I don’t like the word feminist. We should all be equalists!”
actual_quote: I don’t like the word feminist. We should all be equalists!

caption: Hari Kondabolu - “Ethnic Needs”

Boss introduces new employee and gives her a new name that only has the first letter in common with her actual Middle Eastern name because she can’t say her real name. Made me feel embarrassed, ashamed, frustrated.
quote: Boss introduces new employee and gives her a new name that only has the first letter in common with her actual Middle Eastern name because she can’t say her real name. Made me feel embarrassed, ashamed, frustrated.

caption: The heterosexual transactivist who told my boyfriend that by ‘letting’ me continue to identify myself as a lesbian, he was 'allowing’ me to disrespect him. I can’t decide if  it was homophobia or misogyny behind that call. Made me feel absolutely furious and insulted.
quote: The heterosexual transactivist who told my boyfriend that by ‘letting’ me continue to identify myself as a lesbian, he was 'allowing’ me to disrespect him. I can’t decide if  it was homophobia or misogyny behind that call. Made me feel absolutely furious and insulted.

caption: My mother is Dutch-Indonesian. A woman asked her for directions at the airport, and upon my mother’s response, the woman opened her eyes wide and exclaimed, “Oh! You speak English so well!” My mother did not respond. “You’re Asian, right?”
quote: My mother is Dutch-Indonesian. A woman asked her for directions at the airport, and upon my mother’s response, the woman opened her eyes wide and exclaimed, “Oh! You speak English so well!” My mother did not respond. “You’re Asian, right?”

caption: Reminder from my 40-some year old, male, heterocentric general practitioner after a conversation about which medical field I should pursue.
quote: “Anything can happen. After all, you are a woman. You can always get fall in love, get married and have kids.  And that’s important too.”
actual_quote: Anything can happen. After all, you are a woman. You can always get fall in love, get married and have kids.  And that’s important too.

caption: White classmate to a black woman with natural hair. I didn’t feel like explaining breaking down Eurocentric standards of beauty combined with ya'know free will. Made me feel frustrated, awkward, alone.
quote: “Why can’t all Black Women wear their hair like yours?”
actual_quote: Why can’t all Black Women wear their hair like yours?

caption: A girl in my gender studies class, responding to a question about the ‘supposed’ difference between sex and gender. I  am in class after a night of two hours of sleep because I was trying to comfort my  partner who was having incredibly bad dysphoria. I can’t say anything because I’m afraid I’ll start crying.
quote: ““After you strip off his makeup and clothes, biologically he’s still a man”.”
actual_quote: “After you strip off his makeup and clothes, biologically he’s still a man”.

caption: My boyfriend’s mother in response to my announcement that I’m attending university next year. My boyfriend knew this was very important  to me since I grew up in a situation where a college education was hard to come by. He says nothing. Made me feel shocked, compartmentalized, defensive, belittled.
quote: “Why would you waste those four years when you could start having a family?”
actual_quote: Why would you waste those four years when you could start having a family?

caption: My professor trying to make a joke in an undergrad political science class, in the middle of a lesson about how evolutionary psychology might prove that there actually are cognitive differences between the races and sexes. Made me feel powerless to speak up.
quote: “The idea of the noble savage is that primitive things are better. So African drums are better than Beethoven. Which may have something to it, until you hear too much rap music, and then you think primitive things should be banned.”
actual_quote: The idea of the noble savage is that primitive things are better. So African drums are better than Beethoven. Which may have something to it, until you hear too much rap music, and then you think primitive things should be banned.

caption: I was leaving my apartment to go to a hardcore show and I am the only minority (Haitian American) in my building. My neighbors were drinking out front and asked where I was going and I told them and they began laughing. One of them asked, “Am I too white for you?” and as I started to say “I don’t want to have this conversation,” another guy yelled “White Power!” in my face. With 15-20  aggressive white males in my face, I couldn’t do anything.
quote:
I was leaving my apartment to go to a hardcore show and I am the only minority (Haitian American) in my building. My neighbors were drinking out front and asked where I was going and I told them and they began laughing. One of them asked, “Am I too white for you?” and as I started to say “I don’t want to have this conversation,” another guy yelled “White Power!” in my face. With 15-20  aggressive white males in my face, I couldn’t do anything.
Made me feel sad, hurt, small, defenseless, confused.

caption: My girlfriend expressing indignation over me feeling worried about being trans when “nothing bad has ever happened” to me personally. As if my fears about rejection and/or violence would only make sense if had been seriously attacked.
quote:
My girlfriend expressing indignation over me feeling worried about being trans when “nothing bad has ever happened” to me personally. As if my fears about rejection and/or violence would only make sense if had been seriously attacked.
We’re in our late 20s, it was at home, it came up as part of an argument about her very conservative mother. Made me feel depressed, guilty, ashamed, angry.

caption: I’m a wheelchair user in a large museum. I felt like my struggles with accessibility were nothing and the young, able-bodied man who said this expected pity.
quote: “Look at her. That’s no fair. Why do I have to walk? She’s taking advantage.”
actual_quote: Look at her. That’s no fair. Why do I have to walk? She’s taking advantage.

caption: Librarian after taking one look at me (the only black girl at my high school) while my white friends & I are signing up.
quote: “You’re going to have to spell your name for me”
actual_quote: You’re going to have to spell your name for me

caption: “You’re being too sensitive, this "Gifts for Him, Gifts for Her” segregation is just for reference!“ - my friend on an airplane after I showed this to him.
My Dad to me. For the record I came out when I was 16 (I am 19 now). He’s still in denial. In London & it made me feel pissed off & upset.
quote: “You’re going to Old Compton Street? You want to be careful, it’s queer city up that way.”
actual_quote: You’re going to Old Compton Street? You want to be careful, it’s queer city up that way.

caption: But instead of complaining about the ignorance of society and ridiculousness of modern fashion (which is run and supported by so many self centred, materialistic people that i dont think there’s any hope in saving it), why dont you instead educate people about the customs of Native Americans?
quote:
But instead of complaining about the ignorance of society and ridiculousness of modern fashion (which is run and supported by so many self centred, materialistic people that i dont think there’s any hope in saving it), why dont you instead educate people about the customs of Native Americans?
Source: mycultureisnotatrend.tumblr.com

caption: I recently looked in the paper that serves the metro-east area of the city I live in to find race demographics from the 2010 census for the cities and towns in the area. The races listed were “black,” “white,” and “Hispanic.” Apparently, if you’re Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, multiracial, or any other racial identity, you’re not worth mentioning in the racial breakdown of the area.
quote: I recently looked in the paper that serves the metro-east area of the city I live in to find race demographics from the 2010 census for the cities and towns in the area. The races listed were “black,” “white,” and “Hispanic.” Apparently, if you’re Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, multiracial, or any other racial identity, you’re not worth mentioning in the racial breakdown of the area.

caption: A customer I am helping comments that she likes my (short, faux-hawk) haircut and asks where I get it cut.  I reply, “Thank you!  My fiancée cuts it for me."  She responds, "Oh!  Is he a hair stylist?"  I am a lesbian and engaged to my partner and constantly battling the assumption that everyone is straight. Made me feel angry, silenced, uncomfortable.
quote: A customer I am helping comments that she likes my (short, faux-hawk) haircut and asks where I get it cut.  I reply, “Thank you!  My fiancée cuts it for me."  She responds, "Oh!  Is he a hair stylist?"  I am a lesbian and engaged to my partner and constantly battling the assumption that everyone is straight. Made me feel angry, silenced, uncomfortable.

caption: My older, male, white boss called me white-washed. I was the only black girl in the room with him and ten other coworkers because I currently live in the suburbs, attended a private school and “speak real English” (his words not mine), while he grew up in a slightly rougher neighborhood. I laughed it off because I didn’t know what else to say or do.
quote:
My older, male, white boss called me white-washed. I was the only black girl in the room with him and ten other coworkers because I currently live in the suburbs, attended a private school and “speak real English” (his words not mine), while he grew up in a slightly rougher neighborhood. I laughed it off because I didn’t know what else to say or do.
I felt embarrassed, guilty for laughing, alone, and invisible and that I should be old enough to know better

caption: My mother in a conversation about hair styling. I am of color. Made me feel uncomfortable, unattractive.
quote: “Why don’t you want to straighten you’re hair? You don’t wanna be pretty?”
actual_quote: Why don’t you want to straighten you’re hair? You don’t wanna be pretty?

caption: I’m a white male with PTSD to a point that interferes with my ability to  function in the real world. On a daily basis I’m told that I don’t  understand “real pain” and that my suffering is irrelevant.
quote: I’m a white male with PTSD to a point that interferes with my ability to  function in the real world. On a daily basis I’m told that I don’t  understand “real pain” and that my suffering is irrelevant.

caption: When taking our biracial son to the emergency room, my African American husband makes mention of his urethra when discussing my son’s illness. The white, middle aged male doctor says to him, “Where did you learn that word?” as if there is no way that my husband could know such a medical term. Made me feel angry, insulted, and degraded.
quote: When taking our biracial son to the emergency room, my African American husband makes mention of his urethra when discussing my son’s illness. The white, middle aged male doctor says to him, “Where did you learn that word?” as if there is no way that my husband could know such a medical term. Made me feel angry, insulted, and degraded.

caption: Commercial by Red Bull
Tired of always explaining to my white, French flat-mate every time the subject of Asian food comes into conversation that no, Chinese people actually  don’t eat dogs.
quote: Tired of always explaining to my white, French flat-mate every time the subject of Asian food comes into conversation that no, Chinese people actually  don’t eat dogs.

caption: Source: Yale Blackness, a project by the Black Student Alliance at Yale (BSAY). The site contains a lot of posts on “merits” of colorblindness and fears about insularity.
quote: “I have none; there is no such thing. Why does everyone want to make ‘Blackness’ a thing apart from 'humanness’ or 'studentness.’”
actual_quote: I have none; there is no such thing. Why does everyone want to make ‘Blackness’ a thing apart from 'humanness’ or 'studentness.’

caption: I’m Japanese American. I was doing some homework for a Japanese class during lunch at my college campus. One guy passing by saw what I’m doing and started saying “ching chong ching chong” over and over.
quote: I’m Japanese American. I was doing some homework for a Japanese class during lunch at my college campus. One guy passing by saw what I’m doing and started saying “ching chong ching chong” over and over.

caption: Several people on different occasions after finding out my boyfriend is Chinese. Since when is it appropriate to ask an acquaintance how big her boyfriend’s penis is?
quote: “So, is it true what they say about Asians?”
actual_quote: So, is it true what they say about Asians?

caption: While this is not a link about microaggressions specifically, it is an interesting link about the related topic of privilege - experienced by individuals but symptomatic of larger structures of power - compiled in list form, which generated a lot of debate (a thoughtful critique linked at the bottom of the post).
quote: a list of privilege lists

caption: I followed my then-fiance to the gas station and we talked at the pumps before he went inside to get a drink. A random white man approached and asked me if “that man” was bothering me. I told him that he is my fiance. He said, “Oh, I just thought because…” I am white, and my now-husband is Filipino. Made me feel furious and helpless.
quote: I followed my then-fiance to the gas station and we talked at the pumps before he went inside to get a drink. A random white man approached and asked me if “that man” was bothering me. I told him that he is my fiance. He said, “Oh, I just thought because…” I am white, and my now-husband is Filipino. Made me feel furious and helpless.

caption: My boss promoted me from his assistant to a consultant.  In the same conversation, he said that he was concerned that clients would discriminate against me because of my weight, and that my weight would reflect poorly on the company. I was at my boss’ home office, and it made me feel hurt, angry, and confused.
quote: My boss promoted me from his assistant to a consultant.  In the same conversation, he said that he was concerned that clients would discriminate against me because of my weight, and that my weight would reflect poorly on the company. I was at my boss’ home office, and it made me feel hurt, angry, and confused.

caption: The male half of a middle-aged heterosexual couple to me during a UK Gay & Lesbian Pride Parade. Made me feel shocked, demeaned, patronised.
quote: “You’re a lesbian? Why? You’re so pretty you could have any man you want?”
actual_quote: You’re a lesbian? Why? You’re so pretty you could have any man you want?

caption: A former friend after I disclosed to her that I was being severely psychologically abused by my partner of nearly 20 years. Did she think that there was some method by which I could reinsert the words back into his mouth, or prevent the attitudes which created the abuse? Her reaction made me feel shamed and abused all over again.I’m in my 40’s, she’s in her 50’s. Made me feel angry, hurt, unheard.
quote: “I wouldn’t let someone talk to me like that.”
actual_quote: I wouldn’t let someone talk to me like that.

caption: I’m at a cafe having lunch with my brother. The server brings our drinks and automatically hands me the Diet Coke, even though he took our order and knows I ordered regular Coke. I’m a fat woman who has aspartame intolerance and my brother is slim and has type one diabetes. This happens regularly.
quote: I’m at a cafe having lunch with my brother. The server brings our drinks and automatically hands me the Diet Coke, even though he took our order and knows I ordered regular Coke. I’m a fat woman who has aspartame intolerance and my brother is slim and has type one diabetes. This happens regularly.

caption: My ex-boyfriend in high school, explaining why he didn’t believe in “women’s rights”.
quote: “I’m sick of hearing all this stuff about feminism. I’m a white male, does that make me rich? I’m not ‘empowered’ just because I’m a guy. Do you know how many scholarships I can’t apply for because I’m male?”
actual_quote: I’m sick of hearing all this stuff about feminism. I’m a white male, does that make me rich? I’m not ‘empowered’ just because I’m a guy. Do you know how many scholarships I can’t apply for because I’m male?

caption: Old woman at the grocery store. I’m a mixed race Latina who was born and raised in the US.
quote: “I was watching Miss America the other night and lots of the girls are so pretty, but not really American. They’re exotic like you!”
actual_quote: I was watching Miss America the other night and lots of the girls are so pretty, but not really American. They’re exotic like you!

caption: I’m at the bar with a group of female friends and we meet a friendly and engaging group of guys. I am fat, and coming back from the bathroom I overhear the men quietly arguing amongst each other over who will “get stuck with the whale.” Made me feel invisible, as usual.
quote: I’m at the bar with a group of female friends and we meet a friendly and engaging group of guys. I am fat, and coming back from the bathroom I overhear the men quietly arguing amongst each other over who will “get stuck with the whale.” Made me feel invisible, as usual.

caption: White fraternity guys at University of Washington pull up in a car and yell “black power” at a black male student.  The embarrassment I saw in his face at their sarcastic, humiliating remark makes me want to cry with frustration.
quote: White fraternity guys at University of Washington pull up in a car and yell “black power” at a black male student.  The embarrassment I saw in his face at their sarcastic, humiliating remark makes me want to cry with frustration.

caption: 20-something white guy at the library.
quote: “I’ve seen you around and always wanted to talk to you. You just have this wonderful… ethnicity about you.”
actual_quote: I’ve seen you around and always wanted to talk to you. You just have this wonderful… ethnicity about you.

caption: My mom, after she asked what an article she read meant by “cis-woman."
quote: “Oh, so being normal has to have a special word now?”
actual_quote: Oh, so being normal has to have a special word now?

caption: Saturday Night Live: Estro-maxx

The older white man next to me on my flight asks me what I am reading. It turns out we work in similar fields. We talk and exchange business cards. As we leave the flight, he tells me (a biracial Asian/White woman in my 30s) that I should wear  Hello Kitty outfits. I ask him what he means and he tells me that his colleague’s wife, who is Korean, loves Hello Kitty. Made me feel dirty, angry, confused, fetishized, infantilized.
quote: The older white man next to me on my flight asks me what I am reading. It turns out we work in similar fields. We talk and exchange business cards. As we leave the flight, he tells me (a biracial Asian/White woman in my 30s) that I should wear  Hello Kitty outfits. I ask him what he means and he tells me that his colleague’s wife, who is Korean, loves Hello Kitty. Made me feel dirty, angry, confused, fetishized, infantilized.

caption: My aunt to my entire extended family. Made me feel baffled, angry, upset.
quote: “I want to make bumper stickers that say ISLAM IS NOT A PEACEFUL RELIGION and sell them.”
actual_quote: I want to make bumper stickers that say ISLAM IS NOT A PEACEFUL RELIGION and sell them.

caption: A straight male acquaintance on Facebook. Made me so angry I was shaking.
quote: “I find it rather funny when girls who wear rather revealing clothing complain about being touched inappropriately. It’s like walking around with expensive jewelry and getting robbed, then complaining you got robbed. It’s like don’t advertise yourself if you don’t want it to happen to you.”
actual_quote: I find it rather funny when girls who wear rather revealing clothing complain about being touched inappropriately. It’s like walking around with expensive jewelry and getting robbed, then complaining you got robbed. It’s like don’t advertise yourself if you don’t want it to happen to you.

caption: boltupright:What part of NOT LOL are you missing, asshole?

I asked my friends to boycott a bar due to homophobic comments from the staff. With the ulterior motive of not wanting to leave their favorite drinking spot, almost all of my white liberal friends asked me if I was sure the homosexual men weren’t  “making it all up to get attention.”
quote: I asked my friends to boycott a bar due to homophobic comments from the staff. With the ulterior motive of not wanting to leave their favorite drinking spot, almost all of my white liberal friends asked me if I was sure the homosexual men weren’t  “making it all up to get attention.”

caption: Apparently, feeling uncomfortable about power and privilege is something we try very hard to accomplish.
My mom. (I’m on disability for depression.)
quote: “When people ask why you’re on disability, I just tell them you have an anxiety disorder. It’s better.”
actual_quote: When people ask why you’re on disability, I just tell them you have an anxiety disorder. It’s better.

caption: A high school counselor walks past a girl wearing the same outfit as me before saying that I am dressed inappropriately and that I must change or be suspended. My breasts are a lot bigger than hers. when: almost every week
quote: A high school counselor walks past a girl wearing the same outfit as me before saying that I am dressed inappropriately and that I must change or be suspended. My breasts are a lot bigger than hers. when: almost every week

caption: A white guy I used to date when I confronted him about cheating on me. I felt insulted, humiliated and deeply hurt.
quote: “You smell different. I have always dated Caucasian women before and I prefer they way they smell.”
actual_quote: You smell different. I have always dated Caucasian women before and I prefer they way they smell.

caption: Photograph of Elton John and partner David Furnish with newborn baby on the cover of Us Weekly, covered by the management of Harps grocery store in Arkansas with a “Family Shield”. Credit: Psychology Today
(Many) white people when I complain about the usage of the n-word.
quote: “Words only have power if you give it to them.”
actual_quote: Words only have power if you give it to them.

caption: My white neighbor asks me to give him the name of a rap song, any rap song, that is better than Shakespeare’s poetry. He then tells me, in a discussion about women film directors, that he feels women got in their own way because they are too catty, and that while men are responsible for 80% of sexism, women were responsible for the other 20%. He calls me “honey” during this exchange and I tell him that I think it is condescending. He replies that that’s what all Southerners do, apologizes, then proceeds to say, “Good night, hon.”
quote: My white neighbor asks me to give him the name of a rap song, any rap song, that is better than Shakespeare’s poetry. He then tells me, in a discussion about women film directors, that he feels women got in their own way because they are too catty, and that while men are responsible for 80% of sexism, women were responsible for the other 20%. He calls me “honey” during this exchange and I tell him that I think it is condescending. He replies that that’s what all Southerners do, apologizes, then proceeds to say, “Good night, hon.”

caption: I’m sitting in a restaurant with my husband and mother-in-law.  Our server comes to take our order.  He has a soft, somewhat feminine sounding voice.  As he walks away, my mother-in-law turns to me and loudly snaps “Oh, I don’t know why the hell they don’t just go back into the closet and  stop harassing the normal people.  Nobody wants to hear them whine about marriage.”  My husband kicked my foot under the table when I opened my mouth.  He knows that I am a straight ally who supports GLBT rights, and he didn’t want me to confront her bigotry.
quote: I’m sitting in a restaurant with my husband and mother-in-law.  Our server comes to take our order.  He has a soft, somewhat feminine sounding voice.  As he walks away, my mother-in-law turns to me and loudly snaps “Oh, I don’t know why the hell they don’t just go back into the closet and  stop harassing the normal people.  Nobody wants to hear them whine about marriage.”  My husband kicked my foot under the table when I opened my mouth.  He knows that I am a straight ally who supports GLBT rights, and he didn’t want me to confront her bigotry.

caption: Credit: White Whine
Ringing up my groceries, trying not to laugh in his face.
quote: “I grew up in a town where no one was racist so we could get away with saying stuff like that because no one really meant it in a racist way.”
actual_quote: I grew up in a town where no one was racist so we could get away with saying stuff like that because no one really meant it in a racist way.

caption: Credit: Blush And Mumble
I break up with my trans girlfriend. Friends, family and acquaintances breathe a collective sigh of relief as they can now make tranny jokes again.
quote: I break up with my trans girlfriend. Friends, family and acquaintances breathe a collective sigh of relief as they can now make tranny jokes again.

caption: A male friend’s response to the fact that I am vegetarian. I’m genderqueer, but he doesn’t know that. Made me feel like I’d been put in a box, like every “girl” had been put in a box, and annoyed at the gender binary that doesn’t allow for my existence. I felt deleted.
quote: “How come girls are all vegetarian these days?”
actual_quote: How come girls are all vegetarian these days?

caption: We were inspired to create Microaggressions because we wanted, at first, a repository to record our own experiences. As two people who talk a lot about how often they appear in our own lives, we originally needed a venting space for our ourselves. (This project began on a Google Doc, and many of the first posts were by us.) But we knew that our experiences cannot encompass even a fraction of the variety of microaggressions that everyone experiences, so we asked for submissions. The name is nice because many people (including ourselves before we learned its meaning) don’t know that there is already a word for incidents like these. Having a name makes them easier to actively resist and organize against!
quote: What inspired you to create this blog, and the name specifically?

caption: My older male boss looks pointedly between my lesbian coworker and me, rolls his eyes and announces, “I suppose boys are out of fashion.”
quote:
My older male boss looks pointedly between my lesbian coworker and me, rolls his eyes and announces, “I suppose boys are out of fashion.”
Made me feel uncomfortable & objectified.

caption: My supervisor at the college bookstore. My name is Edelio, after my Cuban father and grandfather. Made me feel angry & disrespected
quote: “You know, I wasn’t going to hire you when I saw your name. I was like ‘I’m not going to be able to pronounce that.’”
actual_quote: You know, I wasn’t going to hire you when I saw your name. I was like ‘I’m not going to be able to pronounce that.’

caption: Popped up on my Facebook newsfeed. Made me feel sad, because these ideas have not changed, and still show up in commercials today.
After being pushed to the side by an older White man. Made me feel shocked, hurt, ostricized.
quote: “I don’t want no Yellow Man bagging my groceries.”
actual_quote: I don’t want no Yellow Man bagging my groceries.

caption: Father of the bride tells his son he can’t bring his partner to the wedding, because other guests might be uncomfortable with seeing a gay couple. Father proceeds to tell son the event’s not about him and he shouldn’t be “selfish.”
quote: Father of the bride tells his son he can’t bring his partner to the wedding, because other guests might be uncomfortable with seeing a gay couple. Father proceeds to tell son the event’s not about him and he shouldn’t be “selfish.”

caption: My parents found my homosexuality so abhorrent that “even a black woman” would be preferable.
quote: “Your mom and I will support you as long as you date women. It doesn’t even matter if she’s black, as long as it’s a woman.”
actual_quote: Your mom and I will support you as long as you date women. It doesn’t even matter if she’s black, as long as it’s a woman.

caption: I call my dad to talk about how inspiring the  events in Egypt are. I describe how happy I am to finally see images of Arabs in the media that do not portray them as dangerous, primitive religious zealots.  He responds that aside from all “their” violence against women he agrees with me, and he hopes that some fundamentalist group doesn’t take over.
quote: I call my dad to talk about how inspiring the  events in Egypt are. I describe how happy I am to finally see images of Arabs in the media that do not portray them as dangerous, primitive religious zealots.  He responds that aside from all “their” violence against women he agrees with me, and he hopes that some fundamentalist group doesn’t take over.

caption: earleydaysyet:“Haha! Look at the funny people dressed all weird-like, instead of what ‘normal’ people wear to the gym! Too hilarious!”This makes me cranky and stabby.

My husband and I live on a fairly busy street in a pretty diverse, quiet and safe neighborhood. I’m standing in front of my house with my mother-in-law when a car containing two African-American men drives by. She eyes in disgust and asks aloud, “So there’s lots of gangs in this neighborhood, huh?”
quote: My husband and I live on a fairly busy street in a pretty diverse, quiet and safe neighborhood. I’m standing in front of my house with my mother-in-law when a car containing two African-American men drives by. She eyes in disgust and asks aloud, “So there’s lots of gangs in this neighborhood, huh?”

caption: I was working door-to-door in Iowa after 9/11. I was 19. The thing was, you could tell she totally meant it as a compliment.
quote: “You’re Middle Eastern? Really? It’s so good to know there are actually decent Middle Eastern people out there.”
actual_quote: You’re Middle Eastern? Really? It’s so good to know there are actually decent Middle Eastern people out there.

caption: My Sunday School teacher’s wife discussing the recent shooting at a U.S. Military base in November of 2009. No one disagreed with her. In South Carolina & made me feel angry, ashamed that I didn’t speak up.
quote: “What did you expect, letting Muslims in the military?”
actual_quote: What did you expect, letting Muslims in the military?

caption: A professor during a lecture reminiscing about a beautiful hotel where an important conference was held. Made me feel terribly alone in a room full of men who chuckled.
quote: “This was the kind of place that you take your mistress to.”
actual_quote: This was the kind of place that you take your mistress to.

caption: Domino’s: Our Hot Wings Are Too Hot for Women, HispanicsCredit: Consumerist
White hipster talking to his friend. I don’t think he perceived that I’m half-Latina & I could hear him. Made me feel annoyed, disgusted.
quote: “That burrito place is good, but I don’t eat in because more than 5 minutes in that place & you smell like a Mexican.”
actual_quote: That burrito place is good, but I don’t eat in because more than 5 minutes in that place & you smell like a Mexican.

caption: A professor during a lecture reminiscing about a beautiful hotel where an important conference was held. Made me feel terribly alone in a room full of men who chuckled.
quote: “This was the kind of place that you take your mistress to.”
actual_quote: This was the kind of place that you take your mistress to.

caption: This is how I feel about the pressure for women to shave and wax their body hair. (I’m a white, cis girl with thick, dark Italian hair.)
A white teacher giving a white male student a college application form that was supposed to be for Andre (a black male).
quote: “We’ll give you this one, trust me Andre is not going to college.”
actual_quote: We’ll give you this one, trust me Andre is not going to college.

caption: During a discussion in class on World War Two, I mentioned that my grandmother was a Holocaust survivor. My AP US History teacher told me this made me biased and I couldn’t participate in the discussion because I wouldn’t be able to look at it  neutrally or logically.
quote: During a discussion in class on World War Two, I mentioned that my grandmother was a Holocaust survivor. My AP US History teacher told me this made me biased and I couldn’t participate in the discussion because I wouldn’t be able to look at it  neutrally or logically.

caption: Please consider participating in or spreading the word about this project!inberlynn:I am currently seeking participants to take a survey I’ve created as part of my thesis research on the experiences of queer women of color in public and semi-public spaces in NYC. My hope is to help make the current and ever growing conversation around gender-based violence and street harassment a more representative one through collecting the narratives of queer women of color in NYC and sharing them with dope organizations like Hollaback, Right Rides, etc. Ultimately, I’d like to help existing virtual, emotional and theoretical safe spaces become more inclusive by portraying the stories of women whose identities consist of several marginalized groups and whose stories are often underrepresented.
quote: Research project on public violence against queer women of color in New York City

caption: I’m 22. I mentioned how I still can’t work due to my struggle with fibromyalgia. Conversation with a friend. Made me feel like no one believes how much I’m hurting and worthless.
quote: “But you’re not REALLY disabled. You look so pretty!”
actual_quote: But you’re not REALLY disabled. You look so pretty!

caption: I’m a 32-year old woman with a PhD who works at a private liberal arts college.
quote: “Hi Miss [woman with a PhD], do you know where Dr. [male colleague without a PhD]’s office is?”
actual_quote: Hi Miss [woman with a PhD], do you know where Dr. [male colleague without a PhD]’s office is?

caption: “The Unwritten Stories,” by Rachelle Scarfó.
I called my friend out on a domestic abuse joke, but she said it was  ‘just a joke’.
quote: I called my friend out on a domestic abuse joke, but she said it was  ‘just a joke’.

caption: After coming out to a coworker, she was excited that she had  “another gay boyfriend.” Ever since then she has treated me very stereotypically asking me if I notice minute changes in her hair, about buying clothing, Twilight, etc.
quote:
After coming out to a coworker, she was excited that she had  “another gay boyfriend.” Ever since then she has treated me very stereotypically asking me if I notice minute changes in her hair, about buying clothing, Twilight, etc.
I’m 20, at my office on a “liberal” college campus. Made me feel objectified, upset, alone.

caption: A new acquaintance, over dinner, while making a gesture to indicate how my Asian eyes ought to look and how confusingly round they are.  I had to explain in what ways I am mixed-race until the table was satisfied with my features.  It was just one of the ways I get told “but you don’t look Filipina!” day in and day out, and it’s like saying I don’t deserve my heritage or I’m being dishonest about it.  Since when is it up for a referendum?
quote: “You’re Filipina?  But your eyes are so big!”
actual_quote: You’re Filipina?  But your eyes are so big!

caption: Complete stranger to me (a woman) working at a food stall:        “Hey, smile! Why won’t you smile? You’d be pretty if you smiled!”
quote: Complete stranger to me (a woman) working at a food stall:        “Hey, smile! Why won’t you smile? You’d be pretty if you smiled!”

caption: Credit: Blush And Mumble
The Twitter feed of a white, able-bodied, cisgender male of my acquaintance.
quote: “lol @ people still bitching about the TSA body scanners. I’ve been scanned and pat down. Took less than 10 seconds.”
actual_quote: lol @ people still bitching about the TSA body scanners. I’ve been scanned and pat down. Took less than 10 seconds.

caption: White middle-class suburbanites remarking on the new employee I hired at my coffee shop, who just happens to be black.  Funny how they didn’t notice the last two new employees, who are white…
quote: ““Oh, I see you have someone new here!” *nervous laughter*”
actual_quote: “Oh, I see you have someone new here!” *nervous laughter*

caption: My boyfriend’s white mom over dinner to me, the only “person of color” at the table. Made me feel flustered, like I didn’t know whether to be ticked or shrug it off.  My natural african hair shouldn’t cost me my future job, or make me more profitable.
quote: “Ahh! I love how straight it is!  You know, dear, when you wear your hair like that, it makes you look more…professional, or even exotic!”
actual_quote: Ahh! I love how straight it is!  You know, dear, when you wear your hair like that, it makes you look more…professional, or even exotic!

caption: Older male who works in the stockroom at work and says that EVERY TIME I take out the trash. I may be on the thin side but I am a fit, capable, 23 year old woman and I’ve been working there for over 5 months. Made me feel belittled, patronized, frustrated, tired, angry.
quote: “Hey little girl. I don’t think I’ve seen you before. You must be new. Are you sure you can lift that? Here, let me take that from you.”
actual_quote: Hey little girl. I don’t think I’ve seen you before. You must be new. Are you sure you can lift that? Here, let me take that from you.

caption: My mom pointing to a person walking into the grocery store with children. Made me feel sad and unhappy because I couldn’t apologize.
quote: “Is that a man with that pink bag!? IS THAT A MAN?! Wow.”
actual_quote: Is that a man with that pink bag!? IS THAT A MAN?! Wow.

caption: As a multiracial American, I will get this question for the rest of my life. It is a question that stabs me every time someone asks it.
quote: “What are you?”
actual_quote: What are you?

caption: asiansnotstudying:So yeah… that was fucked.
When “ghetto” is used to describe something predominantly black.
quote: When “ghetto” is used to describe something predominantly black.

caption: Little black American boy: Don’t make her mad! She’ll come at us with a spear!
quote:
Little black American boy: Don’t make her mad! She’ll come at us with a spear!
I was in Pre-K, and the other kids had just realized that I was Nigerian. They had been making fun of me, and I was visibly upset.

caption: Two young men to me as we passed, uncomfortably close on a snowy sidewalk. Made me feel angry, threatened, guilty.
quote: “Oh, cutie!”
actual_quote: Oh, cutie!

caption: At a party a white acquaintance mentions to me that he saw someone who looked exactly like me walking around campus.  I laugh and move on, but later in the evening I overhear him telling my friend how he thought she was me.  We are both black, but aside from that look NOTHING alike.  We’re not even a similar shade of brown.  This happens to me several times a year. Made me feel sad, devalued, unseen, angry, frustrated.
quote: At a party a white acquaintance mentions to me that he saw someone who looked exactly like me walking around campus.  I laugh and move on, but later in the evening I overhear him telling my friend how he thought she was me.  We are both black, but aside from that look NOTHING alike.  We’re not even a similar shade of brown.  This happens to me several times a year. Made me feel sad, devalued, unseen, angry, frustrated.

caption: Statement made by my boss during my annual review. I was the only female on his entire team.
quote: “You are very ambitious for a girl.”
actual_quote: You are very ambitious for a girl.

caption: Random person who asks me where I’m from. I say I’ve lived multiple places. She ask why I moved so much. I say my family was in poverty and looking for work.
quote: “Poor Jews! That’s like an oxymoron!”
actual_quote: Poor Jews! That’s like an oxymoron!

caption: In my statistics class this morning in a discussion of basic polls and data-gathering, my professor uses gender as the example and explains that the two categories are male and female, and you have to be in one and that they are mutually exclusive.
quote:
In my statistics class this morning in a discussion of basic polls and data-gathering, my professor uses gender as the example and explains that the two categories are male and female, and you have to be in one and that they are mutually exclusive.
I am a genderqueer/genderfluid person. This made me feel invisible, like a lie, irate and like I need to leave.

caption: A white co-worker of mine talking to a white student about her black niece’s hair. That day her niece wore her hair natural to school.Made me angry, scared to say anything, ashamed I didn’t say anything.
quote: “I know, isn’t her hair crazy today? She’s going to do something about it today. I can’t believe you went to school like that.”
actual_quote: I know, isn’t her hair crazy today? She’s going to do something about it today. I can’t believe you went to school like that.

caption: juellasaurus:Rush Limbaugh: Still a racist. Jorge Rivas reports.(via colorlines)
rad-emp:And that’s a good thing? Just an observation? Uh……
My friends when I came out of the closet.
quote: “Don’t worry, we can fix you.”
actual_quote: Don’t worry, we can fix you.

caption: In elementary school, I was absent the day we signed up for a game tournament, so my classmates and/or teacher signed me up for Chinese checkers. I am half Chinese and rubbish at Chinese checkers.
quote: In elementary school, I was absent the day we signed up for a game tournament, so my classmates and/or teacher signed me up for Chinese checkers. I am half Chinese and rubbish at Chinese checkers.

caption: I told my dad about how I found a new dentist close to school. The first thing he had to ask was if the dentist was white or Asian.  First of all, what’s with white being the unmarked race in our culture?  Secondly, the fact that people would assume that my dentist would be either white or Asian is a complete reflection of the created racial hierarchies in society. :(
quote: I told my dad about how I found a new dentist close to school. The first thing he had to ask was if the dentist was white or Asian.  First of all, what’s with white being the unmarked race in our culture?  Secondly, the fact that people would assume that my dentist would be either white or Asian is a complete reflection of the created racial hierarchies in society. :(

caption: A guy approached me at a party and asked for my number. Told me I was just his type: not “too hood” or “too ghetto”. I looked like one of those educated black women.
quote: A guy approached me at a party and asked for my number. Told me I was just his type: not “too hood” or “too ghetto”. I looked like one of those educated black women.

caption: a mother to her young son while we were both struggling with our fear of heights. I’m a 19 year old female, at my university’s gym. Made me feel disappointed, irritated, dispirited.
quote: “Are you really going to let a GIRL beat you?”
actual_quote: Are you really going to let a GIRL beat you?

caption: At a campus discussion about [Amy Chua’s] Wall Street Journal article on Chinese parenting, other participants minimize my own physical and emotional abuse as a Chinese-American child by saying that I should be able to just “move on”.
quote:
At a campus discussion about [Amy Chua’s] Wall Street Journal article on Chinese parenting, other participants minimize my own physical and emotional abuse as a Chinese-American child by saying that I should be able to just “move on”.
Made me feel like the most traumatic experiences of my life don’t matter.

caption: The choices:1. White2. Hispanic3. Asian4. Black5. Native American6. Other
quote:
The choices:1. White2. Hispanic3. Asian4. Black5. Native American6. Other
I hate being ‘other’.
- Any statistical survey.

caption: Every time some woman turns to me and goes “Isn’t he hot?” in relation to some guy. Fully expecting that I will respond in a heterosexual way, and safe in the fact that no one will respond negatively to this, whereas if I were to express similar sentiments about a woman, it would then turn into this whole big “Oh my god, you’re a lesbian?” and me then  having to explain or defend myself.
quote:
Every time some woman turns to me and goes “Isn’t he hot?” in relation to some guy. Fully expecting that I will respond in a heterosexual way, and safe in the fact that no one will respond negatively to this, whereas if I were to express similar sentiments about a woman, it would then turn into this whole big “Oh my god, you’re a lesbian?” and me then  having to explain or defend myself.
Happens almost every day. Makes me feel erased, ignored, frustrated, angry.

caption: A middle-aged man to me, a college-aged female barista behind the bar, working through a rush and not directly serving customers. I’ve ONLY EVER HEARD MALE CUSTOMERS INSTRUCTING MY FEMALE COWORKERS LIKE THIS.
quote: “SMILE!”
actual_quote: SMILE!

caption: An older male classmate I have never talked to before makes a joke about women while we wait for a meeting to start. People laugh. I make a face. He says, “Oh, don’t be mad.”
quote:
An older male classmate I have never talked to before makes a joke about women while we wait for a meeting to start. People laugh. I make a face. He says, “Oh, don’t be mad.”
In law school. I am the only woman at the meeting.

caption: A male teacher (9th grade biology) after I expressed my views on sexism and transgender rights. Made me feel confused, claustrophobic, rejected.
quote: “It’s definitely not just a label. WHETHER YOU’RE A BOY OR A GIRL DEFINES EVERYTHING YOU ARE.”
actual_quote: It’s definitely not just a label. WHETHER YOU’RE A BOY OR A GIRL DEFINES EVERYTHING YOU ARE.

caption: Elderly male client says this to me regarding his wife trying to their banking.  I’m the female teller processing his transaction. I felt pissed off, devalued, and helpless because it’s at work and I can’t say anything.
quote: “Men are just better at some things.  That’s just the way it is.  Like men are better at driving cars or flying airplanes.  But you sure look pretty.”
actual_quote: Men are just better at some things.  That’s just the way it is.  Like men are better at driving cars or flying airplanes.  But you sure look pretty.

caption: A classmate, on facebook. Made me feel like crying.
quote: “Thing is, it’s ok if some fucking stupid lesbian activist bint says really harsh things about men, but if some equally stupid guy does it, it’s evil and sexist and chauvinistic. Just shows, being PC is a fuckin joke”
actual_quote: Thing is, it’s ok if some fucking stupid lesbian activist bint says really harsh things about men, but if some equally stupid guy does it, it’s evil and sexist and chauvinistic. Just shows, being PC is a fuckin joke

caption: An old lady started talking to me on the subway platform. We exchanged pleasantries.
quote:
An old lady started talking to me on the subway platform. We exchanged pleasantries.
Lady: YOU KNOW, THERE’S AN ENGLISH LANGUAGE CLASS at a place just outside of the station. It’s free, every Tuesday night. You should try it out.
I was 15 and TOTALLY BAFFLED until I remembered that I was Chinese American.

caption: My then-boyfriend (a white man) to me (a dark-skinned multiracial woman). His reasoning was that I’m from a predominantly white Northeastern state (the state we were in at the time), while he grew up in Florida. I felt stunned, hurt, angry.
quote: “I’m just saying, I’m BASICALLY BLACKER THAN YOU.”
actual_quote: I’m just saying, I’m BASICALLY BLACKER THAN YOU.

caption: Diane Von Furstenberg, fashion designer (via asiansnotstudying)(via asiansnotstudying-blog)
quote: “The Chinese people are very individual. I mean, they are not like the Japanese that are obedient. They’re very — they’re like Jews, really, except that there is a lot more of them. And you know, I mean, try to think of governing a billion and a half Jews.”
actual_quote: The Chinese people are very individual. I mean, they are not like the Japanese that are obedient. They’re very — they’re like Jews, really, except that there is a lot more of them. And you know, I mean, try to think of governing a billion and a half Jews.

caption: I am a doctor and was helping my white colleague apply a bandage to a patient’s face when the tape caught on my glove for a moment.  "Look at that,“ she joked to the patient, "I almost taped you to Dr. —.  You would’ve been running around with a small Asian woman stuck to you.”  Not only did she undermine my dignity in the patient’s eyes, but I was shocked that she felt the need to figure my race into this - not to mention that I’m 5'6" in work shoes and of proportionate weight.
quote: I am a doctor and was helping my white colleague apply a bandage to a patient’s face when the tape caught on my glove for a moment.  "Look at that,“ she joked to the patient, "I almost taped you to Dr. —.  You would’ve been running around with a small Asian woman stuck to you.”  Not only did she undermine my dignity in the patient’s eyes, but I was shocked that she felt the need to figure my race into this - not to mention that I’m 5'6" in work shoes and of proportionate weight.

caption: Apparently, while racism is unacceptable, ableism is A-OK.
At a holiday gathering, my uncle mentioned that in an old French comics the bad guys always wore turbans so you could identify them. My mother quickly chimed in that nothing had changed.
quote: At a holiday gathering, my uncle mentioned that in an old French comics the bad guys always wore turbans so you could identify them. My mother quickly chimed in that nothing had changed.

caption: I’m Jewish, but half-Jewish at the same time.  I identify primarily as Jewish. What does a Jew look like? Makes me feel stereotyped.
quote: “You don’t look Jewish.”
actual_quote: You don’t look Jewish.

caption: Someone’s status on Facebook.
quote: “If Rihanna likes the way it hurts, why did she leave Chris Brown?”
actual_quote: If Rihanna likes the way it hurts, why did she leave Chris Brown?

caption: Racial categories from a NYTimes article on interracial/interethnic marriages
quote: White, Black, Hispanic (white), Hispanic (black), Asian, American Indian

caption: “white winter catcall” - octopus pie, by meredith gran
I bring my grandfather’s cowboy hat to show and tell. My teacher says, “Wow, it looks like you’re about to go work in the field!” I am Mexican. My grandfather didn’t even work in a field.
quote: I bring my grandfather’s cowboy hat to show and tell. My teacher says, “Wow, it looks like you’re about to go work in the field!” I am Mexican. My grandfather didn’t even work in a field.

caption: In the first grade, I was put into ESL for being  too shy. I always wondered why I had to go to the extra classes with a handful of other Asian American children when I was reading at a higher level than my peers the previous year in kindergarten. California Bay Area: 1997-98. Made me confused.
quote: In the first grade, I was put into ESL for being  too shy. I always wondered why I had to go to the extra classes with a handful of other Asian American children when I was reading at a higher level than my peers the previous year in kindergarten. California Bay Area: 1997-98. Made me confused.

caption: I work up the courage to tell my father I’m asexual. He leans over the table at Panda Express and says in a very low, threatening voice, “People change.”
quote:
