I work up the courage to tell my father I’m asexual. He leans over the table at Panda Express and says in a very low, threatening voice, “People change.”
Fast food restaurant, age 14. Made me feel scared, frustrated, dismissed.

caption: Professor to me, one of two Asian students in my psychology class in Australia in 2010. Made me feel angry. I am not the Appointed Spokesperson.
quote: “But you’d know about that, wouldn’t you? Asian parents and overachievement and their focus on studies?”
actual_quote: But you’d know about that, wouldn’t you? Asian parents and overachievement and their focus on studies?

caption: chanelbeee:Get your share of racially stereotypical beauty products at your local Forever 21.
in the Weezer song “El Scorcho.” Made me feel singled out.
quote: “Goddamn you half-Japanese girls”
actual_quote: Goddamn you half-Japanese girls

caption: While I was at work a woman asked me  if my hair is real. I told her that it was and she gave me a compliment and I thanked her.  Just after I turned around to walk away, she pulled on it really hard to confirm that it was real. Unfortunately, this isn’t the first time something like this has happened and I know it isn’t going to be the last.
quote:
While I was at work a woman asked me  if my hair is real. I told her that it was and she gave me a compliment and I thanked her.  Just after I turned around to walk away, she pulled on it really hard to confirm that it was real. Unfortunately, this isn’t the first time something like this has happened and I know it isn’t going to be the last.
I am a 26 year-old mixed race female retail worker and it made me feel angry.

caption: My dad, who cannot understand my butch presentation.
quote: “I would rethink your profile picture. Employers look at facebook to screen candidates.”
actual_quote: I would rethink your profile picture. Employers look at facebook to screen candidates.

caption: “This is not an anti-gay movement of any kind. I would just like some equality.”
quote: Facebook Event: Straight Pride Day

caption: I’m fifteen and we’re in a group of our peers.  No one points out the racism. Someone rushes to help cover it up. It made me feel infuriated, invalidated.
quote: “Oh, you’ll get in anywhere you want. You got [high SAT score] and you’re black!”
actual_quote: Oh, you’ll get in anywhere you want. You got [high SAT score] and you’re black!

caption: Today, my roommate “explained” to me that the poor are only poor because they don’t work hard enough.
quote:
Today, my roommate “explained” to me that the poor are only poor because they don’t work hard enough.
I come from a lower class family who has worked harder than anyone I know. Made me feel hurt, upset, outraged.

caption: I’m at a party with my white boyfriend. His friend says to him: “Wow, it’s so great you’re dating an ETHNIC girl. How did you pull that off?” Worst part: I tell my boyfriend that the comment upset me. He doesn’t understand why because his friend is just “always” like that and I SHOULDN’T TAKE IT PERSONALLY.
quote: I’m at a party with my white boyfriend. His friend says to him: “Wow, it’s so great you’re dating an ETHNIC girl. How did you pull that off?” Worst part: I tell my boyfriend that the comment upset me. He doesn’t understand why because his friend is just “always” like that and I SHOULDN’T TAKE IT PERSONALLY.

caption: Facebook group
quote: “Im Offended That Black People Can Call White People Racial Names But Us White People Cant Call Them Racial Names Back Or Its ‘Discrimination’”
actual_quote: Im Offended That Black People Can Call White People Racial Names But Us White People Cant Call Them Racial Names Back Or Its ‘Discrimination’

caption: Older white couple at a performance of King Lear; the actor in question was a black man playing Albany. He spoke as “well” as all the other actors.
quote: “That actor speaks so well!”
actual_quote: That actor speaks so well!

caption: Today I had two male friends come over to my house. Whenever I started talking or laughing very loudly, my mom would tell me off for being that way. Later on when my friends left, my mom said to me, “Why are you so loud? Women are supposed to be lady-like and feminine, yet you act like a man.” Made me upset for the entire evening.
quote: Today I had two male friends come over to my house. Whenever I started talking or laughing very loudly, my mom would tell me off for being that way. Later on when my friends left, my mom said to me, “Why are you so loud? Women are supposed to be lady-like and feminine, yet you act like a man.” Made me upset for the entire evening.

caption: From Colorlines,You wouldn’t call someone a w*tback, or the n-word. Saying “illegals” is just as bad. The i-word creates an environment of hate by exploiting racial fear and economic anxiety, creating an easy scapegoat for complex issues, and OK-ing violence against those labeled with the word.

I’m waiting at the bus stop in front of my on-campus apartment. A Caucasian male in his 30’s/40’s approaches me and asks, “CAN YOU TELL ME HOW A GUY LIKE ME CAN GET A BEAUTIFUL CHINESE GIRL LIKE YOU?” and then proceeds to explain that he and his girlfriend of 3 years had broken up a month before and he is now ready to move on. First of all, I’m Korean-American. You can’t just clump all East Asians together and call them Chinese. Second, what did you expect from me after having told me your sob story? To go home with you? GET OUTTA HERE. I was offended, disgusted, mad.
quote: I’m waiting at the bus stop in front of my on-campus apartment. First of all, I’m Korean-American. You can’t just clump all East Asians together and call them Chinese. Second, what did you expect from me after having told me your sob story? To go home with you? GET OUTTA HERE. I was offended, disgusted, mad.

caption: Me: 26 and biracial, grew up in a predominantly white area. Boyfriend: 39 and white, grew up in mixed-race neighborhood. Made me feel angry, sad, frustrated, and speechless.
quote: “I’m just saying, I’m basically blacker than you.”
actual_quote: I’m just saying, I’m basically blacker than you.

caption: Reading the phrase, “women and minorities” or “people of color and women” over and over again in allegedly pro-feminist, anti-racist literature, as if being a woman and being a minority were somehow mutually exclusive.
quote: Reading the phrase, “women and minorities” or “people of color and women” over and over again in allegedly pro-feminist, anti-racist literature, as if being a woman and being a minority were somehow mutually exclusive.

caption: Another person who I barely knew deciding my gender identity for me. I was infuriated beyond words.
quote: “Cisgender people like you…”
actual_quote: Cisgender people like you…

caption: A classmate. My Cherokee grandmother was born and raised on a reservation. My uncle teaches Native American history classes.
quote: “Native Amerian Studies boils down to ‘kill whitey’.”
actual_quote: Native Amerian Studies boils down to ‘kill whitey’.

caption: My friend earlier today when ranting about a woman who HE DIDN’T THINK WAS DOING HER JOB PROPERLY.
quote: “And when I call her a bitch, I’m not being sexist. I call men bitches too.”
actual_quote: And when I call her a bitch, I’m not being sexist. I call men bitches too.

caption: Barbra Streisand explaining her presence at last night’s state dinner for Chinese president Hu Jintao. (via zuky)
quote: “I worked in a Chinese restaurant.”
actual_quote: I worked in a Chinese restaurant.

caption: While on a congressional campaign, three of my male colleagues and I were able to listen to former House Speaker Pelosi address all DCCC members a few days before the election. They mocked her words of encouragement, citing her as an abrasive female who was ruining our campaign. I was the only female in the office and I worked for a moderate Democrat.

They mocked her words of encouragement, citing her as an abrasive female who was ruining our campaign. I was the only female in the office and I worked for a moderate Democrat.

caption: I see Facebook statuses everywhere making fun of people with any mental illnesses; my wall is covered in the words “crazy,” “insane,” “unstable,” and “mental,” saying “all those people” shouldn’t be allowed in mainstream society.    I’m dealing with depression and anxiety, and I’m not emotionally stable all the time. Age 18, in the days following the Arizona shootings. Makes me feel ugly, wrong, unwanted, and defensive.

caption: I’m new to the Australia. Woman who’s training me for new job out of nowhere starts telling me about where I can get ribs and greens - you know, the foods my people like. I’m black, she’s white. I’m vegeterian. I tell my white boyfriend and he says, “She was  just trying to be helpful!”

caption: During track practice, we were doing push ups on the track and afterwards the hands of the boy next to me were stained red from the rubber. He turned to me, wiped his hands on his face and said in a fake accent, “Hello, my name is Sanjai, how can I help you with your computer today?" I’m partially South Asian.

caption: I’m walking to the entrance of a store when a car comes speeding my way, almost hitting me. The driver opens the door and screams, “THIS AIN’T YOUR COUNTRY, BITCH!" I was 14 years old, an Ecuadorian teenager actually born in the USA. The driver was an African American woman.

quote: “Of course she’ll get the nomination over me. She’s a minority.”
actual_quote: Of course she’ll get the nomination over me. She’s a minority.

caption: My white friend when describing her new boyfriend to her family: “Well he is black, but don’t worry, he’s not  that type of black guy - he is successful and educated.” No one else even thought this was remotely offensive and I was told to stop being too sensitive when it upset me.

caption: A former roommate. My boyfriend and I are both queer femmes in an opposite-gender relationship. Made me feel angry, confused, & defensive.
quote: “He’s your boyfriend? He’s so girly, I thought he was, like, your gay best friend.”
actual_quote: He’s your boyfriend? He’s so girly, I thought he was, like, your gay best friend.

caption: My Northern, private school roommate commenting on the fact that I’m from the South. Made me feel hurt, misunderstood, bitter.
quote: “God, when I got the email saying you would be my roommate I was so worried you would be stupid and racist or something, but you totally aren’t.”

caption: Just featured on Feministing. Thanks! Still thrilled by the reception we’ve gotten.

caption: I’m South Asian and go by ‘Sam’. When I introduced myself to a white man at a party, he asked me what Sam was 'short for’. When I replied 'Samantha’, he told me that he was expecting something more interesting.

caption: I work as an usher at an events arena where they were having Cirque du Soleil.  An older white woman asked, “Can you tell if those are Orientals up there? They’re all so little like Orientals. You can tell our guys because they are big and muscular.”
quote: I work as an usher at an events arena where they were having Cirque du Soleil.  An older white woman asked, “Can you tell if those are Orientals up there? They’re all so little like Orientals. You can tell our guys because they are big and muscular.”
“He’s been working like a nigger all week. What? I’m saying that they work hard, how can that be racist?”
actual_quote: He’s been working like a nigger all week. What? I’m saying that they work hard, how can that be racist?

caption: A Christmas gift from (and drawn by) my partner's nine-year-old cousin. Made me feel angry and sad at how ingrained body-policing and fat-shaming is.

In a 2007 National Geographic photo book called “Inside China”, where five out of six authors are white. Made me feel annoyed as a Chinese person - enough of this stereotyping and essentialism already.
quote: “There is no question that the Chinese will keep working hard. Hard work is in their genes.”
actual_quote: There is no question that the Chinese will keep working hard. Hard work is in their genes.

caption: After preaching about violence, misogyny, and hate crimes at my church the day after the mass shooting in Tucson, a white man who was serving with me at church told me: 1. Black people can’t say they have “slave names” because they were never slaves themselves. 2. What I really needed to preach about was how white men are blamed for everything.
quote:
After preaching about violence, misogyny, and hate crimes at my church the day after the mass shooting in Tucson, a white man who was serving with me at church told me: 1. Black people can’t say they have “slave names” because they were never slaves themselves. 2. What I really needed to preach about was how white men are blamed for everything.
This is a man who literally purchased a wife from Ukraine. I’m a young queer female priest and he’s an older bigger straight white man.  In a white suburban Episcopal Church. Made me feel frustrated, furious and threatened - he’s a foot taller and a lot heavier than I am, and we were in a pretty small space (the sacristy).

caption: The thing I hate the most about Microaggressions is the fact that it reminds me of the oppression I feel on a daily basis. So when all of my white friends say, “You are being over-sensitive” or “racism is over” or “we aren’t sexist, it’s just a joke” or my favorite, “chill out, you know we love you," I won’t feel absolutely crazy, because I definitely don’t feel alone.

Whenever my girlfriend and I go out holding hands, we’re leered at, catcalled, or occasionally followed around by men asking us for a “hot bisexual threesome.”

Whenever my girlfriend and I go out holding hands, we’re leered at, catcalled, or occasionally followed around by men asking us for a “hot bisexual threesome.”
I hate being objectified and fetishized because I’m a lesbian.  I hate feeling like I somehow invited it by being affectionate in public with the woman I love.

caption: A submission we received:
quote:
A submission we received:
I know that this blog is dedicated to microaggressions, but I wanted to suggest the possibility of starting a blog of…I don’t know if there’s a word…Micro-supports? You know, the little things that people do, sometimes, but not always, without thinking, that make us feel safe, and generally better, and help up retain our faith in humanity.Thoughts?
Please feel free to use the commenting function on this post to organize if you are interested!

caption: We’ve opened up a comment/discussion space for each “microaggression.” Please feel free to ask questions & share why an entry may/not resonate with you - just click on the speech bubble icon on the bottom of each post. Thanks!

caption: White friend: “Hey, look! We’re in a car full of foreigners!” Out of the three minorities, one person emigrated from Europe when he was 9. Me and the other person are Asian-Americans. Everyone in the car is aware of this.White friend (trying to make it better): “Well, we were all foreigners at one point…”
quote:
White friend: “Hey, look! We’re in a car full of foreigners!” Out of the three minorities, one person emigrated from Europe when he was 9. Me and the other person are Asian-Americans. Everyone in the car is aware of this.White friend (trying to make it better): “Well, we were all foreigners at one point…”
Her assumption that “minority = foreign” made me feel resigned to being an outsider. Her immediate reaction—making an excuse, instead of apologizing—made me feel worse.

caption: Dear readers,
quote:
Dear readers,
From the very beginning, we’ve wanted a space where we can educate each other about the subtle ways in which power and privilege are enacted in our lives.  That’s why we’re opening comments for every post.
To make a comment, click the speech bubble at the bottom of every post.
So start talking to one another. We will moderate, and depending on the frequency of trolling, we may change some settings. But for now, it looks like you’re all really nice people.
Love, Microaggressions

caption: Pretty much any time I leave the house in my wheelchair and go to a public place, people feel entitled to come up and ask me the most intrusive personal questions. On a weekly basis, someone asks me: “What’s wrong with you?” People frequently talk over my head to my friends or family members like I am mentally impaired. Many people have told me that they can relate to my disability because they were on crutches for several weeks with a sprained ankle or broken leg.
quote:
Pretty much any time I leave the house in my wheelchair and go to a public place, people feel entitled to come up and ask me the most intrusive personal questions. On a weekly basis, someone asks me: “What’s wrong with you?” People frequently talk over my head to my friends or family members like I am mentally impaired. Many people have told me that they can relate to my disability because they were on crutches for several weeks with a sprained ankle or broken leg.
I’m 27 years-old and the comments are always the worst in big cities and on public transportation. These interactions make me feel anxious, frustrated, angry, and sad.

quote:

Many people have told me that they can relate to my disability because they were on crutches for several weeks with a sprained ankle or broken leg.
I’m 27 years-old and the comments are always the worst in big cities and on public transportation. These interactions make me feel anxious, frustrated, angry, and sad.

caption: I sought treatment for depression during my junior year at an Ivy League school. My off-campus therapist suggested that I transfer to a community college because he had a hard time “imagining me on that campus”, and the community college would have “more people like me”. I had a 3.7 GPA at the time, and never had any trouble academically. I am also an immigrant from Latin America.

caption: Yeah, we’ve gotten a lot of comments about it. Winter break project number one, I think.
quote: I use the same theme that you guys use and have gotten the same comment re: the follow button. I suspect it's something in the theme's code that sometimes doesn't display well.

caption: According to a user,
quote:
According to a user,
I think your layout header thing is blocking the follow button. i had to do a lot of maneuvering to follow you!
… and another,
Hi, I had the same problem trying to find the follow button. It is there on Chrome, but the ‘inspire well’ theme bar sets itself overtop it; I think there’s something up with the coding. I was able to see it in the html on Chrome, but I couldn’t find a way to click it… I had to use internet explorer to do it. For some reason, when I open your page in IE, the theme bar moves to the bottom and then the follow button is easily viewable.
… and last but not least:
The follow button has a tendency to disappear on a lot of people’s pages. You can still use it, it just won’t be visible. If you hover your mouse over the upper right hand corner of the page, you can still click on it so long as your mouse icon indicates you can (and your browser doesn’t tell you the link leads to your dash, of course). It’s what I had to do and yeah it works. Hopefully it’ll be fixed soon (like anything on tumblr?).
Hope this helps! We’re looking to get a domain sometime in the near future and get it right, but until then we hope this issue doesn’t keep you from sharing this site with your folks this holiday season.

caption: In response to concerns about the everyday racism symptomatic of white privilege in my department, and academic colleague replied to me:  It is not your responsibility as a woman of color to educate white people about issues of race, but if you don’t bring these problems to our attention then it is not our responsibility to address them.

caption: During my freshman year of high school, the administrators pulled all of the Asian kids out of class and made us take an English proficiency test. caption: Me (Asian American, first generation, low income student): It’s not like I can just call my parents and ask to get a job from one of their friends.
quote:
Me (Asian American, first generation, low income student): It’s not like I can just call my parents and ask to get a job from one of their friends.
Privileged white guy: Well, if you stopped complaining and just worked harder, you wouldn’t be in this situation, now would you?
A dorm conversation at a rural public university known for hippies, pot, and liberalism. 2008. Made me feel alienated & alone.

caption: “You speak English so well,” said the helpful white boy at the science fair.
quote:
“You speak English so well,” said the helpful white boy at the science fair.
“It’s my fucking first language,” I wanted to say. (Except I was representing my institution and couldn’t.)
I live in a country which the British occupied for 200 years. Our administrative language is English. I’ve hardly used any language but.
Yellow girls can’t speak English.
“It was a compliment.” He sounded aggrieved.

quote: “She had a right to feel scared of you. How could a person not be scared of Arabs after 9/11?”

actual_quote: “If Asian women could stop kissing ass to white men for a moment and get in touch with their Asian community, then maybe they’ll get acknowledged as something other than "honorary white women”. Because as it stands, that’s how you are seen.“

caption: The day after a party I ran into the host and she said, “My husband absolutely loved you, he said you broke all the stereotypes!”  This party was hosted by the department chair of a college program and I was the only Native American person there.
quote: The day after a party I ran into the host and she said, “My husband absolutely loved you, he said you broke all the stereotypes!”  This party was hosted by the department chair of a college program and I was the only Native American person there.

caption: Man on the street, shortly after I came out as a trans guy.
quote: “You know, you’re a very beautiful young lady. I thought you were a guy at first! You should grow your hair long! It would look a lot better.”
actual_quote: You know, you’re a very beautiful young lady. I thought you were a guy at first! You should grow your hair long! It would look a lot better.

caption: 60-year-old white female therapist as I’m talking about the experience I’ve faced as an Asian (Chinese) American.
quote: “You’re always talking about racism, but I just don’t see its impacts on you. You’re not thinking globally. There are 3.2 billion Chinese people in the world. You are actually the majority. And you could choose to move to China.”
actual_quote: You’re always talking about racism, but I just don’t see its impacts on you. You’re not thinking globally. There are 3.2 billion Chinese people in the world. You are actually the majority. And you could choose to move to China.

caption: My Spanish professor
quote: “You want to say ‘mi novia’. If you say 'mi novio’ it sounds like you have a boyfriend.”
actual_quote: You want to say ‘mi novia’. If you say 'mi novio’ it sounds like you have a boyfriend.

caption: When I argue about international affairs or  critique US policy, it’s often met with a “you know, if you went back to Pakistan or wherever you’re from, you wouldn’t even have the right to complain.” I’m an Arab-American woman. I was born in the States. I shake my head and point out that US intervention leads to repressive regimes in the Middle East.
quote: When I argue about international affairs or  critique US policy, it’s often met with a “you know, if you went back to Pakistan or wherever you’re from, you wouldn’t even have the right to complain.” I’m an Arab-American woman. I was born in the States. I shake my head and point out that US intervention leads to repressive regimes in the Middle East.

caption: Man at the bus stop. I am an Asian American woman. I was reading Jane Austen. In English.
quote: “Excuse me, do you speak English?”
actual_quote: Excuse me, do you speak English?

quote: “If you’re not into tits and ass, you’re a homo. End of story.”
actual_quote: If you’re not into tits and ass, you’re a homo. End of story.

caption: At Pride Community Center meeting, where I was being introduced to the group. Apparently, I’m the only black lesbian around. The guy who said it is our community center’s political action chair.
quote: “Most of the white people around here have never met a black person like you. You know, educated, well-spoken, etc.”
actual_quote: Most of the white people around here have never met a black person like you. You know, educated, well-spoken, etc.

caption: Every single book or documentary presented to me that persistently refers to indigenous North American people in the  past tense.
quote: Every single book or documentary presented to me that persistently refers to indigenous North American people in the  past tense.

caption: Old Navy: “Now I can tell them apart.”
Vice principal to a group of students 97% African American going on a field trip. Made me feel shocked.
quote: “Remember, you’re representing your race today.”
actual_quote: Remember, you’re representing your race today.

caption: Every morning, current job, older male coworker to me.
quote: “Heyyyyy little girl!”
actual_quote: Heyyyyy little girl!

caption: Every morning, Current job, older male coworker to me.
quote: “Heyyyyy Little Girl!”
actual_quote: Heyyyyy Little Girl!

caption: Several people, some of them gay or lesbian, to me, a trans person, often when I haven’t disclosed.
quote: “Yeah, you can always tell, though.”
actual_quote: Yeah, you can always tell, though.

caption: a guy at trivia night at my local bar.
quote: “I’m fine with gay people, I just don’t understand why gay guys have to be so flaming.”
actual_quote: I’m fine with gay people, I just don’t understand why gay guys have to be so flaming.

caption: When I was a   doctoral physics student, my advisor consistently asked me (the only woman in our group) to handle administrative tasks and run errands for him.
quote: When I was a   doctoral physics student, my advisor consistently asked me (the only woman in our group) to handle administrative tasks and run errands for him.

caption: White male TA in my Islam class
quote: “But I wonder what kind of Islam he believes in, since he’s African American.  Where is he even learning about Islam?  Maybe he’s some kind of ‘black Muslim.’”
actual_quote: But I wonder what kind of Islam he believes in, since he’s African American.  Where is he even learning about Islam?  Maybe he’s some kind of ‘black Muslim.’

caption: In kindergarten, we did a Christmas play with stereotypical Santas from around the world.  Being the only Asian, I was given the role of Japanese Santa, for which I had to borrow a taekwondo outfit from a white kid.
quote: In kindergarten, we did a Christmas play with stereotypical Santas from around the world.  Being the only Asian, I was given the role of Japanese Santa, for which I had to borrow a taekwondo outfit from a white kid.

caption: I’m black, and my name consists of four words  that could easily be common first names. So of course I’ve been told,  by people who read my name before they met me, “Wow, I really wasn’t  expecting a black person, I have to say.” No, you didn’t have to say,  thanks.
quote:
I’m black, and my name consists of four words  that could easily be common first names. So of course I’ve been told,  by people who read my name before they met me, “Wow, I really wasn’t  expecting a black person, I have to say.” No, you didn’t have to say,  thanks.
- most notably, it happened 4 years ago in an interview

caption: My psychologist constantly refers to my girlfriend of over 2 years as my friend, despite being corrected.
quote: My psychologist constantly refers to my girlfriend of over 2 years as my friend, despite being corrected.

caption: I was a student at UC Davis, and my first English teacher wrote this on my paper.
quote: “A+  this is really good for a Latina.”
actual_quote: A+  this is really good for a Latina.

quote: “Well, the difference between Canada and the US is that in the US we just killed them all, so we don’t have to deal with them anymore.”
actual_quote: Well, the difference between Canada and the US is that in the US we just killed them all, so we don’t have to deal with them anymore.

quote: “Your son doesn’t look Asian at all. Isn’t that funny. Your blood must dilute easily. Well, at least he looks like your husband.”
actual_quote: Your son doesn’t look Asian at all. Isn’t that funny. Your blood must dilute easily. Well, at least he looks like your husband.

caption: Friend of a friend to me (the only black woman at the table)  while having lunch: “You’re vegetarian? So that means you don’t even eat chicken?” The other people around the table laughed and told me to “lighten up”.
quote: Friend of a friend to me (the only black woman at the table)  while having lunch: “You’re vegetarian? So that means you don’t even eat chicken?” The other people around the table laughed and told me to “lighten up”.

caption: Friend says black people who went to Ivy League schools “aren’t really black.”
quote: Friend says black people who went to Ivy League schools “aren’t really black.”

quote: “Wow, you are really good at your job! You are great. When they hired you I was so angry because I assumed you were a token, but you are actually very good!”
actual_quote: Wow, you are really good at your job! You are great. When they hired you I was so angry because I assumed you were a token, but you are actually very good!

quote: “There’s no such thing as white male privilege. That’s something that was invented in the 60’s by liberal feminists.”
actual_quote: There’s no such thing as white male privilege. That’s something that was invented in the 60’s by liberal feminists.

caption: My ex-boyfriend to me at a Halloween party
quote: “You can’t be Alice in Wonderland. You’re not white.”
actual_quote: You can’t be Alice in Wonderland. You’re not white.

caption: The company vice president visited today. He had in depth conversations with every male employee, but did not even greet the female employees.
quote: The company vice president visited today. He had in depth conversations with every male employee, but did not even greet the female employees.

caption: White woman I’ve never met to me, a black woman she’s never met, in a vegan soul food restaurant in Baltimore, where we are both eating with our respective partners.
quote: “Could you get me some water?”
actual_quote: Could you get me some water?

caption: My white, middle-aged boss will only date very young (19-24 years) Asian women, and “jokingly” asks me to get the phone numbers of any I come into contact with. Since I work for a small, male-dominated company and because I’m easily replaceable, I feel like telling him enough is enough will threaten my position. However, not speaking up makes me ashamed of myself.

quote: “Wow, you don’t sound Asian on the phone!”
actual_quote: Wow, you don’t sound Asian on the phone!

quote: “Why don’t you use your own bathroom?”
actual_quote: Why don’t you use your own bathroom?

quote: “I’m just not into [your race here] girls/guys. Sorry.”
actual_quote: I’m just not into [your race here] girls/guys. Sorry.

caption: Two high school sophomores chatting loudly on the train ride home. Overheard by a 16 year old.
quote: “My mom said this neighborhood is going downhill so we might move. There are so many Indians and Black people here now. God, where are they coming from? This place is becoming like a slum.”
actual_quote: My mom said this neighborhood is going downhill so we might move. There are so many Indians and Black people here now. God, where are they coming from? This place is becoming like a slum.

quote: “If you don’t like being reminded of sexism, just ignore it.”
actual_quote: If you don’t like being reminded of sexism, just ignore it.

caption: Whenever I stand fairly motionless in a big store (usually off in iPod-land), someone will invariably come up to me and assume I’m an employee rather than a customer. They start asking where things are or how to find something, regardless of the fact that - at a place like Best Buy - I am in no way dressed in clothing that resembles their uniform. But as a black man, I must be there to serve them, right?
quote: Whenever I stand fairly motionless in a big store (usually off in iPod-land), someone will invariably come up to me and assume I’m an employee rather than a customer. They start asking where things are or how to find something, regardless of the fact that - at a place like Best Buy - I am in no way dressed in clothing that resembles their uniform. caption: Customer: Where do you keep the black people music?Me: What?  Wh… black people music?Customer: Yes, the music by black people!Me: Is there an artist you’re looking for?  We have music by black people in every section of the store…Customer: Just show me where the rap section is.She was looking for Ella Fitzgerald.
quote: Customer: Where do you keep the black people music?Me: What?  Wh… black people music?Customer: Yes, the music by black people!Me: Is there an artist you’re looking for?  We have music by black people in every section of the store…Customer: Just show me where the rap section is.She was looking for Ella Fitzgerald.

caption: Friend
quote: “Ohmygawd, you’re totally not what people think of when they think of muslim women. you’re so… cool!”
actual_quote: Ohmygawd, you’re totally not what people think of when they think of muslim women. you’re so… cool!

caption: Graduate from Georgetown University.
quote: “I think black people have more tattoos than white people, because I associate tattoos with gangs.”
actual_quote: I think black people have more tattoos than white people, because I associate tattoos with gangs.

caption: More often than not, when I’m at a straight bar with the girl I’m dating, guys stare whenever we hold hands and even cheer whenever we kiss or show affection.
quote:
More often than not, when I’m at a straight bar with the girl I’m dating, guys stare whenever we hold hands and even cheer whenever we kiss or show affection.
The worst is when guys think that there is something missing in our relationship and that they have the solution. Yes, we can fuck without your dick and no, we’re not interested in a threesome… Now if you’d be so kind as to leave me the hell alone so I can kiss my hot date.
“What do you mean, you don’t celebrate Christmas? It’s for everyone!”
actual_quote: What do you mean, you don’t celebrate Christmas? It’s for everyone!

caption: At a party, the white host called the only black guest a n***** and explained that it wasn’t offensive because he didn’t mean it as an insult.
quote: At a party, the white host called the only black guest a n***** and explained that it wasn’t offensive because he didn’t mean it as an insult.

caption: Older co-worker: How can you be the president of the PRIDE club, aren’t you straight?Me: I’m not.Older co-worker: Not the president?Me: I’m not straight.Older co-worker: No…. You’re straight, you have a boyfriend!
quote:
Older co-worker: How can you be the president of the PRIDE club, aren’t you straight?Me: I’m not.Older co-worker: Not the president?Me: I’m not straight.Older co-worker: No…. You’re straight, you have a boyfriend!
Made me feel upset and ignored.  Why wouldn’t I know my own sexuality?

caption: My hair is in microbraids and little old white women think it’s just fine to pet my hair while in line at the grocery store.
quote: My hair is in microbraids and little old white women think it’s just fine to pet my hair while in line at the grocery store.

caption: My dad, trying to convince me not to be transgender
quote: “You could face a lot of discrimination if you decide to do this.”
actual_quote: You could face a lot of discrimination if you decide to do this.

caption: In high school, during an SAT prep class:
quote:
In high school, during an SAT prep class:
“You shouldn’t have a problem getting into Berkeley. You’re a minority.”
Said to me, a black/Korean girl, by a full Korean girl. Later, that same class period:
“I went to Berkeley during the days of affirmative action. A lot of clowns got in.”
Said to me by the full Korean SAT math teacher.

caption: The follow button should always be on the top right, unless you’re using an iPad. The reblog and like buttons are on the page of the post, accessible by clicking the link of the time it was posted.
quote: I'm having a super hard time finding the follow and reblog buttons on this theme. Help?

caption: My coworker, a first year college student
quote: “It’s not like that with lesbians though, you can pretty much tell them on sight.”
actual_quote: It’s not like that with lesbians though, you can pretty much tell them on sight.

caption: My husband says that the race issues I encounter don’t count because Asians don’t suffer discrimination.
quote: My husband says that the race issues I encounter don’t count because Asians don’t suffer discrimination.

caption: Leering man who followed me around Penn Station for 10 minutes after making this lewd remark.
quote: “Big titties.”
actual_quote: Big titties.

quote: Several male doctors insisted my debilitating health problems were all in my head – before I learned that I have a very real and treatable autoimmune disease.

caption: Mom: What’s your husband’s social security number?Me: I don’t know. Why?Mom: We should do a background check to see if he’s an illegal immigrant.
quote:
Mom: What’s your husband’s social security number?Me: I don’t know. Why?Mom: We should do a background check to see if he’s an illegal immigrant.
My husband is Mexican-American and was born in Georgia. At Thanksgiving.

caption: At least four times this year, though I’ve been working at the university since 2008.  I TEACH ANTHROPOLOGY AND SPECIALIZE IN THE US, but I happen to be of South Asian heritage.
quote: “You must be the new Arabic teacher!”
actual_quote: You must be the new Arabic teacher!

caption: (ex)Friend: I’m such a bad liberal. I don’t have any brown friends.Me: Excuse me? Native American, right over here. (ex)Friend: You don’t count, ‘cause you don’t look Indian and people can’t tell.
quote:
(ex)Friend: I’m such a bad liberal. I don’t have any brown friends.Me: Excuse me? Native American, right over here. (ex)Friend: You don’t count, ‘cause you don’t look Indian and people can’t tell.
at a liberal arts college. made me feel angry, hurt, invisible

caption: My male American History teacher to a female student
quote: “We would put you back in our ribs if we could.”
actual_quote: We would put you back in our ribs if we could.

caption: A random guy on the street who has just gotten in my face
quote: “How ‘bout a smile, sweetheart!”
actual_quote: How ‘bout a smile, sweetheart!

quote: A man I’ve worked with tells my friend I’m the best female writer he knows.

quote: “I CAN TOTALLY CALL THEM THAT BECAUSE THEY FIT EVERY STEREOTYPE.”
actual_quote: I CAN TOTALLY CALL THEM THAT BECAUSE THEY FIT EVERY STEREOTYPE.

caption: Sitting at a bar chatting with my friend, a guy walks up to us, bows, and says “Konichiwa.” When I say “Excuse me?”, he says it again, louder so we can understand him. We’re Filipina.

quote: My aunt asks me if I have a boyfriend yet without considering I might want a girlfriend.

actual_quote: YOU’RE SO ARTICULATE… AND BEAUTIFUL IN AN EXOTIC WAY, EVEN THOUGH YOU’RE DARK…

quote: “MAYBE IF YOU STOPPED FOCUSING ON WHY YOU THINK IT’S HARDER BEING A WOMAN, YOU COULD JUST FOCUS ON BEING SUCCESSFUL”
actual_quote: MAYBE IF YOU STOPPED FOCUSING ON WHY YOU THINK IT’S HARDER BEING A WOMAN, YOU COULD JUST FOCUS ON BEING SUCCESSFUL

quote: “WOW, YOU’RE REALLY RACE ANGRY, AREN’T YOU?”
actual_quote: WOW, YOU’RE REALLY RACE ANGRY, AREN’T YOU?

quote: ““[…]something like the feeling of "over-kill.”  The tone could not sustain my patience, and turned a bit pedantic, whiney, and self-important[…]“”
actual_quote: “[…]something like the feeling of "over-kill.”  The tone could not sustain my patience, and turned a bit pedantic, whiney, and self-important[…]“

caption: I briefly worked as a telemarketer in late 90’s and had a man repeatedly tell over the phone that I was “difficult to understand and sounded like one of those Jew folks.” He then proceeded to ask me if I was “one of those Jews.” I ended the conversation and marked it on the computer as incomplete due to language barrier.
quote: I briefly worked as a telemarketer in late 90’s and had a man repeatedly tell over the phone that I was “difficult to understand and sounded like one of those Jew folks.” He then proceeded to ask me if I was “one of those Jews.” I ended the conversation and marked it on the computer as incomplete due to language barrier.

caption: Racialicious | “More Than a Meme: Microaggressions Offers a Safe Space for Sharing Short, Painful Stories”
quote:
Racialicious | “More Than a Meme: Microaggressions Offers a Safe Space for Sharing Short, Painful Stories”
* we’ve changed the entry form to include more about the CONTEXT of the quotes & the impact on the person hearing/receiving the comment. thank you readers for feedback!
* we are also looking into ways to open up a discussion/forum option for each comment to increase conversation about different microaggression submissions. for now, we’re depending on people reblogging & discussing the issues through other venues.
* take a few seconds to recommend us to the tumblr directory for politics by clicking here.
with love, microaggressions project

quote: “WELL, IT’S OBVIOUS THAT YOU MUST BE PUTTING OUT. WHY WOULD A NICE, FAIR-SKINNED GUY WANT TO TALK TO SOMEONE AS BLACK AS YOU ARE? YOU’VE DONE WELL!”
actual_quote: WELL, IT’S OBVIOUS THAT YOU MUST BE PUTTING OUT. WHY WOULD A NICE, FAIR-SKINNED GUY WANT TO TALK TO SOMEONE AS BLACK AS YOU ARE? YOU’VE DONE WELL!

quote: “‘Women are traps,’ Kafka said once, ‘which lie in wait for men everywhere, in order to drag them down into the Finite.’ It’s a perfectly ordinary expression of misogyny, dispiriting in a mind that more often took the less-traveled path.”

caption: After telling a girl I just met about the time a man pulled my Star of David off me and threw it in the gutter during the Israel-Lebanon war, she responded, “you should have known he would be offended by that symbol during that time, it’s basically your own fault.”
quote: After telling a girl I just met about the time a man pulled my Star of David off me and threw it in the gutter during the Israel-Lebanon war, she responded, “you should have known he would be offended by that symbol during that time, it’s basically your own fault.”

quote: “Maybe, like, in different countries, but we don’t need feminism in North America. I mean like, we’re equal so don’t be selfish.”
actual_quote: Maybe, like, in different countries, but we don’t need feminism in North America. I mean like, we’re equal so don’t be selfish.

quote: A white lecturer (who is a practicing psychologist) assumes that an Asian client married to a white man must be a mail order bride. I call her out in the class. actual_quote: Wow, from talking to you on the phone, I’d never know that you were a fat girl. You don’t sound fat at all.

quote: “You speak so well. You don’t sound like other black girls.”
actual_quote: You speak so well. You don’t sound like other black girls.

quote: Friend online about the Microaggressions project: “kim jong [il] prob gets microaggressions like "i hate petty dictators" ever thought of that?”

caption: Someone born in America
quote: “So, do you feel more Asian or American?”
actual_quote: So, do you feel more Asian or American?

caption: While at the laundromat, a white man and white woman are having a conversation about immigration. The white man turns to me and asks me where I am from. I say, “from the United States.” He says, “No, where are you really from.” I concede  and respond “Africa.” He then asks where in Africa I’m from. As a descendant of slaves I don’t know where, so I say “I don’t know.” The white man shakes his head disapprovingly then says,  “Someone doesn’t know their history.”
quote: While at the laundromat, a white man and white woman are having a conversation about immigration. The white man turns to me and asks me where I am from. I say, “from the United States.” He says, “No, where are you really from.” I concede  and respond “Africa.” He then asks where in Africa I’m from. As a descendant of slaves I don’t know where, so I say “I don’t know.” The white man shakes his head disapprovingly then says,  “Someone doesn’t know their history.”

caption: yearbook comment from a high school friend
quote: “Have a good life, to a good but fat kid!”
actual_quote: Have a good life, to a good but fat kid!

caption: at a dinner party where i’m the only person of color
quote: “YOU SHOULD JUST CALM DOWN AND GET OFF YOUR SOAP BOX. WE’RE ALL JUST TRYING TO HAVE FUN”
actual_quote: YOU SHOULD JUST CALM DOWN AND GET OFF YOUR SOAP BOX. WE’RE ALL JUST TRYING TO HAVE FUN

caption: My boss, when I described how my mental illness made the concept of functional adulthood seem impossible.
quote: “You’d make a good possession.”
actual_quote: You’d make a good possession.

caption: Really, Regis?! (at 3:40)

quote: “I know you have to be worried all the time about being raped, even on campus, but as a man I could still be mugged or something. So don’t tell me I don’t understand, I hate that!”

caption: During the Oka Crisis of 1990 in Quebec when the Mohawks of Kanehsatake, along with other First Nation allies, barricaded a highway to protest Oka City Council plans to develop their burial grounds into a golf course, a bunch of us workers - all white - are having a beer after a long day. We discuss the crisis, then unfolding, between the Indians and the provincial police. One of the guys says, “Fucking people - why don’t they all just go back to India?” We all just stare at him, dumbfounded.
quote: During the Oka Crisis of 1990 in Quebec when the Mohawks of Kanehsatake, along with other First Nation allies, barricaded a highway to protest Oka City Council plans to develop their burial grounds into a golf course, a bunch of us workers - all white - are having a beer after a long day. We discuss the crisis, then unfolding, between the Indians and the provincial police. One of the guys says, “Fucking people - why don’t they all just go back to India?” We all just stare at him, dumbfounded.

caption: This tumblr is looking really text-y. We would love photo submissions! You know there is that one sign or poster in your neighborhood/campus that annoys you.Artistic liberty can be liberating. We would love drawings, collages and illustrations of your microanecdotes. If you would like to try your hand at illustrating a microanecdote, email us!We have 258 followers, a number growing by the hour! Truly exciting. Share, share, share the love!
